Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: YiiYng
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents in for my mother's birthday and the hotel was just so nice about it. They sent my mother a cake and were really friendly. Really made it a special time for her. There are nice hotels but its the service that really makes the difference and gives them an edge over the rest! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best service!! Top notch staff.”
Reviews.Author: bonbons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for a night, which was a total disappointment considering the high price and low staff/guest ratio. We booked Ritz Carlton for a family trip and the service was amazing the second you arrive. The staff greeted us with personal attention, kept us comfortable during the check in process, which was speedy compared to Sands. Rooms were clean and spacious, had a cozy seating area for relaxation at the end of the day. The views from the bathroom tub was amazing. One thing that could be updated is the hairdryer, which was a bit dated. Breakfast selection and staff at the omelet and waffle stations were very professional, food was excellent at the pool area too. Hotel manager Lance was superb and 100% attentive to detail even after we left and discovered some billing error. He responded right away to our inquiry and followed up every detail. Concierge service may need more staffing as our questions regarding Sentosa venues were not addressed correctly. The person on duty didn't seem like the usual concierge, so it could be just a one time thing. All in all a highly trained staff and kudos to the team at Ritz Millenia Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better properties in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: eton1970
Reviews.Content: Overall comprehensive 5 star property. Excellent and large rooms with very good bathrooms and space utilization. Gym is large as is pool area. Good conference facilities with excellent staff. Very pleasant and well maintained property. Some things to keep in mind: though a Ritz, they are one of the few Ritz properties not to participate in the rewards program. Unless you have a corporate rate, prices can be high, approaching 500US for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great afternoon tea”
Reviews.Author: globetraveller32
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after reading great review. Overall was a delightful experience. Loved the afternoon tea served at the lounge. It would be perfect if Internet is offered at no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best”
Reviews.Author: Roger1128
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. The attention to detail is terrific and the staff could not have been more helpful. Views are great and the location is spot on. If you can afford it, it is well worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very over priced”
Reviews.Author: aandlinphx
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Singapore for a week long business trip and stayed at both the Marina Bay Sands and the Ritz. The room at the Ritz was very nice, I had a great view overlooking the bay and it was very spacious. The service was attentive but they could have used a few more people behind the check in desk as opposed to wandering around offering help. The breakfast was a slight bit better than most but at $50 SGD it's ridiculous. I hate paying for wi-fi at hotels and at $30 SGD/day that is ridiculous as well. There is a covered walkway out the side entrance to the hotel that takes you straight into a very nice food court at the adjacent mall. The Ritz was definitely more relaxed and quiet than the MBS but lacked the choice of restaurants and the pool at the MBS was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Buenisimo”
Reviews.Author: Shragaus
Reviews.Content: Beautifull, excellent Service, super view from rooms, very well located, a super choice for Singapore, dont miss tea at the lobby, with spanish music

Reviews.Title: “staycation at Ritz Carlton for birthday”
Reviews.Author: mkw-sg
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of Ritz's birthday package to celebrate my daughter's first birthday over a Saturday night. Package comes with free upgrade to premier suite, breakfast, birthday ammenities and late check out for $495 including taxes. Having stayed at Pan Pacific a few weeks ago at half the price i had high expectations for Ritz given their reputation. They passed the tests with flying colours in terms of their service and the rooms and location but there are still some small areas which can still be improved to make it a perfect stay. LOCATION: Ritz Carlton probably have the best view amongst all the hotels in the marina area. They have unblocked view of the flyer, Sea and the marina bay sands. I stayed on the 27th floor and had a gorgeous view of the marina bay sands from the living room and the flyer from the bathtub. In terms of convenience they are conected to Marina square and Millenia walk, Suntec and a short walk via the underpass to the Cityhall MRT and circle line. This means that u have access to shopping, restaurants and train service connected to the hotel without having to worry about the weather. Full marks for location defintely! RESERVATION/CHECK IN: Booking the room was a breeze from the website. They had options for us to select most of the things that we needed like early checkin, cribs, high floor, king bed and non smoking rooms. There was no queue at the checkin counter and all our requests were taken care of which is great! There's even free flow of drinks at the lobby for guests which shows that Ritz take cares of the little things that makes guest feel at home. ROOM: We had a premier suite for our stay as part of the birthday package. This is definitely the highlight of our stay. The views of the room were gorgeous! We had amazing views of the flyer, Marina bay sands resort and the entire marina bay from our room, bath and the living room. The room were well designed and very clean. We really like the huge bathroom which had seperate shower, WC and bath plus two seperate sinks and even a walk in wardrobe. One thing that i am very impressed is the sound proofing of the rooms. This is probably the only hotel which i've stayed where the rooms were completely noise free! Maybe there's nobody staying beside, on top or below our room but there's definitely no noise. Like i said at the beginning everything about Ritz is probably perfect but there's some small things that can be improved to make it the perfect experience. One of them is the wooden flooring which at some location seems to be slightly damaged. The other is the fact that they do not have a guest information booklet that provides information on the room and how to use it. Most other hotels have such a handbook to guide the guests on how to get connected to the wireless internet, use the motorized blinds, inform them of the menu available for inroom dining etc. While there is a booklet on in room dining and breakfast and a card which instructs the guests on how the nespresso machine works there is nothing which tells me where the controls for the blinds are located and what are the programs that are showing in the tv channels. Apart from the lack of information on the gadgets i would say that the room is awesome. BREAKFAST: We had buffet breakfast at the greenhouse as aprt of the package. There was a short queue to get a seat but the wait was just a minute and we were brought to a table. First impression was that the greenhouse cafe was a little small to cater to all the guests coming for breakfast. We were seated at an area that seems to be somekind of makeshift area to accomodate the large breakfast crowd at the side of the cafe. In terms of spread i would say that the items are reasonable and unique. The greenhouse have the usual staple of eggs, ham, bread porridge, rice fruits, noodles that most normal buffet will have which should suffice most people. Unfortuntaely i'm a picky eater and alot of the stuff that they had just did not suit my tastes. For example i was looking for some noodles/beehoon for breakfast but for some reason they had what we call Sang mee which is fried noodles with sauce that is typically served during dinner. Not much live stations apart from a smoothies bar, egg and some kind of pancake station. They do had some unique items like japanese cold tofu and a variety of muesli bars which the wife liked...so while it did not meet my requirements i'm sure it will meet the standards of others who have different tastes. POOL: One of the activities that my kids enjoys most during a staycation is playing at the pool. We checked out the pool after breakfast and to be honest we were disappointed. It is standard rectangular pool more suited to swimming laps with some sort of jaccuzi at the side for those who wants to soak. If there's one thing that should be upgraded this is it. Clearly not a pool that fits the image of a luxury hotel...the one at Mandarain oriental looks much much better. SERVICE: We did not really tested the service of the staff at Ritz due to the fact that we only stayed for one night. But there were still interactions with the staff which gave us an indication of the kind of service that u can expect. I would say their front line team at the lobby are very well trained and customer oriented. The staff which checked out for me even asked me whether i had transport arranged for my flight...and gave me a complimentary parking coupon when i told him i was a local. Thumbs up for the inititiative. There was a turndown service and the cleaning lady offered us bottles of water and replenished our tea, coffee and towels another sign that the hotel takes cares of its guests' needs. Finally when we were exiting from the carpark leaving for home we had some issues with the complimentary carpark coupon. The hotel staff opened the gantry for us without much questions asked.The only negative thing that i noticed is that the housekeeping lady was not very fluent in English which might make it difficult to communicate with foreigners with special requests. SUMMARY: All in all the experience with Ritz Carlton was a very good one. They position themselves as a luxury hotel and delivered in terms of the quality of their rooms and the service that distinguish them as one of the top hotels in Singapore. The hotel gets top marks for its location, view and service but given the premium that it is charging i would expect everything to be perfect. Improving the breakfast and the pool area would be two items that can help the hotel would a big step forward towards nirvana. A bigger variety for breakfast and maybe a bigger capacity breakfast area would definitely enhance the breakfast experience. For the pool i would suggest some cabanas and a children play area for parents to lounge around under shade while the kids can have something to entertain themselves. Ritz is going to have strong competition in the later part of the year when Pan Pacific completes their major renovation if they do not constantly upgrade themselves based on my experience with the two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with incredible view on the 32th floor”
Reviews.Author: jclinder
Reviews.Content: I had not been in a Ritz Carlton for a very long time (probably around 10 years) but this short stay (1 night) will encourage me to add them to my list of selected hotel chains. This one is really beautiful and huge. The view from the 32th floor is incredible and the suite I got incredibly big with windows with view on Singapore in every room including the bathroom ! The greeting service was perfect as it was done on the Club Level with completely personalized welcome. I got a lot of amenities and a very nice upgrade as the hotel was booked by my friend through Amex Centurion Hotel Services. The only thing that lacked a little was the slow service at breakfast. I had to ask two times to get my tea and the guy still came back without delivering it to tell me that the buffet was going to close ! There was a table of american businessmen (all with laptops in front of me) and one of them went to the waiter and yelled with him that he has been waiting forever for a glass of water !

Reviews.Title: “Business Luxury”
Reviews.Author: b888
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the Ritz-Carlton as part of a business conference that was in the hotel. I can honestly say that it was an absolute delight. The rooms are spectacular. The comfy beds and block out blinds are dangerous when you have to get up for an 8am meeting! The bathrooms are beautiful. having a spa whilst overlooking the city is just amazing. Staff are incredibly helpful, friendly and professional. The breakfast and lunch buffets are second to none. A huge selection of local and western dishes are available. The hotel bar is also relaxed and friendly, and very tolerant of groups who are lingering and sipping their Singapore Slings right up to closing (midnight). I can't comment on value for money because I didn't pay. I also can't comment on the location much because I hardly got out of the hotel due to long meetings. But I can highly recommend the hotel and it's facilities, especially for business groups.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to fault”
Reviews.Author: worktravellerglobal
Reviews.Content: Its pretty hard to fault the Ritz Carlton Singapore. The newly refurbished rooms are wonderful. The beds are heavenly and they have power points next the the bed! It's the little things that impress me... Great large bath tubs that are worth finding the time to soak in. The gym and pool facilities are some of the best. The pool is long enough for laps.  The staff are very kind and there systems good enough to remember if you have been there before and what newspaper you like. The breakfast buffet worth making time for, but not worth queuing for (which sometimes happens when they have big events there

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Wanderwish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a staycation at this supposedly 5 star hotel over the long weekend. Although we were satisfied with the spacious rooms with good views, we were shocked by the poor service, overcrowded-ness and was disappointed overall. We checked-in at 2 pm, only to find about 20-25 people at the reception counter trying to check-in. There was a physical queue and the wait in line was long and unpleasant. The check-in process was long and alot of mistakes were made with our booking details, including the package quoted.. Eg, breakfast was supposed to be included but was not duly noted by the hotel. Fortunately this was rectified. Even after the check-in process, we had to wait till 3.15 pm to receive our room because the room was supposedly still under cleaning ( although check-in time is 2pm ). The hotel did not seem to be able to cope in full capacity. The breakfast at the greenhouse which was priced at $50 per head, was from 6.30-10.30. We were fortunate to get there at 8am in the morning. By 9am, there was a physical queue of 20 people at the restaurant door, waiting to enter as there were insufficient seats. This queue lasted till the end of the breakfast. There was also a queue, albeit shorter one, at the chihuly lounge for breakfast. The next morning, the hotel decided to hold the breakfast at an alternative location. The breakfast was moved to a level 1 area - reception area of the hotel ballroom. The hotel did not even open the ballroom but instead held the breakfast at this stuffy, cramp holding area outside the ballroom, with a buffet line that had much less variety and off poorer quality than the original greenhouse breakfast. The hotel employed temporary staff to wait during the breakfast. The temp staff was unprofessional and service was poor. The staff were idling in groups, chatting and using vulgarities at times, all within hearing distance of guests. They would shout across tables at themselves when trying to get help or giving instructions to one another. The entire breakfast experience was unpleasant to say the least and felt like a very low-budget hotel wedding; a far-cry from the peaceful, weekend getaway that we were hoping to have by paying for a supposedly 5 star hotel. We felt that the hotel should not have moved their breakfast venue to such a poor alternative and with admittedly poorer quality/ more limited variety of food, without first informing the guests or compensating them, especially since they were charging a substantial amount for it. We believe we are not the only guests to feel short-changed by the experience. I would definitely not consider a return visit to the Ritz as it seems their standards in terms of service quality and guest satisfaction have dropped tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamlSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Millenia in Singapore for 3 glorious nights and were completely blown away with the huge windows which overlook the fabulous Marina Bay Sands and all this fabulous complex has to offer. We were very spoilt with the views from our 7th floor room and enjoyed the Night Light display at 9pm each evening. Our room was spacious and well appointed. The beds and pillows were just so comfy. The bathroom was huge and had a wonderful shower with a rain head (my only gripe was the lack of hooks to hang wet towels, etc)....We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast which was plentiful and of a very high standard. The staff who were on the Concierge desk were very helpful and keen to assist us with all our silly tourist questions. One small disappointment is the lack of fresh milk for tea/coffee making in the room. We hate Coffeemate in our tea and once we requested the fresh milk Housekeeping was very quick to send it up....a bit shocked when we checked out to see we had been charged for this small amount of fresh milk....this should be one of the things offered in a hotel of this calibre...still did not change our overall experience and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kildonan_kid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton Millennia in Singapore for 5-days, plus an additional day on our way back home. We were there for the BMW Golf Tournament, and was basically spoiled by BMW in every which way. The Ritz is a beautiful venue and hotel, providing mostly typical Ritz Carlton service and accommodation in a location that give easy access to many areas of Singapore, either by foot, MTR or taxi. Concierge advice and front door service was very good in the times we used them - although getting chauffeured by BMW and their drivers can definitely help! I will criticize a number of miscues or shortfalls in what I see as a hotel that should be worth considering for business or holiday travellers alike. Room - comfortable beds, modern & new, and mostly roomy. A "walk-in" style closet which is actually a little small to actually walk-in - you kind of get stuck trying to manage in/out of the closet. Bathroom - beautiful except for a lack of hooks for bathrobes, towels, bathroom bags. A couple strategic hooks would make the experience much better. Had to use the shaving mirror to hang stuff. Breakfast buffet - mostly good selection and tastes, except for lack of a good noodle dish for breakfast. Throughout Asia, noodles are de rigeur and my preference - however here - most days not even one noodle dish!!?? On our return through Singapore, our reservation was missing. Before leaving our initial visit, we were pretty sure we made a reservation, even getting a call our last evening, from the desk to confirm the BMW rate for our return. While we didn't get a confirmation number (our mistake), we thought it was clear when we enquired/confirmed that we wanted a room - also making arrangements for storing bags, etc. In any case, when we tried to check back in the following week, no reservation - but available rooms! it took a painful 40-minutes to get a room. Computer was down, no non-smoking rooms, night manager not available to confirm rate, etc. When the manager showed up, she was very concerned and apologetic, but it still took an interminable time to actually get checked in. The lateness of our arrival (945pm) and the earliness of our next day departure (6:00am) contributed to the overall impression. I would consider staying here again, but more likely will try a few others in the area before deciding again.

Reviews.Title: “How can one not like this place!”
Reviews.Author: bartwookie
Reviews.Content: After spending so many nights in guesthouses and villas all over Asia during our 3 months visit, we decided to treat ourselves to this wonderful hotel which has everything. The rooms are magnificent, the food is so exquisitely delicious and the wine choice is superb. Definitely not a disappointment even thou we burnt a hole in our pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJTourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Marina Bay view room and this was an excellent choice due to the fact that we had a spectacular view of the Marina Bay Sands and light show that starts at approx 9pm. We stayed 3 nights and were returning guests.with friends, The location is handy to the Marina Bay Complex as well as a short stroll to a shopping complex that leads to the MTR and is airconditioned all the way. We had rooms on the 7th floor, spacious and modern ,though felt that our last stay on the 10th floor, seemed a bit more luxurious . From check in to checkout, the staff were simply the best and The Ritz Carlton is the perfect place to stay in Singapore with it's quiet parklike grounds and luxurious elegance. Thank you to the Managment & Staff for another memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel chain (for both business and family holiday)”
Reviews.Author: Tose_Mt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several Ritz Carlton hotels in KL, HK and Singapore for business trips. This easter I took my family for a holiday in Singapore. Ritz is of course on my top list even though it's not located in Orchard area. I booked two rooms under Easter Package Deal that came in with buffet breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children plus a SGD 50 credit per stay. I came with my two kids (age 9 and 5), my wife and my parents in law (both above 65 years old) The check in process was very smooth. The reception was as great as ever. The Front Office Desk officer kindly managed to give us nearby rooms. The rooms were great and very spacious. Something that you can expect from Ritz hotels. The only thing if I have to say was the price for wifi. It was ridiculously expensive at SGD 15 per hour. The one thing that I liked the most was the hospitality of the staffs, especially the ones at the Greenhouse during the breakfast period. They were very helpful and efficient. I have to say it was a very successful family holiday at the Ritz Carlton Millennia.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: chaosy
Reviews.Content: Service generally is good. Breakfast is fantastic with many choices (e.g. 2 types of yogurt, yakult, fresh fruit juices, a variety of honey provided etc). Areas that could be improved: 1. Went with 2 kids so I asked for 2 pairs of kids size slippers. Housekeeping brought me a pair only. I asked for another pair. Housekeeping said they have ran out of kids slippers. I called again. Housekeeping subsequently brought 3 pairs. 2. Perhaps can provide a stool so that kids can wash their hands easily. 3. Something wrong with the door access so we can't open the door using card key. We called the operator who said someone will come to assist. As we had just finished breakfast, my son was in urgent need of toilet. We called again after 15 mins and was told to wait. I asked the chambermaid who was cleaning the room next door to help. She said cannot open due to security, made a call and that's it. I approach another staff at the end of the corridor for help. He told me to approach the chambermaid. I approached the chambermaid again due to my son's urgency. Again, no. So I called the operator again who told me to wait. I told the operator to speak to the chambermaid to open up the door. So there i was, walking to and fro and my voice getting louder. Finally chambermaid open the door. The help that was supposed to come, came after about 20 mins and again, the card key can't be used. Anyway I asked to speak to the manager. In the end, the manager came personally to hand me the card key and offer me a complimentary lunch. There is no need for rectification (and additional cost to the hotel) if certain things can be done correctly, right from the start. Guests do not need undue frustration, esp when staying at a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Tonyvaya
Reviews.Content: Service cannot be faulted, clean renovated room overlooking marina bay n ocean view. Sunday brunch is something to look out for, advance booking needed.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: dehetoxic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, stopped over on our ways to Australia. The Ritz-Carlton. One look by the name means exclusive & quality. Nothing to fault. The service, location, quality, and overall experience make it simply the best. Staff are empowered to go the extra mile, and you are bombarded with 'hello' and 'good morning' as you move about. They clearly have a great recruitment process, as they do genuinely enjoy their work and helping you. The rooms are very spacious and have all the bells and whistle one needs - flat screen TV, DVD player, really fast internet, ipod docking station, facing the marina bay provides a spectacular views , best of all a butler to take care of all your personal needs.The breakfast we had was most outstanding. We even ordered room service on our last night which was superb in quality! You learn what is luxurious when you are at Ritz, definitely would be back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Skotti56
Reviews.Content: We had previously at the Mandarin Oriental next door which we had enjoyed but not been blown away by so decided to try the Ritz instead. With all of the recent development in the Marina Bay area, it is very much the most convenient place to be if on holiday. The hotel is extremely comfortable and luxurious. We had two connecting rooms on the 15th floor with Marina view. Spectacular views, particularly at night when the light show was in action. I wouldn't get fixated with a really high floor as anything above floor 10 will give you a great panorama. The design of the hotel is rather strange in that none of the public rooms make use of the fantastic location to give a view out over the harbour. this is a real shame so the Marina view is a must. Rooms are very spacious, more like a junior suite in some other hotels, and the light colour scheme only makes them feel even larger. The bathrooms with the window are fantastic. Great shower and extremely comfortable bed. Service was excellent. The staff could not have done more. Breakfast staff remembered our names and those of our sons every day despite the fact that this is a huge hotel. Some staff really went out of their way. Breakfast was very good and we also tried the seafood buffet which was excellent. The only minuses were the pool needs a freshen up both in terms of the facility itself and the gardens around. Many people will be wondering whether to stay at the MO or the RC given that they are next to each other and in exactly the same price bracket. I.M.O The Mandarin Oriental has a nicer pool, and a much nicer spa. The Ritz has much better and more spacious rooms and slightly better service. If I had to choose, I'd take the Ritz but they are both excellent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN SINGAPORE? I HOPE NOT...”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: Just checked in to Ritz-Carlton in Singapore for my first (and last) visit. Waited twenty minutes to check in, waited an additional twenty minutes for my luggage, waited twenty-five minutes to have my laundry collected, had mailed the hotel to ask them to book a table for me at the Raffles and they had forgotten and now the restaurant is fully booked, and, and, and... Don't we miss the times when Ritz-Carlton placed smaller faults into a guest experience just to impress the guest with their guest service recovery! So glad I am only staying for two days.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions weren't the lasting impressions”
Reviews.Author: PLKV2000
Reviews.Content: First impressions typically frame the entire stay for me but not for this hotel. Let's start with the bad first impression. The layout. The hotel's layout is not at all intuitive. The arrival experience isn't what you'd have expect for this class of hotel. No large impressive atrium with large reception to greet you. Instead you arrive, not sure which way the reception is as there are two passage ways, one to their all day dining and the other to the lounge and the reception is not visible at all. Then the nearest bank of lifts from the reception which by the way, you turn right towards the lounge, leads to the car park and not the rooms. So get to your room you'll wanting the bank of lifts that are the furtherest away. On entering the rooms I can't say I cared much for the fit out. Granted I was in the deluxe room, but the whole lay out with the beds right next to the door and the door finished with the same material as the walls made it feel a little like a cabin in a cruise ship. I'm not saying its a bad fit out, just not my taste. Now after all of my whining, the best bit about this hotel is its impeccable service. They've trained their staff extremely well and really try to personalise the service. I've stayed at the St. Regis, the Conrad, mandarin oriental and grand Hyatt (all in Singapore) and I must say the service here is the best. The rooms facing the marina bay also have spectacular views and of all the bathrooms of all the above mentioned hotels this is one of the largest and most well appointed, coming in a close second to St. Regis. Whilst I whined about the room's fit out, it's certainly large and extremely comfortable. Certainly for me, the whole experience here was great even if I didn't quite appreciate the aesthetics of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Ritz Carlton.”
Reviews.Author: optom
Reviews.Content: This is my seventh visit to the Ritz Carlton, each time staying for about a week. We have always enjoyed our stays here, but as in all hotels there have been little niggles. Last year we opted to go to the Pan Pacific for a change, but very quickly realised that the two hotels are a class- or a least a full star- apart, and returned to Ritz Carlton this year. Great decision. The rooms have been upgraded, new beds, TVs, but most importantly the rooms have been configured so it all makes sense, and you sit on the sofa and admire the view. New lighting, which is very clever, but also sensible as there is plenty of light to read. Bathroom has been retiled etc, but the stunning layout with bath under window remains. The rooms facing the Marina have the best view, but you pay a supplement for the view, and identical room. For that reason, I have only twice had Marina view, and am happy with my cheaper view of vibrant city and water. I don't know whether there has been a change of management, but service is now excellent. Whoever is in charge runs a tight ship! It is an example to other 5 star hotels. The pool is superb, both for swimming lengths and splashing around. Lots of loungers and parasols. The only food I ate in the RC was breakfast, and that was as good as ever. It has always been the best hotel buffet breakfast I have ever had. As the hotel is very well situated, with 2shopping malls just outside, and an MRT station to take you anywhere in Singapore, I always wanted to explore the fabulous Singapore food, rather than hotel food. I will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless, apart from the price.”
Reviews.Author: ScottAbroad_11
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite although travelling by myself. Total luxury! The views from the bath are amazing. I didn't dine in the hotel but snacks by pool at night with a classic cocktail and the fantastic jazz singer in the lobby were memorable.  Perfect for a honeymoon of special weekend away. The cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in,  with attention to every detail. I would stay there again if I could afford the suite price tag. Other 5 star hotels offer good deals on their suites, I wish the Ritz did the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne P
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here at the Ritz and were very impressed with the professional yet friendly staff. Our room had a great view of the sights. Although we had our dinners outside of the hotel, we found the breakfasts to be very good and the room service prompt. The spa massage therapists were great! I would highly recommend this hotel to others. The location is an easy walk (if you should decide to venture into the humidity) to many points of interest for viewing of interesting architecture or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: sharit911
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay several weeks at this wonderful property..and I can only compliment the wonderful and professional staff. I used to stay at Mandarin Oriental and St Regis , this was my first time at the Ritz Millenia and I can only say that this hotel does not compare with its competitors, it is far, far above ..The rooms / suites are stunning,in perfect condition, the view of the Marina is simply amazing.Housekeeping service is excellent , the staff is caring and so professional .The greenhouse does serve very good food, buffet breakfast is delicious, Sunday brunch is a must,the service is spotless .The chinese restaurant is one ot the best I have tried.The pool area is simply great, large pool, confortable lounge chairs, good service, exquisite fresh fruit cocktails and not as crowded as the Mandarin.Each of the staff at this wonderful property is eager to please and always have this wonderful smile.I do travel a lot and Ritz Carlton SIngapore is among the very finest hotel I have stayed in.The location is great within walking distance to the Marina Bay Shopping mall, and very close to all the main sightseeing areas of the city.I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and it surely will be our home when in Singapore.Simply a fantastic !!! Don't bother going anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: talonglang
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced luxury at its finest. Ritz Carlton offers luxurious and comfortable accommodation. From our arrival to our check out, we have been treated like royalties by the courteous and efficient staff. As soon as we entered our room, we were amazed by the view and the elegance exuded by the room. The bed, pillows and comforters were just great. I can bury myself and sleep there the whole day. I even wanted to ask where they buy that kind of bed and what kind of pillow they use, I want to buy and get that comfort every night. The bathroom is perfect! It has a separate control for music and it's fantastic while relaxing at the tub with an awesome view of the city. Needless to say, this is the best hotel I've stayed in so far. However, since it's so great, the rate is also great that I think I wouldn't spend for again unless I have extra to spare for luxurious accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jlshaeff
Reviews.Content: Room is large including bathroom. Beds are super comfortable. Service is professional. Harbor view rooms have great views. Large swimming pool. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “cost room & amenities but lack of quality for food”
Reviews.Author: goshocky
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights during family vacation. the location is superbly great - walking distance to Suntec City, Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands and a MRT station behind the hotel. check-in was great, very nice lobby and valet service. but I hope they simplify the check-in process and more proactive instead of normal way of check-in. we got free parking where we leave our car for 3 days since cheaper to take a cab or MRT than driving/parking outside. the room were big and cosy - more like a studio room than a normal deluxe with 2 seat sofa and a chair. bathroom also massively big. we got a room facing marina bay which is absolutely spectacular! the bathroom amenities were luxurious- Bulgari products. the service by housekeeping was very awesome, they're punctual, fast-response & proactive. the breakfast a major downside for my stays, small portion and not so great food. i can say just like other normal 4-star hotel. the gym were luxury and we spent half our day there using the facilities which is on par with paid fitness centre back home. overall i'm satisfied and will stay here again. but hope better food next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to start our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Guray003
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty from the moment we checked in. The quality of service was exceptional and the views of the city skyline and the singapore flyer were amazing! I would highly recommend room 2426!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: oliverAustralia
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. We were checked in by Steven, who immediately gave me a very positive impression of the hotel by his charm, graciousness, willingness to assist us to find a room we wanted as well as his offer to phone us when one became available as we had checked in early. One of our best check in experiences ever. When we saw our room on the 30th floor, I could see why the taxi driver had told us that this is the best hotel in Singapore and why we had been wise to choose this hotel over the Mandarin Oriental-our other considered option. The spacious room very was nicely furnished, looks attractive and has 'a view to die for' i have already spent lots of time just looking at the ocean,marina, ships,storms coming in and lights at night. The little touches are also great- a small walk in wardrobe, lovely gowns, soft slippers, a very clear, good size TV, thoughtful lighting , plethora of power points,a great bed and pillows and free internet (paying for internet in 5 star hotels is one of my pet hates) and together, make for a luxurious and comfortable stay. The pool is large and the towels provided there are big and fluffy.Newspapers are also provided in the pool area. The gym are also good with plenty of the requisite treadmills and other equipment.The breakfasts were also excellent. When in Asia, I always eat the local offerings, and the Chinese dumplings, soups and congee were as good as anywhere I have been. The Western food also looked good but I can have it anytime. When I return to Singapore, it will be this hotel to which I will return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tommysudarsono
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4D/3N during the Singapore GP F1 weekend in Sep12. From the moment I arrived in the lobby, going thru check-in and entering the room I amfully satisfied with their services, excellent, I get what I've paid for for sure. Everyone is eager to help, always greets and smiles at us (something quite rare in Singapore hotels I believe). Check in process was a breeze, the guest relation, Akiko, is extremely efficient yet politely assist us with our needs. The room itself is one of the cleanest, with an amazing view over the Marina Bay, you could also take a peek from its large windows to the F1 race happening down below :-)

Reviews.Title: “High-class hotel with great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 14 nights in room 1307. The hotel is very large and has excellent facilities including: a very well equipped gym (lots of bikes, treadmills, machines etc), a lovely outdoor pool area, huge restaurant (great egg station) and a couple of other restaurants (which I did not try). My room was a double and it was huge, with a wonderful bathroom (bath in the window) and huge shower. There was a also a walk-in wardrobe and plenty of storage space. The service was exceptional, very attentive when required but also unobtrusive too. All of your luxury items were included in the room (dressing gowns, slippers, mini-bar, tea-making equipment etc, etc.). I really liked that the wi-fi and internet was free. Breakfast can be expensive if you don't get it included (was S$54.95 per day otherwise). You are also right next to an indoor shopping mall that has a lot of other restaurants to pick from and a bowling alley and cinema...you reach this by walking through the hotel - rather than a hot and sticky walk outside. Taxis are very, very cheap and everywhere - so it is easy to get around. My favourite place to go for a meal was Clark Quay - try the Brewerks microbrewery and restaurant for great value food and a wide selection of beer made on the premises - there are many more restaurants in this area, covering every possible taste and Clark Quay has a busy / hussling night-life scene after 11pm. It is also only 10 minutes from the hotel with a taxi cost of about s$10

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: rmribeir
Reviews.Content: It is really worth getting a room in a high floor with front view. Probably one of the best I have ever had (Marina bay). Room was great and I wish I had more time to enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Dewi P
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ritz Carlton Millenia Singapore was unforgettable. Our room had a beautiful view. Taking a warm bath with while looking out the window was memorable. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be excellent, but”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAlner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in February, not knowing that it coincided with the international air show. The hotel itself was great, but there are some small gripes: acknowledging that it was our anniversary we were upgraded to a Marina Bay room, but sadly in a room right next to the lifts. That made sleep impossible, even with ear plugs. We eventually moved, past midnight, to another room, this time with the City view we booked, but in a twin not a double. They claimed to be fully booked. Having to move our own luggage was not ideal either. The rooms themselves are well apportioned and very comfortable. Really it is a hotel for short business stops or if you are breaking up a longer flight with a couple of nights in Singapore. There is a lot of competition in this price bracket though and you would do well to look at all of your options. And, if you do booked and up end up with a room "18" on any floor, you will be by the lift and should ask for another room.

Reviews.Title: “Club lounge and rooms a winner!”
Reviews.Author: treasureParis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel way too early for check in (about 7.30am off a flight from Paris). The staff at the reception desk kindly showed us straight to the Club Lounge where we were invited to help ourselves to the buffet breakfast while they got our rooms ready. Within an hour of our arrival we were shown to our spacious rooms with great views. The staff in the Club lounge were friendly, would greet us by name, remember what we liked to drink etc. The food was of a high standard and with breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, dinner and cocktails on offer, getting a club room is a good deal. Having a drink overlooking the marina and watching the light show at night was lovely. The hotel and its staff were excellent and we will definitely be back again and again .......

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent”
Reviews.Author: HansdeVries
Reviews.Content: A great property in a great location, with really great people who ALL go the extra mile. If you ask directions somewhere in the hotel, the staff bring you there. Food & beverage was also top drawer. Marina Bay view rooms have a truly spectacular view, that changes constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: good rooms, location, service.”
Reviews.Author: Jochen K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz Carlton probably 4 times in 2011. Enjoyed all the stays and would go again. Whilst the Ritz Carlton was great, it does however not have anything special compared to the other high-end hotels (i.e. the pool of Marina Bay Sands, the service / colonial style of the Raffles etc.). Also, did not participate in Ritz Carlton member schemes. Rooms are great: large, good bed, excellent views over the skyline / harbour / Marina Bay Sands. Downside: if you end up on the other side of the hotel, views are less than average and it can be noisy. Also, very light wood is used in all the rooms which gives it a slightly "cheaper" look. Service: Good but not personal (Especially if compared to the e.g. Raffles Hotel. Think RC is too big for excellent service) Location: Good (not exactly downtown) Pool / Spa etc: Good but not comparable to Marina Bay Sands. Overall, definately would stay again. To note: doors often don't close without "pulling" them into their lock.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Danny K
Reviews.Content: The room was large and bed very comfy. Even the bathroom had a great view to the outside with its total glass panel design but of course the curtains could be drawn. I was very impressed with the fact that every single facility in the room was in good working condition, something that not many hotels, even the top ones could boast of. Other plus factors include its proximity to many interesting food outlets and also shopping malls like Marina Square, Millenia Walk and Suntec City among others. MRT stations were also within walking distance, The hotel staff were courteous and attentive too. The only downside, in my opinion, is that free wifi was only available in the lobby and second floor open area which were not conducive to the hotel guests. Wifi could be made available in the room but at an additional charge of S$30 per day, and I say for a guest staying at the Ritz it's not about money but more so about principles. To me, if the management could take that extra step to provide free wifi in the rooms too, Ritz would definitely score a Perfect 10.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: DianaMariaLondon
Reviews.Content: If you like bathrooms you're going to love this hotel. The hotel is known for the 'sexiest bathrooms' and they all have a huge bath which is situated next to a panoramic octagonal window. If you like showers they have that too. The beds are huge and comfy with really good pillows. When you arrive a member of staff comes up to your room with you and explains how to use all the electronic controls. The location is great - walking distance to the Singapore flyer and loads of eating places. The staff are lovely as you would expect. We would really love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: martin_roberts
Reviews.Content: as expected a top class top end hotel with all expected amenities and service levels. Rooms all very well equipped with great bathrooms - all have bath with full view out of the signature windows.

Reviews.Title: “A property that does not live up to the Ritz standards of service”
Reviews.Author: srvsan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on multiple trips to Singapore between December and February - have been disappointed by the front desk putting me up on a lower floor facing the city despite my multiple requests for a higher floor due to the road noise that is significant on rooms facing that side. They claimed full occupancy each time which is hard to believe given the number of properties nearby - Mandarin Oriental, Pan Pacific, Conrad. Has a limited in-room dining menu, average spa and limited number of dining options - head out to the nearby Shoppes at Marina Bay sands where multitude of options exist. Hotel does not participate in the Loyalty program - clearly they think that they can survive on the transient convention and exhibition visitor population that visits Singapore. With new properties that have come up in the vicinity (Marina Bay Sands, Fullerton), better choices abound

Reviews.Title: “luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: dream1980
Reviews.Content: shortly , it is peace of heaven..nice room .. nice buffet

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaster2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite - the views were fantastic. The staff noticed from my passport that it was my birthday. They sent a cake to my room with a happy birthday message on it. It was great. Staff were all very friendly, professional, and I felt like they wanted me to be there. I'd go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on the way to Australia. We stayed three nights. The Hotel is fantastic, great atmosphere and superb service. We had a corner Suite which was really very very good indeed. Very well appointed, awesome views and a great place to be. Travelling with our two young children (3 and 1 year old) things were difficult as our Daughter fell sick on our first day. the Hotel staff could not have been more helpful or friendly, truly exceptional levels of service. The location is close to many other big hotels and we would not hesitate to stay here again, a really great place. Many thanks to all the staff that made our stay so good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samuel L
Reviews.Content: As always, one can expect quality accommodation and service from the Ritz Carltons. The Ritz-Carlton Millenia Singapore did not disappoint: great staff, attentive service, terrific cuisine, great attention to detail. We really appreciated the large guest rooms and wonderful views from our bedroom and bathroom. Will for sure return the next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: PCD63
Reviews.Content: No doubt the Ritz-Carlton in Singapore has a fantastic location, a nice big room, great food, great gym and etc. However this hotel struggles to amaze you with a top 5 star hotel experience. During my stay, the hotel became really a super family vacation hotel. The hotel struggled to absorb/mute that vacation atmosphere. There should be a bigger focus on the normal Ritz-Carlton style of sophisticated hotel experience. At this time this hotel is still not fully participating in the Marriott Rewards Program.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there!”
Reviews.Author: Marie J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views, friendly staff and great food all help to make our holiday memorable, and this hotel has all that and more. The room was large and modern with comfortable beds and even the bathroom had breath-taking views of Marina bay. So much to see all within a short walk of the hotel, and within easy reach of the tube stations for visits further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Big room!”
Reviews.Author: JamesWYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent many of our weekends in this hotel few years back and we re-visited again two times last year before X'mas. Nice renovatiion, very spacious room, wonderful view and cheerful service are what we can remember of that two stayed. The only thing we dislike is the noise from the wooden flooring but still we will come back for more, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Content: We were five nights in this hotel in early January. The rooms are very spacious and softly decorated. The service was fabulous. The pool and public areas were spacious and attractive. It is possible to walk anywhere within the city from the hotel. The clean, safe metro has two stops within minutes of the hotel for trips further afield.

Reviews.Title: “we love the green”
Reviews.Author: Jayjade
Reviews.Content: Ritz is surrounded by lots of green which made us felt refreshing. Complimetary ice tea and fruit juice were availble by the front desk all day long was an added bonus. Service etc were what one could expect from a 5 star hotel. Buffet selection was great especially with the variety of uncut fruit which we could take with us for consumption during the day as they didnt provide any frsh fruit bwol in the toom like some other hotels. There were nine of us. We couldnt stay on the same floor because we went during Chinese New Year. We had two rooms on 30th floor, one on 22 and one on 6. The view was nice for the 30 and 22. However, the room on the 6 was the most spacious but we could hear the traffic outside at night. It's room 601 and I suspect all 01 rooms are that spacious so if you are lucky enough to get 3001, then you will have both the view and the space without the traffice noise in the middle of the night! By the way, free wi fi only availble in the lobby. We paid SS30 for 24hr wi fi in the room for one guest only even though the room was registered under two guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not Feeling the Love”
Reviews.Author: molrick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay over 150 nights a year at hotels. Most of those nights are spent at Marriott properties. Marriott usually treats us very well. Since the Marriott in Singapore was under construction we decided to stay at a sister property The Ritz Carlton. We were disappointed because the Ritz in Singapore doesn't honor Marriott status nor does it give points. We decided to stay anyway because I had always believed that it was a superior hotel chain. Boy was I mistaken. The location and views were grand but the customer service was some of the worst I've experienced in Asia. Not only did the hotel disappoint but the restaurant's service was pretty dismal. The food in the restaurant was very good but we had a hard time getting anyone's attention when we wanted plates cleared and more beverages. When we checked out of the hotel we were given a bill. Later they decided that they forgot a fee and called to say they were adding additional charges. They never forwarded an updated receipt for my husband's expense report. When we got home we contacted the hotel to tell them about our various problems. We were promptly called by a customer service representative named Victoria and while the representative was sympathetic she really didn't provide any solution other than a vague promise to contact her when we are returning to Singapore and she would like to make it up to us. It has been 3 months and we are returning to Singapore so I emailed her to see if we could get a reduced rate or some compensation. I have only received an email back saying she is out until the day we arrive in Singapore. When I forwarded an email to whomever is covering for her in Victoria's absence I did not receive a reply. The first slight was bad enough but ignoring a solicited opportunity to make good seems like really poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “nearly 5 star”
Reviews.Author: travelalotParis
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Ritz in Singapore about twice a year for a week. The standard rooms are excellent, great king bed, functional work desk and spacious room with really nice views. Room amenities and service is always great. Breakfast buffet is worth spending some time at. The only slight negative is that the line for omelets/pancakes can be long and the guys are pretty slow, but the selection is overall great. Pool is good, but I don't like the submerged location. Location is pretty good, though I prefer to be further up the river, but there are no 5 star hotels further up (like near Robertson quay).

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: cx123
Reviews.Content: great location across Marina Bay, and to all major attractions. amazing service, hospitality, beautiful rooms and incredible pool and buffet nice !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: swordfish01
Reviews.Content: Superb Service level on arrival to check in to check out. The location of the hotel is at walking distance to the Singapore flyer and Marina Bay Sands and interlink walkways to nearby shopping complexes and MRT connections. Rooms were comfy, comfortable bed and pillows, good room service.Good Tv channels. Bathrooms were big and it has a view of the city. Overall the hotel has a good level of service which they provide in every sense they could. Possibly try to request rooms facing the Marina Bay Sands, they have awesome views. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ktwilliams
Reviews.Content: Magical. The service was flawless, the rooms elegantly comfortable, and the bath -with -view a sumptuous experience. The Ritz-Carlton Millenia has a great modern art collection (ipod tour available from the concierge desk) - long enough to be interesting, but short enough to retain the attention of our 11 year old boy - or at least until the pool claimed him! From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, to be greeted by name, to the moment we finally left the experience was faultless. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location and child friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kateandmattb
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in a Ritz-Carlton before and were limited with our options in Sinagpore for the Chinese New Year period as had booked quite late. We have a 7 year old and an 18 month old so we not sure it would work. We were glad to say it did! Room was great, big enough for 4 of us, such friendly service, great pool and even though the hotel was really busy, the service was excellent. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “6-star hotel as usual”
Reviews.Author: My_Travel_Book
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at this hotel. We decided to choose one of the best hotels in Singapore, which was not a disappointing choice. The service from the concierge to the check-in counter was very smooth. We got a corner room on the 18th floor which had a nice view. The bathroom amenities and the decoration in the room was extra-ordinary. The hotel suits those who prefer privacy away from the noisy Central Business District. The hotel is conveniently connected to 3 shopping malls, namely: Marina Square, Millenia Walk, and Suntec City. It is just about 10-minute walking distance to these malls. The hotel's Asian Seafood buffet dinner on Sunday at the Greenhouse Restaurant is just great. It has lots of variety. But be sure to arrive early at around 6 pm as it will be packed. Advance reservation is definitely required. Overall, I think it is a hotel worth-staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: SergeDem
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel to celebrate my brother's 60s birthday as well as the New Year. It was a wise choice. The hotel is great in every aspect. However, the most impressive were the quality of service and the professionalism of the staff. I would like express my very special and profound thanks to Mr. Oscar Potsma, Executive Assitant Manager, Rooms - he and his staff made us to feel welcome, to feel to be at home among close friends, and to get the best possible positive feelings about the time in Singapore and in Ritz-Carlton. He also gave us an excellent advice on getting tickets for the floating stadium seating area, where we could watch the New Year firework from the best possible position without breaking our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - no Rewards!”
Reviews.Author: sjs1205
Reviews.Content: This has hotel has all the attributes of the Ritz Carlton brand - upscale public areas, attentive staff, beautiful rooms with fabulous views - but it lacks some soul and a coffee shop! Yes you can find somewhere to eat but the lounge area that specialises in afternoon tea is not good for a quick bite between meetings or after arriving off a long flight and the rates in the restaurant are not appropriate for that kind of meal. The ambience is all about style and does not have much real character - it could have been anywhere. As a regular business traveller one of the few compensations for the time away from home are the points that you earn that can then be used to gwant with who you want. Noramlly I stay in the Marriott when I visit Singapore but, as this is being refurboshed and although I had been able to geta room at a reasonable rate, my colleagues could not, we went to the Ritz Carlton as the other Marriott brand available. However, we were extremely disappointed that there were no Rewards on offer and the benefits that go with Gold membership were not being offered either. The most important thing about a brand is consistency. Marriott offers this in so many ways but this was a big disappointment and I could have satyed at one of the other hotels where I also have loyalty scheme membership if I had known. It was pointed out to me that this was on the hotel website but I am sorry I do not have time to check these details that I would have expected to be available without asking. One further point - although our corporate rate included internet we were charged for this and had to ask for this to be removed. We had to prodcue paperwork confirming the details - not the best customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing return visit”
Reviews.Author: never2tired2travel
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Club rooms after 3 excellent stays 3 years ago during the same busy Xmas-New Year period, however unfortunately we were very disappointed. The Club Lounge was so crowded with free-loaders and the staff so cranky there was no good reason to continue our stay. We even saw people being turned away from the Club at breakfast time due to overcrowding. Manangement should seriously look at how the Club Lounge and Rooms are managed.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Asia”
Reviews.Author: nrexjp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 20 times in the past 5 years and I can say without a doubt that this is my favorite hotel in all of Asia, possibly the world. From the moment you arrive, the greeters at the front entrance put you at ease with their gentle smiles. The check-in process is always seamless and efficient as I am usually in my room within ten minutes of arrival. My room is always set up according to my preferences which is odd because I don't recall ever making any special requests. I remember asking for a foam pillow once and from that stay onward, there is always a foam pillow waiting for me in my room. I used to re-arrange the desk chair so I can face out while I work. Now, they move the chair for me before I check in. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The bed is large, clean and extremely comfortable. And the bathrooms are big and well stocked. The restaurants are all good as is the lobby bar. Even their room service is delicious. The gym is more than adequate for a hotel gym and the pool is fantastic for lounging or swimming laps. I've swam in just about every hotel pool in Asia and my favorites are the Mandarin next door, the Grand Hyatt in Tokyo, the Grand Hyatt in Seoul, the W in Hong Kong, the Four Seasons also in Hong Kong and this one. Service is impeccable here. The staff at the front desk is both courteous and efficient as is the concierge. There is nothing these people cannot do. I once asked them to locate a former colleague who had recently moved to Singapore. All I had was her maiden name and believe it or not, they found her. True story. I can go on and on, but I'm sure you get the picture. It's the attention to details that makes this property great. There are newer, sleeker and more luxurious hotels in Singapore (St. Regis, Four Seasons, Fullerton to name a few), but nothing seems to compare to the Ritz. It truly is my home away from home. I give it my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your bucks”
Reviews.Author: julesher
Reviews.Content: Excellent attention. Every detail is well looked after. Staff is fantastic. And... If you ask nicely, they may give you a free upgrade to the presidential suite ;) Of course, this depends on availability. For one or two night stays, it's easier to get this bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless courteous service”
Reviews.Author: llynpeninsularsurfer
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in the heart of Singapore. Superb staff. Spectacular view from the bathroom window whilst relaxing in the bath. Make sure you don't slip on the bathroom floor as it is very slippy when wet. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel ever stayed.The hotel is great with all modern facilities and very friendly staff. The breakfast was worth trying.The food was great with a lot of choice.The rooms were a pure luxury with a great bath.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: TPHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Ritz Carlton during Christmas. Our room was EXTREMELY spacious with 5-star hotel amenities. Great attentive staff, even the doormen at the side entrance were super cheerful. The proximity to Sands was great. I personally think it’s a much nicer stroll at The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands than going to Orchard Road – too many people. A few minor issues: TV was mounted on a wall parallel to the bed and we need to turn our head at an angle to watch TV and that’s a little uncomfortable. Apparently that was the only place to mount the TV so that the bed could face the BIG windows with great view outside. However, TV signals went dead frequently which was quite annoying. A bigger issue: No Wifi except in hotel lobby & restaurant. Also, if you are using MRT, make sure you pick the right exit (think the exit next to the neighboring shopping mall is the closest), otherwise, it could be a bit of a walk back to the hotel from the MRT station. In all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service rendered to guests from Millenia Presidential Suite”
Reviews.Author: AlanCHLim
Reviews.Content: My family and I checked in the 2-bedroom Presidential Suite from 31 December 2011 to 2 January 2012 only to experience disappointing and embarrassing services from a 6-star rated hotel. Upon check-in, my wife noticed one of the toilets in the Presidential suite was leaking, resulting in wet and slippery marble floor. Deliveries for in-room dining were delayed for prolonged period of time despite me calling many times to remind and chase for our orders. The hotel gave us 4 bottles of complimentary champagne for our New Year's eve countdown celcebration (thank you very much!) but only provided us with 4 champagne glasses. The hotel expected each of us to drink a bottle of champagne. We had 8 people in our Presidential Suite and my friend called up the service butler to ask for 4 more glasses. He was informed by the service staff over the phone that it would cost me S$10 to deliver the 4 additional glasses to our suite. My gosh, it was embarrassing to me when my friend said he would rinse and "re-use" the coffee cups in our suite for champagne toasting. On the same night, we asked for ice cubes as the housekeeper failed to top up the ice buckets in our suite. My request by phone was again chargeable at S$10 for the delivery of ice cubes and I took the opportunity to ask for some coffee cups to make full use of my S$10. My family and I tried to visit the Club lounge during our stay, but there were no available seats and we had to return to our suite and make our own coffee and tea. On 2 occasions I had to return to my room after knowing there were no available table for us. The Club lounge was fully packed day on night from 31 Dec 2011 to 2 Jan 2012. Breakfast every morning was a nightmare! Long queue and insufficient food on the buffet spread to cater for the huge crowd. I had to clear a dirty used table MYSELF to make space for my family to sit and have our breakfast. I suspected the hotel over sold its Club floors and created the overcrowding problem. I spent approximately S$11,000 for our 2 nights stay at the Presidential Suite over the New Year holiday plus a dinner at the Chinese restaurant which cost me close to S$1,800. Absolutely disgusting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular !”
Reviews.Author: SK_SharadKhanna
Reviews.Content: Spectacular ! Just one word describes it best . Was with elderly parents & my minor son age 10 , very well looked after right from a swift check in. Booked a Premier suite & were upgraded to a higher floor (29th. on request by Ms.Wong) plus a corner suite . NYE fireworks were amazing from our room across the Marina bay. Hotel Marina Bay Sands appears like a fish market .... this was a pure luxury , classy stay if you can indulge in extravagance ! Birthday cake for my son was arranged , truly a memorable highlight of our visit to Singapore for New years eve 2012. Stayed 2 nights 31st. and 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Classed as a 6 Star hotel and definitely worth every star.”
Reviews.Author: StarFT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times before and this is our preferred hotel in Singapore. We tried the Mandarin Oriental once and switched back to the Ritz for the next stay. The staff are extremely helpful and willing to help where they can. The rooms are very comfortable, and the bathroom is fantastic with the picture window next to the bath with a great view of Singapore. The staff are attentive and after suggesting a restaurant for lunch they recognised us and on our return they asked if we enjoyed it- it is not like the hotel only has a few guests that they need to remember. Breakfast is pretty good, although the jazz brunch on Sundays is supposed to be the best. Downsides- although not enough to lose a star- they do not accept Ritz Carlon Rewards cards, the wireless internet connection is not free (which you would expect from a 6 star hotel) and the tvs in some of the rooms are built in the wall, but at the completely wrong angle to watch tv in bed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: hstone5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a room on the 18th floor. The room and the bathroom has been very well equipped very well. The view from the bathtub has been great. The windows could be better noise reduced since it has been pretty noisy due to the busy streets in front of the hotel The service from everybody has been great, overall very competent and caring. The outdoor pool is sensational and the as well there the service has been great. The only think i have been pretty disappointed has been the sauna, steam room and locker area which seems to be pretty old and worn down but at least clean

Reviews.Title: “Service and Elegance on the Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: 2far
Reviews.Content: November 2010. The hotel had just finished a room renovation program and the results are smashing! I liked the old decor but the rooms were looking worn, but the new decor is spectacular. What has also improved is customer service. We were last here in 2008; customer service was not quite up to snuff. This visit was quite different: We were met by the Bell manager at the taxi and escorted to the club floor. At the club for were welcomed with a glass of Champaign and escorted to our room, a spectacular Millennia suite. The Millennia suite is about 1000 sq feet and was over the top! The Club floor at the RC Millennia is one of the best. They serve a nice breakfast buffet, snacks at Lunch and at cocktail hour. The service was the best ever! Great place to spoil yourself in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “probably the best hotel in singapore”
Reviews.Author: barmak
Reviews.Content: Iwas in ritz -carlton in dec 2011 ; perfect service,perfect room.....all the best....it was my first experience in ritz -carlton , i recomended this hotel to every body....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, and so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 24-hour lay-over on New Years Eve, and it was very nice. The room was spacious with a wonderful panoramic view. And we splurged on the New Year's Eve buffet dinner -- about S$400 per person, with free flow of alcohol; impressive, but probably not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: This place has to top my list of best hotels. The service was absolutely outstanding. When I checked in I was with my 6 year old son and it happened to be his birthday which was something that came up in conversation during check-in. A few minutes after arriving in our room (which was amazing with incredible views) there was a knock on the door and it was the two girls from check-in and they had signed a birthday card for my son and brought him a little gift. When we had to leave our flight was early before breakfast but while we were waiting for transport to the airport, the concierge asked my son if he was hungry then promptly went away and returned a few minutes later with some breakfast to take-away with us. I will stay here every time I am in Singapore, it is simply incredible and worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: LovetravellingDXB
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Ritz and loving the hotel even more. The newly refurbished rooms were amazing, very modern and well designed. The service, as always, was immaculate and personalized without being intrusive. Impressive how the management could maintain such high quality service in a 600 rooms hotel. Even I only stayed once a year, and book the rooms under different names yet the staff always recognized me. There was a minor leakage in the bathroom AC, but rectified within 30 minutes after being reported. They even offered to change my room after it was fixed! Again the service... :) Location is excellent! Linked to Marina Square, Esplanade and Makan Sutera are accross the road and 15 minutes walk to Marina Bay Sands. Unfortunately during my stays I did not dine in the hotel as Singapore has a lot to offer in terms of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel well situated at the Marina”
Reviews.Author: Rachael_Bramber
Reviews.Content: A very luxurious hotel conveniently situated at the Marina. The rooms are amazing, so beautifully furnished and full of gadgets. The bathrooms are outstanding, it was wonderful to lie in the huge marble bath and look out over the Marina through the hexagonal window. The pool area is lovely and here is a substantial gym. The staff are very helpful and the service is very good. An interesting feature is the hotel's extensive contemporary art collection and the concierge can provide a booklet and iPod tour which is well worth doing. The bookmarks featuring the hotel's art are a nice touch too. The main criticism I have of the hotel is that it charges $30 per day for wifi. Wifi is now a basic service that everyone needs like water and electricity and charging for it separately seems penny pinching and mean - just increase the room rates and provide free wifi. And just be aware of the extremely high hotel service charges - $15 for breakfast cereal, $33 for continental breakfast and $10 for a coke. Unsurprising in an upmarket hotel but something to be aware of (there are plenty of eating places and services in the next door malls)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hersey_choc
Reviews.Content: When my bf & I stepped into Ritz, Everything was fantastic!! ALL of the staff are polite!! I was lucky enough to get a corner room on the 29th floor as I had requested for a higher floor.. I love the huge room & the toilet. Everything is good. The bad part was they had window cleaning which we wasn't inform beforehand and it was totally rude.. We just hope that this kind of minor mistakes can be avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This ain't your ordinary 5-Star!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Escape
Reviews.Content: Maybe it has six. It deserves 10! From the moment you drive down the lush driveway, you KNOW you have entered into somewhere special. Even for well-manicured Singapore. The hotel lobby is absolutely stunning. Hec, the entire hotel is a visual feast. We stayed on the Club Level at the very top (35th floor, I believe), since we were in town only a night and had business appointments. We checked-in in the club area, sipping champagne and gazing out at the crazy view of the city. We weren't sure what to expect, having booked the 'smallest' room. Imagine our shock when we were escorted by the concierge to a double door, 1-room apartment. We felt like royalty! The 'room' was a spacious one-room affair, incredibly decorated and plush. The view overlooked where the Formula 1 drivers zipped by, along the harbor. The bathtub was nestled up against a window and afforded a view of the entire marina area (hope they couldn't see in!)--the luxe Acqua di Parma products were simply everywhere. The bed was so comfy; it simply enveloped you. All of the room furnishings were in excellent condition. The usual robes were cozy. Every amenity imaginable was either in the room, or available upon request. The staff were competent, smiling, kind... extremely helpful in making our arrangements (we invited our colleagues to the room: how could we not share?! :). The club room offered the most sumptous buffet I've ever seen in a Ritz: sashimi, fruits, yummy hot & cold apps, and a fresh duck offering prepared by a very kind chef wearing a very big hat. The champagne flowed endlessly. Breakfast the next morning was equally stunning and plentiful, with hand-carved fruit designs, made-to-order omlettes, and other 'Eastern' options which still remain a mystery, but were simply delicious. The location is very convenient to shopping, businesses, cultural sites as it is situated along the promenade. All in all a very special experience in a gorgeous venue. We can't wait to stay again (um, might have to save a FEW pennies first... but the experience is just worth it).

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Continues to Please!”
Reviews.Author: chendricks0
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, the staff made it their business to make me happy. As I stepped out of the cab, made my way to the Registration counter and up to my room, at every point, the staff asked if there was anything they could do to help. It was wonderful and that level of service was maintained for 6 days. The room was immaculate. I appreciated the large room, closet and excellent bathroom. Great views from my side of the hotel and the room came with both day blinds and sun shade (block-out) blinds. I used both so they came in handy. The hotel is conveniently located near several malls so you will never be bored if you have a spare hour or two to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Millenia - great again”
Reviews.Author: Oracle68
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited SIngapore as part of a South East Asia trip (included HK and Singapore). We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Millenia before and we knew what to expect. Asked for interconnecting rooms. Upon arrival, a guest relations person accompanied us to our rooms and assisted with the reservation process. I travel frequently for work and the Ritz Carlton continues to rate up high there in terms of great experience and enjoyable stay. We used the breakfast buffet (which was very nice, even though on Sunday the queues were very long and it took over 10 mins to be sitted), the dinner buffet was also excellent (although you pay S$66 per person) and the hotel proximity to the Marina makes it a top choice for all travellers visiting Singapore for work or leisure. Nothing negative about the hotel, nothing I can even mildly complain about. Rooms were extremely clean, staff were very quick to assist (esp our dealings with Zarif in Concierge services was very good) and nothing was too hard for them.
