What made it even better was that we were allowed to exceed the standard 6pm late departure time which made a huige diffference when you have to catch up a midnight flight with two kids. Will definitely choose the Ritz Carlton Millenia again in Singapore. And I recommend you all to do the same. Not the cheapest hotel, but you pay what you get!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RG1978
Reviews.Content: i would say second only to marine bay hotel. staff were helpful, food was good, didnt make use of all facilities due to sight-seeing. did lots of research on which hotel to stay and believe this was right choice. worth going to again, if not to check out marine bay hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY TRIP”
Reviews.Author: aby c
Reviews.Content: Excellent trip for me to Singapore, never forgot the wonderful time I got in Singapore. Mr Peter who is working in Citi Bank Singapore help me in guiding to this hotel , I thank him a lot for the wonderful support he given to me during my visit to Singapore.I definitively inform my friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Doing the Ritz in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PeterHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Conde Nast readers have voted the Ritz-Carlton one of the best hotels in the world and I am in no mood to argue with them. If you can get a good rate, this hotel is a very good alternative to the Mandarin Oriental, and the legendary Raffels. Apart from the miles of mock marble and plastic, the rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms fantastic, though nothing compared to the Sukhothai in Bangkok. Take your heart pills and nitro tablets before examining the minibar rates: they make London and Paris seem cheap by comparison. The price for breakfast also rivals those of the aforementioned cities. The best experince of this hotel, and a stupendously expensive city for that matter, is the wonderful staff. I will remember Singapore for the staff at the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have enjoyed it more”
Reviews.Author: JodesLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms in the Ritz Carlton in transit to and from Europe, four nights in total. The place is stunning, with great artworks throughout the lobby, beautifully appointed rooms with wonderfully panoramic views, large baths and showers, comfortable beds and great amenities. All the staff, from reception, concierge and the doormen to restaurant and room service waitstaff, were very professional, warm and helpful. The room servicing was without fault - housekeeping does a great job. The food was delicious, the breakfast buffet fresh and extensive and room service meals really good, I would strongly suggest picking some of the Indian dishes and the Singapore Noodles, Yummo! The hotel is also in close walking distance to a shopping centre with a food hall with the usual fare, such as burgers and chips if your children are craving something simpler. The only downside for us, and absolutely no fault of the hotel, was that on the way over our 4 year old daughter ended up in Singapore's Raffles hospital with a viral infection and on the way back our 1 year old son obviously picked up a tummy bug in Paris and became extremely sick on the plane just before we landed in Singapore and then continued to be rather sick for most of our stay. Needless to say, it was pure bad luck, and we really didn't get to enjoy the hotel's facilities outside the rooms such as the pool etc or get to walk to the harbour and check out the local parks etc, but we got to appreciate the hotel staff, who were very helpful and followed up with inquiries on how our daughter was doing (we didn't mention our son being very sick on the way back, we just wanted to run and hide in our rooms and have a good shower and bath). Anyway, it was a great place to stay, even with sick children. Incidentally, if you are sick and don't have travel insurance, don't go to Raffles Hospital - an overnight stay for our daughter, with a raft of tests, which was overkill, but apparently a usual practice in Singapore, cost $1900. Luckily our insurance covered it, but the price was still quite a shock. The hospital was pretty amazing though. I would also suggest, if you have the cash, to pay for a direct private transfer to the hotel, we used the Singapore Stopover bus service, and being squeezed into a very tight mini bus with loads of luggage, and lots of other people who are being dropped off at other hotels along the way, is excruciating. The Ritz Carlton is about the last drop off point, so with 2 young children it becomes a bit of a nightmare - especially if you have to wait a while at the airport for the pick up in the first instance, like we did. In summary, we will definitely stay at the Ritz Carlton again as we could not fault the hotel (except maybe to fault the extortionate price of its Japanese dishes in room service), and hopefully the next time the children remain healthy for the entire stay and we get to enjoy it more!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service with nice views”
Reviews.Author: BoulderTravelers5
Reviews.Content: Just had a really nice stay at the Ritz Carlton-Singapore. They get it all right from the reception area, to the rooms, to the restaurants. Upon returning from a run around the Marina, I was greeted by the bellman with a towel and bottle of water-talk about service!! I had a bay-side room with awesome views. The only issue I had was with check-out. It was sloooow. 15 minutes to check out is way too long given the cost fo the lodging-add more clerks and get that line moving!

Reviews.Title: “excellent views and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: frankview
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the suite with my wife and kids for the Singapore National day celebrations in August. Excellent location to watch the fireworks from. Breakfast was terrific as always. room service took time - may be due to a house full for national day celebrations.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Mahtew
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a hotel to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary when we decided on Ritz as it overlooks the Singapore CBD and MBS. We were not too sure about our decision until hotel confirmed upgrading us from a Suite with Marina Bay View to something even better (premier suite, with a living room, room 2408)! Check in was a breeze. When we arrived at 230pm, there was a long queue but the helpers very quickly opened up another line at the concerige and we were in our rooms in less than 15 minutes. We were truely shocked when we got to our rooms to find the majestic view, how spacious the room was and the quality toileteries (acqua d parma). The living room was equiped with i suspect a Samsung 52 LED Tv. This same Tv was again available in the sleeping room. Very soon, we made ourselves comfortable in the huge, soft and clean bed. The electrical blinds made it all very easy should you want to reduce the sun/glare (but why would you when the view is so good?). Being the first time staying at such an high end room, we were pleasantly surprised when service staff came around and checking if we need anything (ie. remaking the bed, topping up coffee, etc). The politeness made the stay felt very welcoming. Definitely a recommended place if you want the luxury, convenience of location and the warm feeling of service. Check out the next day was fast. Service is again immaculate as they volunteered help with our luggage the minute we are at the checkout reception. by the way, parking in the hotel is complimentary.. Am pretty sure we will be back again...

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: xtne
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another 2 night stay at the Ritz Carlton. Each stay seem to be getting better than the previous ones. This time we got a free upgrade to a Marina Bay view suite! It was the first time for us to get a room in the north (?) side of the hotel (Room 1516) and this side is much more quiet at night than the side near the Singapore Flyer (and near the highway), no sound of cars revving up those engines. Check in took some time as they were trying to look for a room for us. We wanted to get a suite but were booked for a deluxe room.First time for me to see a queue at the counter, but the staff were quick to attend to them so guests dont have ot queue up longer than necessary. Breakfast was remarkable. So much more selection than we could take. I have to mention that this hotel seem to have almost everything we needed. My daughter was not in the mood to walk around, so we asked housekeeping if they have a stroller we can borrow. And they did have, we're very impressed. Try not to request for stuff from housekeeping during peak hours (like 2pm which is the checkin/out time) it will take time for them to attend to your request. We had to call 3 times for a baby cot to be brought up to our room even if we already requested this at check in. We requested for the stroller early in the morning and it was brought to our room right after we called.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: DJBradachNaples_FL
Reviews.Content: Rarely stay at any Ritz, normally because of price. Being 13 time zones away from home made this a different occassion. Being out in the marina area close to the huge Ferris Wheel and the within walking distance to the new Sands Casino and extrodinary complex makes this a great choice. A pretty new property from the looks of things with views to kill for. In the room lighting system knock my socks off as did the bath tub with a window facing the skyline of Singapore. Make sure you try the breakfast buffet, if you are from the States, More sruff you never seeen before. Great staff adn very accomodating. Shops nearby, so is Raffles and Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, modern decor, with amazing views”
Reviews.Author: JW1023
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Ritz. I've stayed here thrice already and I've never been disappointed. The views of the Kallang River was amazing. Large windows, plus you have to try the bathtub and look out the window. The rooms are large, and tastefully done, in a minimalist type. I love the interiors and the furniture, and the technology that they have - buttons for the blinds so that they automatically go up or down with a press of the button. The lighting is amazing, since you have night mode, bed mode, and master mode lighting. I like the night mode because the floor is lit to help you when you need to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. The card access function is great too, because you don't need to swipe it, you only need to wave it in front of a reader - very easy to use. The only problem I have is the access to the street in front. There is no sidewalk along the driveway. You have to go the side, out the hotel and then find your way down the stairs to the street. It's also a bit of a way from the MRT. Also, I wish they'd offer free wi-fi. I do hope they also serve oatmeal in the breakfast buffet in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand 5 star hotel with bay view”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: Opted for a short romantic weekend getaway at ritz Carlton. Stayed in the hotel on several occasions so it is always a safe bet for me in terms of 5 star accommodation. Yet again, we were not disappointed. Attentive service and great in hotel dining. Looking out from the bathroom window while u are lying in the bathtub - you will get a bird eye view of the bay. Love the spacious room layout and comfy bed. We overslept and decided to skip breakfast (a pity hehe)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: gino888md
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in Singapore to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary. I requested for an early check in since we took the first flight from Manila. Upon arrival we breezed through check in procedures and were whisked to our room . Upon opening the door we were greeted with a surprise: our room was filled with balloons and a welcome treat consisnting of chocolate covered strawberries were placed at our table and to top it off we were given a special birthday cake upon our first night. Truly we were so surprised and it realy made our stay quite fascinating. We would also like to commend the staff from the front desk and guest relation services for an impecable service. The buffet breakfast was excellent. We weren't able to use the pool and gym facilities during our stay since we are on a tight schedule but we plan on trying them out on our planned stay this January.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorite Hotels in Asia”
Reviews.Author: Gearhead85
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a delightful hotel in all respects. The service is excellent, the outdoor pool is great, and the rooms are large and all have dramatic panoramic views of the city. The hotel is also walking distance to the Marina Bay Sands casino and shopping center. One way to judge a hotel is not by the problems you encounter, but by how the hotel responds. When I mentioned that the hotel boradband internet sercice was quite slow during my stay, they graciously waived the internet fees. The only downside: this hotel does not participate in the Marriott Rewards program.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooms but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: The impressive Ritz-Carlton Millenia offers arguably the most lavish rooms in its category, and backs it up with top-notch facilities. It would be the best hotel in Singapore if it was better located. As it is, I find the Fairmont more convenient thus ultimately more convincing for business or tourism, if less luxurious. The spacious lobby and common areas invite to hang around. The architecture is modern and uncluttered. Ample use of natural light, white stone and white marble, accentuates the overall impression of fluidity. The restaurants and swimming pool are equally enticing. Service is professional and discrete; I found no fault with the food. The hotel's big draw is the rooms. Their huge size, making them closer to suites, is reinforced by the full-size windows and unobstructed views. The striking bathrooms have their own external windows. The overall decoration, modern for a Ritz-Carlton, makes use of warm materials such as leather panelling and richly colored clothing: it works well with the space to create a feel of refinement and comfort. While the place is not new, the high quality of the fixture makes it age quite gracefully so far. One has pleasure in staying in these rooms for extended periods, even during daytime. Not surprisingly, the room rate is at a premium to comparable hotels in Singapore (add about S$100-150 per night). Unfortunately, the Ritz-Carlton does not integrate with the rest of the city. Location is central but there is no street life. The area has one notable place of entertainment, which is Marina Bays Sands. Walking to the colonial district takes a good 15 minutes, either boring in underground passes, or sweaty in the Singapore heat. The nearby Promenade and Esplanade subway stations are on the Circle Line, not very well-connected. Eventually, one ends up relying extensively on taxis to commute to the rest of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Can't help but rave about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: siomao
Reviews.Content: You know you are in a special hotel when they even take care of the little things that other five star hotels don't usually do. The rooms are superbly interiored with leather panelling, a walkin closet, veneer finish, touch phone, big lcd tv and a spacious bathroom. But I am impressed with the little touches like when we left the do not disturb sign on, we found a little note from housekeeping slipped under the door saying that they will be back in a few hours to check on the room again. Usually in other hotels, they just wait for you to call the reception. It shows great training of staff by the hotel. You will also find a small checklist on the desk asking you to check if you prefer more water or coffee or tea in the room. We also got small Italian made chocolate squares every night by our bedside. The staff are very efficient but never cold or aloof. Always friendly and warm. The buffet breakfast has a great variety suited to any palate. The attention to detail is quite impressive, first time that I have seen Yakult in the beverage selection, my toddler son loved that. Location wise, there are pros and cons. Pro is that you get a fantastic view of the harbor. It is a really beautiful sight, worth the price of the room alone. Con is that I wish it were nearer to Orchard road. You can go to the Marina Bay Sands mall, a high end mall with celebrity restaurants and a skating rink and casino, just by crossing the bridge. Or you can drop by the Marina Square mall but shopping is limited. On a high traffic day, it can take 20min just to get to orchard road from the hotel. This hotel is now my favorite hotel in Asia. I really can't say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Old Property, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: The service at the Ritz Carlton Millennia is of the standard you would expect of a Ritz property. Staff are attentive and welcoming and are one of the biggest things this hotel has going for it. The rooms are incredibly large and the views on both side of the building are incredible. The bathroom is luxurious and generous at the same time. The layout and mod-cons built-in to a lot of the fixtures make for a room that simply makes sense. The building itself is old and a lot of the property's design and interior is tired. The bottom line: rooms here are quite expensive and the luxe-to-price ratio is low so you may want to consider one of the many newer boutique hotels in Singapore than offer convenience, great service and value. Alternatively at the same price level you have several new options in the Marina Bay area that are worth considering. Also important to note, Ritz Carlton Millennia is not part of any frequent guest program.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Millenia Singapore”
Reviews.Author: supriyapunyani
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel with great view t Marina Bay. The hotel room was the best one which glass windows and view was great to cisty and grand wheel....the accesories in hotel were nice..food was amazing ..indian food was super authentic with greta fllavors...cab was available 24*7 hrs and the room service was great..though it was expensive 480 SGD per night :)

Reviews.Title: “Views, Location and Service- 3cheers!!”
Reviews.Author: aviIndia
Reviews.Content: At check-in, the reception went the extra mile to find a room with the best view of the harbour, even before I asked for it. Their service was great all-through. The room was really big with comfortable big sofa and nice firm bed. The room greeted me with a wonderful expansive view of the Marina Bay- right from the Marina Bay Sands building to the iconic Singapore lion spewing water. The bathroom also has the same view – so you can enjoy the view even while you take bubble bath on your bath-tub. The swimming pool has a nice environment- sounds made by the fountains give an impression of being in tropical forest pond. The hotel is definitely located in a convenient place- since the CBD is a 5 min drive and Marina Bay Sands is 5 mins walk. You can cross the road and enjoy the motor-boat racing as well. Overall I was pleasantly surprised and it is one of the best hotels I have stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Delivers every time”
Reviews.Author: Thebarrs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the last 11 years. I am always delighted with my stay. My only comment may be that its been a while since I had an upgrade and would appreciate that regular guests be upgraded occasionally. The breakfasts are amazing and keep you going all day. The evening buffet is the best I have ever tasted and good value at $62.00 plus tax. Staff are very attentive as always and Amy in the restaurant was particularly helpful this visit. I will be back in a couple of weeks on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an increasingly good location”
Reviews.Author: a1001
Reviews.Content: I arrived early morning and was escorted up to the Club Lounge on the 32nd floor for check-in. I was offered a coffee, however, the usual efficiency meant that I had barely had one sip and the formalities were completed and I was shown to my club level room which was just down the hall. The room had a certain "wow" factor mainly as a result of the large panoramic windows in both the bedroom/lounge and the bathroom. The room was large and well kitted out with a large bed, sofa, table and desk. The amenities were of an excellent quality and as you'd expect constantly topped up including bottled water and Nespresso capsules. The main advantage of the club level was the lounge which provided good quality snack during 5 periods each day. The views from the club lounge were great and a glass of champagne at sunset is recommended. The hootel is located a 3 minute walk from a metro station and convenient for Clarke Quay. Also it is joined to the Marina Bay complex by a new walking bridge (<5 mins walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: amsf
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here and was lucky enough to be upgraded to a corner suite with city/marina bay views - you really do want a room this side if you can (and a suite if you can afford it, or like me, blag an upgrade!). I get the impression the rooms have all been refurbished and a lot of the older review comments/pictures are out of date - the rooms and bathrooms really are excellent now. My only criticisms would be that there is some traffic noise in the room as you are right by a major road and there was no decent bar with a view (or atmosphere!) to have an evening drink in - the lobby lounge doubled up as the bar and was ok but not great. The Mandarin Oriental next door looked like it was better in this area. Have previously stayed at the Shangri-La when in Singapore (which has more of a resort atmosphere as it's set in a large, spacious park area with big pool, pitch and putt etc) but preferred the location of the Ritz and being nearer 'the action' of the marina area. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will try again”
Reviews.Author: pickymom46
Reviews.Content: Our family had a short overnight stay at the Ritz exclusively for the purpose of watching the NDP at the Marina Float. The stay had its highs and lows, but there were enough appealing aspects that we would try it again during a less-hectic time. To its credit, the hotel did its best to manage an extraordinarily busy and inconvenient arrival process, which included the closure of the road fronting it. Impressively, they did not misplace any of our many pieces of luggage despite having to store everything curbside in an improvised space, and they also delivered everything to our room in a timely manner. There was (understandably) a long line for check-in packed with families with young children since we weren't the only ones with the NDP idea, but the hotel provided snacks and beverages and the check-in staff managed to stay smiling and gracious despite the crowd. Our room was ready for us upon arrival and, as promised, had a spectacular view of the marina and city skyline. The room was refreshingly spacious and had recently been updated; the bathroom had the trademark octagonal window over the tub with another stunning view of the marina. Extra credit for the gallon-size plastic bag in the bathroom for air travelers to put their liquids into. Someone had also thoughtfully placed a crib in our room, except we didn't need it and couldn't get the overwhelmed housekeeping staff to come get it despite a few phone calls. We finally pushed it into the hall ourselves where it was eventually taken away. Surprisingly, the room service we ordered was both delivered and retrieved quickly, and the food, tasty. We left for Changi early the next morning so did not try any of the hotel restaurants We usually stay at the St Regis in Singapore, but would certainly visit the Ritz again should we need to be closer to the CBD. A+ for effort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: dureid
Reviews.Content: Had a bad start with a very rough and tough girl at the reception who didn't care. Yet her front desk and guest relations manager(Miguel) was a very good guy who responded positively. If you are a Marriott rewards member don't expect any points.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Abhishek1308
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the hotel for several years. Be it business or leisure its best. The rooms are the largest and bathrooms are size of a room in a european hotel :) View of Marina Bay is breathtaking and rooms are very posh with nice courteous staff. Great location. 2 negatives: tough many times to get a room at low prices and not part of any loyalty programme so cant earn points for any free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Quick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights at the Ritz-Carlton Millenia Singapore on business. Most of the hotel and rooms are newly renovated. The Harbour View rooms have beautiful views of the city skyline, harbour and Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyover and the Esplanade. The only negatives about the hotel rooms are the poorly lit toilet room, lack of an exhaust fan, and the hidden switches that operate the mechanical blinds. The restaurant and lounge served very good food, allowing you to stay in if you don't want to venture out. If you do venture out, there are several shopping malls connected to or adjacent to the hotel. It's a short taxi or MRT ride to Chinatown, Little India or the bustling Orchard Road. Overall, the Ritz-Carlton is a great hotel, for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay of 9 nights at this property recently and had a great time. The best part of the stay is the friendly, polite and courteous service form all staff, from the doormen/women, bell boys, check-in staff, business centre...everyone always had a smile and a polite greeting. House keeping was impeccable, our included daily buffet breakfast was delicious, and the business facilities were great. We also had a complimentary fruit basket that was changed daily that we looked forward to digging into at the end of each day. A few negatives (which to us were minor and were more than compensated for by the positives): a small claustrophobic toilet with a strange flush mechanism, poor pedestrian access from the street to the front door, no washing machine facilities (you have to pay for laundry to be done for you and it is VERY expensive), and the concierge staff often strangely give poor directions to local places like restaurants that are in walking distance. I kept wondering why they didn't just have little maps they could give you to show you how to walk there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton - Two Thumbs Up !”
Reviews.Author: C-550D
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton is one of Singapore's premier hotels along with other great hotels like Goodwood Park, Marina Mandarin and the Shangri-La. Situated facing both the Marina Bay and the Kallang Bay, it has beautiful views for all rooms though the Marina Bay rooms are clearly the preferred choice for travellers. Greeted by name as we stepped out of the taxi (they check the luggage tags 1st), our personal valet escorted us to the front desk, offered us a beverage while we checked in, and then walked us to our room. Don't miss the night time view out of the bathtub, quite impressive. Plush deluxe rooms, comfortable duvet beds and a expansive beautiful bathroom with a tub right beside the window that offers sweeping views of the Benjamin Sheares Bridge and Marina Bay. Clearly for the romantics. Staff are all helpful and very courteous, greeting you all the time to make you feel at home. Breakfast selection was plentiful and situated in a nicely lit and decorative cafe Plush, nicely decor room that is welcoming and not imposing. All amenities provided. Unique Quality: Beautiful bathroom that is right beside a window that has sweeping views of the sea and surrounding Marina Bay. The higher floors, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fab68
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been newly renovated to a high standard , the views are excellent ! One of the negative points is the fact that the check in took nearly half hour which is not acceptable for this kind of hotel , it was not because there were many clients but because they seem to look for a free room even though we arrived after 2 pm . As well the concierge service is not up to the standard of the hotel, they didn't not confirm the restaurant booking which was made . They need to train better their staff .

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Credo Shows Consistent Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Layn33
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel on a business trip. When I got to the hotel, I was escorted to a private alcove to check in. There was no wait and definitely no line. I was escorted to my room but the person who checked me in. There was water and a platter of fruits and cheese waiting for me. The room was spacious, well-furnished and clean. To top it all the big circles you see around the building is the entire expanse of the view from the room. I would recommend and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best stay i ever Had (I travel 90 days a year)”
Reviews.Author: abdoatef
Reviews.Content: The whole stay was wonderful, and everyone -literally everyone- will do his best to help you, Compliments in the room every day, nice gestures and pampering during your stay. a wonderful experience one of the best i had

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding One of the Best Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: JDK1700
Reviews.Content: This property is outstanding in every respect.The rooms are large, great views of the Marina, very luxuous. They are generous with upgrades. Staff knows your name and is very attentive. Club level has great variety of food presentations (3 hot dishes in the evening plus chef making additional special dish). Terrific breakfast buffet in main dining room. I stayed here several years ago and was hesitating to stay again because I remember it being isolated and far from Orchard St. It still is 15-20 minutes by taxi from Orchard St, but there is no reason to go to Orchard St anymore as area around the Ritz has developed with lots of shopping centers and hotels. Walk out the back door and in 1 minute walk you enter the first of many shopping centers that are connected together. Walk out the front and across a 5 minute walkway to the Marina Sands hotel and the unbelievable urge shopping center with ice skating ring, casino, restaurants, brand name shops, great science museum on water and lots of other attractions. Just outside the rear door is a massage place which is very inexpensive and very good. This is top of the line Ritz Carlton and I definitely recommend it and its club level.

Reviews.Title: “superb location with nice size modern & friendly rooms and great view”
Reviews.Author: barbaraebner
Reviews.Content: overlooking the harbour with sweeping views - this really offers all you could wish for. high tech amenities, large very comfortable rooms with desk, sitting area and great bed. Bathroom with shower and tub right in the window to enjoy those views. extra cozy bathrobes. If there is one thing missing, it is a waste bin in the toilet - nothing else to complain about. The mini bar prices are high but so is almost everything in Singapore. Try to get a room rate which includes the breakfast - it is superb, doesn't get any better. One of the few hotels where you always have a lift ready- even at convention times.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: jamesjen25
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Ritz Carlton Singapore twice this year, once for business and once for leisure. It was my first time staying in this part of Singapore, and while the location is not as central as Orchard road, being close to the Esplanade did have some perks. Overall, the hotel was “above average” in quality. The hotel looks to have been renovated fairly recently, and had some of the most modernly comfortable rooms I have stayed in. However, this was in contrast to some other parts of the hotel, which remained a little dated. The staff were always helpful, and allowed us to use shower facilities at the health-club post check-out, but aside from that nothing in particular stands out in my mind. My chief complaint the BOTH times I stayed there was the general noisiness of the hotel, as both times my beauty sleep was interrupted by either loud noises outside, or by renovations taking place within the hotel. +++: Rooms: Spacious, and outfitted with modern amenities such as universal /USB outlets on the desk, iPod dock, large TV with multimedia system, and electrically controlled curtains, all of which were easy to use. The bathrooms were elegant and spacious, with a bathtub overlooking the city. Location: Walkable distance to Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade, and in a generally quieter part of town, which gives a little more relaxing feel. Short taxi ride away from main business districts. Bonus tip: try drinks at Orgo, which is the Esplanade’s rooftop bar. If you can stand the heat, you will be rewarded with a great atmosphere and original drinks, and is truly a great way to enjoy/start a night out. Be warned, I have heard the food there is lacking though… ---: Location: Generally not considered as convenient as Orchard Road, and a little (I stress a little) further from districts such as Chinatown and little India. Noise: The first time I stayed, it was noise from outside the hotel that woke me, and it persisted through most of the morning. Since the hotel neighbours the Padang, it is understandable that sometimes rehearsals take place, so I was a little more understanding. The second time though, was more of a nuisance, as the persistent whirring of a drill came from WITHIN the hotel on both Saturday and Sunday from around 10am onwards – not the greatest complement to a mild hangover. Security system: Just an annoyance rather than a huge negative, but a friend stayed in the same hotel, and we were put on different floors. At this hotel, your card only has access to your particular floor, so it was impossible to get to a different floor without the help of staff, which in turn required guest name, room number AND a call up to the room to confirm with the guest. I understand the Ritz Carlton prides itself on security, but all in all, that really seemed a little overboard. Lack of free Wifi: Boo

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view from room!”
Reviews.Author: EllyN_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on a business trip, and initially was not impressed by the slow check-in. The staff told me to wait for 15-20mins, and I waited very nearby to the reception area, and after 25mins, I went to ask again if the room was ready. It was actually been ready but they did not even let me know! Put that aside, the services thereafter was excellent, a staff actually walked me all the way to Millenia Walk to show me the nearest MRT station when asked. Also, during the conference, we found that the room was warm and stuffy, and the staff was quick to respond to alleviate the problem. The housekeeping service was great and discreet, never once they forgot to replenish the amenities throughout my stay. The food was okay - in terms of the buffet spread at the coffee house, I have seen better spread at other hotels in Singapore. Would definetely come back for the very comfy bed, spacious room and bathroom and the awesome view. But food-wise, I prefer going out. Tips: No Signboard restaurant is just within a short walk at the Esplanade mall facing the bay. The seafood there was great! However, for slightly cheaper seafood with local fare, MakanSutra is also very near to the area, hawker style.

Reviews.Title: “Meh... Underwhelmed. Nice Hotel, But Not Ritz Standard”
Reviews.Author: stoneman60
Reviews.Content: Hey Ritz staff! Here's a reading tip... get everyone in your hotel a copy of Peak by Chip Conley (American founder of Joie de Vivre Hotels in California). You will all learn something. I came to your hotel directly from a Joie de Vivre 3-star place in San Francisco a day before and I'm sorry to say that at half the price they blew your 5-star butts away. In short, your rooms are great. I love the renovation. However when staying at a Ritz (justifiably by the price you charge) I expect great service. Having spent a week here you did not deliver. Further, at $400+ a night I don't like getting nickel and dimed for little things. I expect a seamless experience that is hassle free. Even if my company is flipping the bill I can't excuse $30 dollar a day internet, $20 dollar bottles of beer or $45 dollar breakfasts. Pros: -Renovated rooms -Great view of Marina Bay (especially if you're a first timer in Singapore) -Comfortable bed and quiet -Nice pool area Cons: - Expensive internet access. Lame. It's 2011. Every business traveler needs web-access. - Service is not at Ritz standard. There is no personalization, staff don't bother to learn about guests. Unacceptable for a 5-star. Make me feel special. - Not much local advice. If I hadn't lived in Singapore previously I would have felt lost and gotten the impression Singapore was a giant mall. -Limited pedestrian access from the front. You must use driveway with taxis zooming by. This is silly. Overall. Nice inside. Great art collection. But no personalization. I expect to feel special when I stay at a place bearing the Ritz Carlton brand. Will be back in Singapore in 3-weeks. I'm going to consider the new Fort Canning Hotel or maybe the Mandarin this time. No repeat stay at the Ritz - even if "The Man" is paying for it instead of me.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: CleoBs
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley we had only one night stay at the RC Millenia but we couldn't imagine a better ending for our honeymoon. The staff is very friendly and service was excellent, from the moment we arrived till when we left to the airport. Great attention to details, nice message and amenity in the room upon arrival. Our Premier Suite was huge with a stunning view on the Marina. The bed was "too" confortable and we loved the soft bathrobes. Breakfast was delicious. We had the option to use the Spa to take a shower before leaving to the airport for a late flight. Would definately reccomend the RC Millenia Singapore, it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Ah, what can you say, the Ritz carlton”
Reviews.Author: smellyfish
Reviews.Content: there is just something about the Ritz Carlton service which most hotels should try to emulate. I havent stayed here since 2005, and lo and behold, everything is as exquisite as ever. Got myself a Marina View Club room this time, and the view, service, the LED tv, simply superb just wished i had more than the 2 nights here. luxury plus from the coffee machine in room to the bathroom, to all the little stuff will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveler_011
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore quite a bit on business, and I've never had a bad stay in Singapore. That said, the Ritz is definitely one of the top hotels in the city. It's luxurious in every way, and the staff are just the best. The rooms are beautiful, modern, and very well maintained. My last stay there was during F1 week, so the whole city was just buzzing with activity, so it was very nice to get to the Ritz after a long day and just relax and get pampered. The views from the hotel are very nice, the rooms have huge windows in which one can gaze out over the harbor (or the casino). The gym is top notch, well equipped, and opens early and closes late, perfect. I usually stay at the St. Regis, but I may have to start staying here more often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in! I proposed to my girlfriend at this hotel and told the hotel in advance. They upgraded me to a suite with a fantastic view of the Singapore Flyer, the Esplanade and basically all the downtown buildings along the river! They also prepped the room with flower petals and a huge bouquet of flowers to give to my fiance. They basically did everything they could do to make this a most memorable event. The room itself is what you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton hotel. Really nice looking, high end decor and furnishings and an amazing bathroom..definitely a five star property! What sets this Ritz apart from other hotels I've stayed at was that the entire staff were so friendly and accommodating, they really made you feel welcomed and at home. I wanted to give a special thank you to Riri and Jim for making this such a wonderful night to remember for the both of us!

Reviews.Title: “6 Star Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AniWard
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Singapore is outstanding. The rooms have beautiful suites in perfect condition, amenities are beyond what to expect and the service and housekeeping is of top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: This property is expected to excel and it did. I was particularly impressed with the rooms and views. Staff were professional and attentive. Food for breakfast was fine. Lots to do in the area or by short taxi ride. Very impressive overall.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Choices”
Reviews.Author: whmurray
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I have been fortunate on my trips to Singapore to find myself only in extremely well run properties. Perhaps there are no bad ones. After all, Singapore is a five-star park. This trip was for a board meeting. I used my limited influence with the arrangements meeting to choose one of the properties that I had been to before. Instead I simply added one more great property to my list of hard choices of hotels in Singapore. This hotel starts with great architecture. It is a beautiful work of art with lovely room decor and public rooms. The public rooms are spacious and inviting, large enough to provide both company and privacy. Even the bath rooms were special, large, open and with all the amenities. Real walk-in closets. Luxury bedding. It is integrated into its environment so that it is a safe and easy walk to other hotels, restaurants, convention facilities and shopping. When I fumbled with luggage and credentials on arrival, the doorman paid my taxi driver. Not surprisingly, check-in was welcoming and efficient. In fact, everyone on the staff, regardless of role, handled every suggestion of a request through to satisfaction. Wonderful. I no longer carry a computer that will attach by wire. WiFi in my room was not very good. When I inquired, I was moved to different room. Now frequent travelers know that once, settled, changing rooms is often more stressful than what prompts the move. Really great hotels like this one,know how to make it painless. Even departure was exceptional. After late check-out the hotel took responsibility for my comfort until my late evening plane. They took care of arranging my transportation, luggage, and even offered the spa for a late shower and change from business to travel clothes. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world. Most are forgettable. This one is a pleasure to recall.

Reviews.Title: “Its the Ritz, and you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: prince_of_roam
Reviews.Content: Well run, well kept extremely glamorous hotel. Views are fantastic and the quality of the rooms are amazing. Biggest draw are the bathroom with over-sized windows (see pics). The rooms are equipped with a iPOD/ iPhone Dock that allows you to play music, photos and videos right on the TV. The Gym has the latest equipment and the pool is fantastic,

Reviews.Title: “Best Singapore hotel during F1 Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: This is the closest hotel to the F1 paddock and where most of the top F1 protagonists stay (and at the adjacent Mandarin Oriental). The atmosphere in the public areas is great. I particularly enjoyed the outside terrace bar, suitable for cigar smoking. Service is excellent everywhere. The pool is not bad, but it's a little better at the Mandarin. Also, the rooms and in particular those with terraces are better at the Mandarin. Outside the F1 season, I'd probably stay at the Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view. Impressive details of the room and furniture. V relaxing but luxury. Service is not impressive but in ok standard”
Reviews.Author: Praredaa
Reviews.Content: View and location r amazing. Furniture s luxury relaxing clean and the bed s so comfortable. The service s in their standard but not impressive as other hotel in their range.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Trvlbug1974
Reviews.Content: I get a very good corporate rate for this property and am very happy with everything here. The staff are efficient, the rooms are well appointed, there's a big window overlooking the Singapore skyline at the bathtub. Good room service, good buffets. I like the way this hotel is designed, although it's in the city, you feel quite secluded in a way. Walking distance to shopping. Taxis are easily available & they are metered & will provide you receipts and you can also pay by credit card,

Reviews.Title: “Best high tea”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had high tea at The Ritz Carlton as were unable to make a reservation at Raffles. What a wonderful surprise. Welcoming, attentive staff, relaxing environment and the loveliest spread imaginable. What a treat we had. We have had high tea at a number of top hotels around the world and this far surpassed them all. We were staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat isolated, but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DiploConcierge
Reviews.Content: If you like Dale Chihuly’s colorful, undulating glass art, you’re in luck. It’s everywhere, though tasteful. The Ritz is perfectly located for those who love the performing arts. The durian-shaped Esplanade complex is right across the street. Museums are a bit of a hike, however, and there is no easily-accessible metro station nearby. You’ll mostly have to take cabs, which are fine and not terribly expensive, unless it’s rush hour. And there may be a wait for taxis – they’re not always lined up in front of the hotel. So you’ll have to queue, or call. Either way, be prepared to wait, and perhaps you’ll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “A must in Singapore, especially for the Formula1 GP”
Reviews.Author: Arbre_Sage
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Millenia is a palace situated in front of the Marina Bay in Singapore. Run by Ritz Carlton, it is a true five stars hotel. We stayed there for four nights during the Formula1 GP, and we had a Marina Bay Deluxe Room, meaning that our room had an outstanding view on the marina, the skyline, the new Marina Bay Sands hotel, and even the Merlion. The Singapore Flyer is also ver close to the hotel. The room is very spacious, and all furnitures are great - the bed was great too. The bathroom had a bath, and a shower, plus a separate toilet. From the bath, there is a view on the marina - same from the shower (imagine taking a shower in front of Singapore's bay). There is also a flat TV screen with a blu-ray player, a big desk, interne connexion (to be paid) ... All you can expect from such a place. The staff is very friendly, but very busy too. They try to accomodate with your needs. The concierge service was disappointing, but it is true that because of the GP season, he was overbooked. When asking for things, it is delivered. The hotel faclities are great too : swimming pool, bars, restaurants, fitness, etc. The prices are those of a five stars hotel, and especizlly those of a Ritz Carlton place, meaning that this is not for every one. All in all, a fantastic experience there, especially from the room and the scenery visible from it - believe me, sleeping in front of the illuminated skyline is an experience in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful establishment, but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Yau Baby
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a special place in my heart as it was where my wife and I spent part of our honeymoon. We had a fabulous experience then, but haven't returned since. Now 7.5 years later I go back on my own for business. Service is great, and everything looks the same, literally. Nothing wrong with the beautifully designed lobby and the expansive views from the bathtub. But some of the public areas (the gym for instance) is really showing its age. The ceiling vents has dark circles around them, carpets are stained and sockets rusty. Devil is in the details and I spotted a few ugly ones. I really hope the hotel cleans up before I bring my wife back for our tenth anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: vik p
Reviews.Content: The hotel room overlooked the grand Marina sands, and the marina. Great beds, The rooms are comfortably large, and the bathroom, and the bathtub overlooking Singapore was really grand at night with the city lit up. The service was impeccable, and so helpful. The concierge, the lobby staff. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spacious rooms w views, good service”
Reviews.Author: GingerHongKong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in Sep 2011. Was really delighted with the rooms. Their newly decorated stylish rooms all have views, are v spacious and have big bathrooms with great baths with a view. Big work desks, big sofa and the best bed I have slept in for ages... Better than the Westin's heavenly bed! What a great nights sleep. Everything you would expect and need at a five star hotel. Room service was good - prompt and piping hot (good laksa). Check in was a little slow but they were quite full and took some time to choose my room. The buffet food was average for dinner. I would go to Marina Bay Sands for dinner as the quality is better there. The ice cream both thru room service and at the buffet is excellent though. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “upper segment 5 star”
Reviews.Author: listenwell
Reviews.Content: Service good, rooms decoration and hardware are at the upper end of what a 5 star hotel needs to offer today....in high end Singapore. Good view, if your get the right side and elevation. Top connectivity for all gadgets.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ccaruso123
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the ritz twice this year, once with my children in the club suite in jan over new years, the other in march with just my husband, both times very much impressed with everything. Our blackberry was out of battery and we were having trouble charging it, the staff found a special charger and charged it within 1/2hr My favorite is the gym, the change room in the gym and the whole experience is why I continue to return, that and the food Service is 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Tipflex
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Superior across the board (room, service, food, bar etc.). When the person taking care of my room saw I was reading a couple of books, she left a very nice bookmark. Little things... Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “5* factor”
Reviews.Author: BHAVESHPATEL
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got to Singapore and saw our hotel I was more than impressed. In one word amazing. Service was great, rooms and view to die for. I was kicking myself for not staying at the Marina Sandbanks, however after visiting there and seeing the service and queues I was happy at my choice. However its worth visiting the Sandbanks for the sky tower and centre. Highly rated.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KWKW727
Reviews.Content: early checkins. rooms with an uninterrupted panorama of marina bay. peacefully quiet pool. personal service. The sunday champagne brunch is the best in town for free flow moet and mojitos. all round outstanding property. On the down size service can be a little too full on - right down to holding your handbag at checkin (no thanks) and it is still not part of the Ritz Carlton loyalty program.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: VanessaSk14
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable. I was impressed when we arrived and the doormen took our bags - by the time we got to our room, the bags were already there, set in the closet. When we asked the concierge how to get to the subway stop, she walked us halfway there. The room was huge, the bed was so comfy, and the views are beautiful. I liked the coffee machines in the room - very good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The colors of the 80s”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Simply put: I can not recommend it. Singapore has all the options and there are many far better ones. Sure, the staff is fine. But the hotel wins another prize: The one for the most dated and outlived architecture. You know there are places that were built 1880 or 1900 and they're still just wonderful. Unfortunately the post-modernism of the 80s doesn't stand the test of time and that's where Singapore's not so ritzy Ritz comes in. And if you're into colors, well, here's an opportunity to study which ones you shouldn't be using and how not to combine them. Check-in seems an issue at many Ritz-Carltons, they just seem to have too small check-in areas with too few staff. Not a good start for a nice stay having to queue. Apart from that the hotel does for some odd reason not participate in the Marriott Rewards System, so no points and no acknowledgement of your membership status. Anyway, I don't want to be too nasty, the views over the Marina are great (if a bit noisy) and if you can get a corner room, that's even better (and a tad noisier as well).

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite SG Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorochoi
Reviews.Content: I love the amazing views from my room, newly renovated too. Staff was friendly with excellent service, love the swimming pool and hotel location.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury”
Reviews.Author: rabbitloverHk
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) only stayed here for one night so I'm perhaps not the best person to comment on the hotel. However, here are my impressions. The Ritz Carlton Singapore offers huge rooms that could easily accomodate a family of 4. The room finishings are ultra modern and luxurious and really lets you pamper yourself. The views, whether of the city or the marina are stunning. The bathroom is the largest of any hotel I have ever seen and, as mentioned often, the bathtub offers a window through which you can view the Singapore skyline. I thought the pool was excellent. Apart from the main pool, there is also a warm jaccuzzi. The pool is shrouded by lots of trees which gives the feeling of peace and tranquility rather than being in a major metropolis. This is a good place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore. The hotel is connected to a major shopping mall where you can eat cheaply and do your shopping. On the whole, the location is slightly out of the way as its a bit of a walk to the nearest MTR station. Most of the time you'll probably need a taxi to get to most attractions in Singapore. I would say that this is the place to go if you don't mind paying lots of money to pamper yourself in luxury accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Ritz quality service, great views, somewhat lacking location...”
Reviews.Author: Gbabigurl84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend stayed here for an entire week and I joined him on the last two nights before we switched to the Fairmont. The Ritz Millenia offered the standard quality service you'd expect from Ritz (they always address you by name, never let you lift a finger, great you within 5 feet etc) and the grounds were quite pretty with a jungle like driveway and grand lobby (one of the prettiest lobbies I've seen in Singapore). The room was quite fresh and large with AMAZING views. The bathroom view is something they're famous for and it is quite nice but we're not big bath people and the shades were drawn most of the morning. I'm giving 4 stars for the amazing service, size of room, and views but deducting one point for location and ease of getting a cab. The Ritz is an OK walk to/from the Marina Bay Sands shopping center and casino, and some of the water front area, but in regard to more central downtown locations it is somewhat lacking. The location also made it somewhat scarce in obtaining cabs at times, but never a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Hotel Experience in Years”
Reviews.Author: SukhumvitRoad
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the club level and it was the best overall hotel experience I've had in years. The club facilities are very good and the food presentations are generous and even perhaps a bit over the top, but it is the staff there that is so extraordinary. I've spent half my life in top flight international hotels -- at least it feels like half -- and I'm not easily impressed. These folks impressed me. I've stayed in a lot of Singapore hotels and never developed an overwhelming affection for any in particular, but now I'm a fan of the Ritz Carlton for life. Just one thought. Spring for the club level. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_B_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while en-route to our honeymoon destination of the Maldives. The hotel is beautiful and the service is spectacular. I'm not in a business where I get to travel and stay in hotels - but I would imagine this is a hotel where top business people stay... For a honeymoon we probably would have been better off at the Marina Bay Sands. However the Ritz do cater for the honeymooner too - we experienced the Butler Drawn Bath on our first night which was a lovely way to start our vacation. Also, the buffet breakfasts we had each morning while staying at the hotel were AMAZING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tommaso B
Reviews.Content: excellent position for a great hotel , we stay there four times and we will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Look no where else: the Ritz-Carlton Millenia is #1 in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: donSeoul_SouthKorea
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Singapore is in a class of its own. My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of our anniversary vacation. The ladies and gentlemen who work here exceeded all expecations and went far to make our stay here our most memorable moment in Singapore - quite an accomplishment given how amazing Singapore is. The rooms are immaculate. The new rooms have leather paneled walls. Top quality material used in every part of the room. The entire room feels like the interior of an Aston Martin or Rolls Royce. Leather and high quality soft materials everywhere. The bed uses the top quality fabrics, making our sleep one of the most pleasant ever at a hotel. Most of all, the Ritz provides the best view in Singapore. It is one of the few hotels that offer a full wall view of both the Marina Bay Sands and Raffles Place in a single view. The full wall view exists in the bath as well, providing for an amazingly romantic experience. Service is brilliant. Upon finding out about our anniversary, managment hand delivered a gourmet cake and fruit basket to our room, along with personally signed card. This was most well-timed since we had friends over to enjoy the view over bubbly. I'm figuring my friends were as impressed by this as much as we were. The management also made it their job to satisfy our every desire. The restaurant responded immediately to a slight comment I made about slow coffee service during breakfast. The next morning, it was abundantly clear that management listened and made sure my delicious coffee was re-filled at moments notice. Recognition must be given to the Greenhouse manager Mr. Calvin Lim and his staff. There are many aspects about the Ritz-Cartlon that I want to mention but I will defer that to other travellers since I am certain that they will make equally splendid remarks about the hotel. I did split my trip between two of the finest hotels in Singapore. If I had to choose a winner, it would be the Ritz-Carlton hands down. I regret not having stayed here my entire trip and I will definitely be returning here my next trip down to Singapore. 10/10 in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel. Great service. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jazzhou
Reviews.Content: We had a two-day conference at the Marina Bay Sands. Since the conference organizer didn't offer free room or special room rate at the Marina Bay Sands, we looked for an alternative in the vicinity. Usually we wouldn't have thought of staying at a Ritz-Carlton because of the rates. I'm glad that I looked into it at the last minute and found a special package rate that fell within our company's travel expense policy. And, it was only a short walk across the Double Helix Bridge from the Marina Bay Sands hotel/shopping mall/conference complex, and close to the central business district. The rooms were spacious and the view from the rooms was spectacular. We were on a Club Level Package rate, which permitted having breakfast in the Club Lounge on the 32nd floor. We were surprised to find more than just Continental breakfast was served as the package description stated. It offered made-to-order egg dishes, with other hot breakfast items. Favorable impression of its service started before our arrival when I communicated with reservations regarding our room type preferences. Even though at the end we couldn't have what was originally requested and confirmed on our confirmations, the issue was solved apologetically and satisfactorily. In short, it's a great hotel befits the Ritz-Carlton reputation. I only wished this property participated in the Marriott Rewards or the Ritz-Carlton Rewards program. We could have earned lots of points/miles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: abeb1900
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton twice in May for a total of five nights. The check-in experience was great, and the staff very attentive and friendly. On both occasions I had a fantastic view from my room. And no matter how busy things were in the morning, breakfast was a pleasant experience with great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: Ratio3533
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review almost one year late. But thought I should record our satisfaction with the Ritz Singapore. We travelled with our two kids to visit Singapore, Universal Studios etc. Great trip. The hotel was truly first class and we loved the room (huge with bath tub w/ a view!) as well as all the children amenities - extra stroller, toys to play with etc. The buffet breakfast is probably one of the best I have ever eaten - what a selection! Kids ate free as well which was a nice added touch. Greeted everywhere with a smile - the pool was out of this world also. We didn't eat any meals in the hotel as we were out and about, but all the restaurants were filled with happy customers so I think they have sorted that side of things. The only slight slight drawback was the location - but that is not anyone's fault. Bit of a trek to the nearest MRT stop (although it is covered all the way to Suntec/Raffles City/Esplanade) so we found taking taxis the easiest option (which are not always available!). But that's it. Great hotel and I hope to be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Utter dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: LWKJ
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Ritz on special occasions with my family all these years and have been a great fan.... Until now. We checked in in the afternoon and my toddler was taking his nap when a staff knocked to check the mini bar in the afternoon! Immediately after that, came an incessant hammering of tiles in the room above our floor. Probably some renovation works. I made more than 5 calls to the front desk to request for the noise and activity to stop but it kept going on and on for over 20 minutes. I requested to speak to the GM but they said the GM is overseas. The operator said a manager will be going up to see me but I repeated that my son is sleeping and I will go to the front desk to talk to the person in charge. But meanwhile, stop the renovation works for the 5 th time! I do not understand how come we have been allocated to a room under one that is undergoing major renovation and I do not understand how difficult it is to have someone go upstairs personally to tell the contractor to stop work instead of calling the security, calling housekeeping, calling the director of engineering etc. Utter failure in service and my son missed his nap.

Reviews.Title: “A superb week of luxury! We will return!”
Reviews.Author: laced
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel at all. ALL the hotel staff were very attentive at all times. We were welcomed in and out of the hotel on every occasion;nothing was a trouble. Any requests were handled promptly. When we booked our Qantas Holiday in March, I mentioned that the trip was to celebrate a special birthday for me. When we arrived in our hotel room, there was a small birthday cake and a personalised scroll signed by the Management - a lovely touch and very much appreciated. Breakfast at the Greenhouse each morning was a delight - such a wide variety of international food which would please just about anyone. Excellent facilities in all areas of the hotel including the swimming pool, gym etc. Powered night and day blinds in the room, lockable mini-bar cabinet, very comfortable bedding, choice of shower head in the shower recess, the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great !”
Reviews.Author: LarryWong
Reviews.Content: Location: you can access to MRT, different malls on foot through covered foot bridges or underground walkway. There are plenty of malls, restaurants, duck tour, Flyer, Food Trial and Sands are within walking distance. Cleanliness: the floor of my room is dirty, I have to wear slippers. Other hotel facilities are good though. Room size: Big. Swimming Pool: 1.4M depth which is good for kids Gym: Equipments are new and adequate With the room rate that I paid, it is average in standard when comparing to other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: michwong
Reviews.Content: From the moment of our arrival to the time of our departure, we were provided with excellent service from the hotel staff. We travelled with a toddler and the staff were very careful and thoughtful to ensure that we were comfortable - even whilst waiting for our room to be ready (as we arrived much earlier than the allowed check-in time). The rooms are very spacious (by Singapore standard), amenities were excellent and we had the view facing the Marina Bay Sands - which was excellent. The blinds in the room were automated. My only complaint would be that the hotel should have another thicker/ non-light penetrative blind for the bathroom. There's currently a thin day blind which works well for the day but for the night, use of the bath-tub will show sexy silhouettes from MBS! Buffet breakfast at the Ritz was excellent. A generous and delicious spread and attentive service. Location is about 10 minutes walk to the Singapore Flyer (where there's also a good spread of yummy hawker fare at slightly premium prices) and about 15 minutes walk via the Helix Bridge to Marina Bay Sands Mall. The Ritz is also connected to Marina Square and subsequently to Suntec City. Given another opportunity for a nice luxurious holiday, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: cashman83
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a luxury retreat in Singapore book your stay at the Ritz. The rooms are excellent and the staff goes above and beyond from check in to check out. The workout facility is well above average for a hotel gym and the adjacent pool is amazing. If you are given access to the Carlton Club for breakfast made to order eggs are available (unlike most hotel executive breakfast lounges). The only drawback to this hotel is the price but the service and accommodation is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Always Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Camerong
Reviews.Content: I’m staying in room 2025. Great gym, spa, views and I would highly recommend the Chinese restaurant in the Ritz. The rooms are large with great views of Singapore, large bathrooms and up with the best city hotels. 10 minutes walk to boat quay, city office and lau pa sat hawkers market. Great running tracks and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience, value....”
Reviews.Author: gul1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights watching the National Day parade, fireworks, etc over Marina Bay... We were given a 100m2 1-bedroom suite with all the exec-club benefits, privileges you can imagine. The hotel was 100% full during this period but service and attention to detail was amazing - staff were at their best despite the pressures of a fullly occupied hotel... This Ritz Carlton property delivered at it's best.

Reviews.Title: “Snooze away”
Reviews.Author: Jasmineeee
Reviews.Content: Another stay-cation with the family. Stayed here for 2 nights. Room was spacious & personal (unlike MBS, that was spacious but leaves you feeling empty), view was fantastic (had a room that faced the singapore river, mbs, fullton etc), beds were extremely comfy, slept like a pig for the 2 nights, was sad when i had to check out. The toilet was also nice & spacious, chocolates on the table was a nice touch, its the little things that count right? Morning breakfast was absolutely yummy! looked forward to it the 2nd morning. I didn't manage to try the pool but i did try out the gym! It was great! I went to the machine and before i could begin, a guy came running up to me to pass me a bottle of water and towel. I thought that was nice of him to do seeing i was empty-handed. Overall, I would definitely recommend people to stay here. Great location, great service, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back even after a somewhat disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: mag_ty
Reviews.Content: Ritz is one of the places we always narrow down for our regular staycations in Singapore. It was a Fireworks Fiesta package (timed with the National Day Rehearsal fireworks). What went well: the view on 22nd floor of the Marina Bay area was SPECTACULAR! I had some great shots of the fireworks that went on for the NDP rehearsal. I posted one to show how great the room was. What was disappointing: The late check-in (2.5 hours), the inability of staff to ensure that all guests were able to wait in comfort, the 'not so clean' floor of the room, the inability to get into the restaurant for our breakfast as there were 20 persons in line Why would I come back again? The front desk apologized for the late check-in & quickly extended my stay till 6p.m. the next day. The quick recovery action of the front desk manager in offering his apologies after feedback was sent. As such, Ritz will continue to be my choice for a staycation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Thuis place was really different”
Reviews.Author: Ericscott
Reviews.Content: The laat time I went to Singapore instead of staying downtown as we usually do, my wife and I stayed a hotel that really is different – the Ritz Carlton Millenia on Raffles Avenue. It’s a 32-storey luxury hotel located in Marina Bay, next to the Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay. Its ten minutes walk from the Orchard Street shops and only twenty minute taxi ride from the airport. And the walls are adorned with more than 4000 original pieces of modern art. It’s quite something to see great art at every turn, from the bedroom to the bars. We arrived at nine at night and were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome we received; everyone knew our names, no matter which floor or part of the hotel we visited. It was a welcome guaranteed to make you feel loved and important! It was very impressive – and the service lived up to that standard throughout our stay. We were taken up to the 26th floor to a Premier Suite, marvellous accommodation with access to the Club Lounge, When we arrived our body clock was lagging four hours we decided to drop into the Club Lounge and have a few nibbles and glasses of Moet before turning in for a duty free night cap in our luxury lounge and watch a movie on the 32 inch TV. The suite itself was the epitome of luxury and certainly ranks in the top five of rooms I’ve stayed in, with 60 square metres of space, and an enormous bedroom which came compete with TV set and walk in wardrobe. When tiredness eventually set we sank into the huge king-sized bed with feather mattress, goose down doona, extra large king pillows and white cotton sateen sheets. The bathroom was equally impressive, with double wash basins, separate two-person shower, and a huge bath that sat in front of the one-way mirror windows that let guests see out and no-one see in. Not that it mattered much on the 26th floor. And all set in black marble, My wife was quick to comment on how good the toiletries were – White Tea by Bvlgari, no less Add to this the separate toilet and large walk-in wardrobe and lap-top size safe The lounge room was even bigger than the bedroom with a spectacular view over the bay, comfortable settee and chairs, plus the super flat screen TV. There were wine glasses to suit every drink, vases of live orchids and of course the complimentary fruit bowl. The hotel is close to the site of the new billion dollar resort and casino right next to the “Singapore Flyer” a massive Ferris wheel which is Singapore’s answer to the London Eye. We could see these icons from the windows of the suite. It’s worth an upgrade to club class for in the lounge up on the 32nd floor you get 360-degree views of the city-state from panoramic windows, eat complimentary breakfast and enjoy up to five different dining experienced during the day – champagne breakfast, mid-day snacks, afternoon tea, hors d’oeuvre cocktails, and chocolates with cordials in the evening, After a day out in the shops or sightseeing it’s a great place to have a nightcap and check out the views of the Marina Bay lights. There’s even a private meeting room, which can accommodate up to eight, business centre services, free wireless broadband and a library. Nevertheless, we ate dinner on the lower floors in The Summer Pavilion for a signature Cantonese meal. You can do your shopping without leaving the air conditioning if you want to. A few metres from the hotel lobby is the Millennium Centre that links to several huge shopping arcades. On our final morning we did a thousand or so steps around the centre before picking up the complimentary Straits Times and settling by the pool until it was time to to leave this lovely oasis of comfort for our journey back to Brisbane.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...I would go back in the morning!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilikechocolate25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of July 2011. On arrival we were greeted at the door, our bags taken and delivered to our room. There was an issue with a tile in our bathroom, so we were escorted to our room and shown the problem. Which we wouldn't have noticed but they were unhappy about it, but they were fully booked and so for the inconvenience they upgraded us to a premium suite for the second night. This included use of the club lounge on the 32nd floor. Both the room and the suite were amazing, the bath had its own octagonal window with fab views. The food in the hotel was fantastic but it was the service that really was top class. We were flying late on our second day and were offered to the use of the leisure centre to shower when we returned for our bags. We were also encouraged to use the club lounge again for as long as we needed. The shower was something that we hadn't thought of but having been to Singapore now, we understand why they offered us this option, the humidity is unreal,

Reviews.Title: “One of best Ritz Carlton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: AZGuys
Reviews.Content: The executive level service was over the top food and drink always available. Great Bathrooms with a nice big window over tub. Sunday buffet lunch, although rather expensive was well worth the price, and absolutely no extras except for tip.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently outstanding”
Reviews.Author: voyageur à paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favourites. I've been staying here on my trips to Singapore for over 10 years. This property has aged exceptionally well. Rooms have been recently renovated and the result is outstanding. As a return visitor to this property, I am welcomed back like a returning family member, and that's a nice touch. At this hotel, porters appear from nowhere, doors are opened, and there are smiles and hellos everywhere. The rooms are very well equipped with all the latest comforts - wide screen television, a vast choice of enterntainment options, electronic window shades, espresso machines. Then there are the plusses: a full set of office/work accessories such as post-its, a stapler, a highlighter -- not that this make a huge difference but the attention to this type of detail is exceptional. There are plenty of electric outlets in the rooms and suites, and I particularly appreciate the bedside controls that allow you command the entire room (or suite) without having to get up. The bathrooms are spacious and the bay windows are great for watching the city as you have a end of day soak. The hotel is well located. It's a 5 minute walk to the new casino complex, and is connected to the vast Millenia mall and close to Suntec city. Boat Quay is a 10 minute walk - although no one seems to walk alot in Singapore. Finally, the hotel has a great pool area, adjacent to the only average aspect of the ensemble: the gym. A few more cardio machines, especially for the morning "rush" would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Sound proofing issues, too big a hotel for them to manage/service, very crowded...”
Reviews.Author: kizzcat
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the good things: - Great location, walkable distance to Marina Bay Sands across the bridge, next to Mandarin Oriental, Pan Pacific, Conrad...etc., afterwall Singapore is small. - Staff are generally helpful and smiing. Shame that it seems that the hotel is too big and however much the staff tried to help, it only seemed not enough and there're not much room/resources to go the extra mile to meet rhe Ritz Carlton expectations. - Good & clean rooms (sort of newly renovated) with great view, spacious. - Excellent room service food. - Lovely pool area and good gym room. - Concierge team very capable and helpful. Efficient service especially Ronald whom have made a few reservations for us and good recommendations on Spa and restaurants (thank you). Not so good... - Outrageously expensive room service food plus surcharges?! SGD5 for each order for room service, I have never seen there're surcharges added on top of ordering room service food plus all other service and taxes?! (Although the food is great, Nasi Goreng to die for and Laksa) - Unattentive service (although friendly), just not the usual Ritz experience. - Often crowded and packed with people everywhere! - Sound proof is BAD. Can hear everything that happens in the corridor and upstaris...I found it quite shocking in a hotel this class for this to happen. - 'Newly renovated rooms' are already aging and tiring out...!?
