Found stains and paints falling off... - They forgot to turn down our room one evening (not a big deal but fyi this 'can' happen.) - Breakfast not worth waking up early for...often CROWDED and had to queue for 5 - 10 minutes at the egg station...both chicken and pork sausages had cheese stuffed into them..?! Bacon extremely oily...generally just stick to the pain au chocolat and croissant. Limited selection of food. - Pillows too soft, most mornings I woke up with with neck pain. - TV at an odd angle to bed. - No free WIFI in room! - No music/sound player/speakers. All in all it was a pleasant stay but I had a choice between staying there, Four Seasons and Naumi and I must say I regretted choosing Ritz Carlton... Had such great experiences at other Ritz hotels worldwide and this time certainly was disappointing and I think I will be choosing other hotel chains next time when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST !!”
Reviews.Author: amirali10
Reviews.Content: Wow ! what a hotel ! We stayed here for 6 nights during our last months family vacation and all of us just loved the Ritz - my kids are still missing it ... The size of their Deluxe room is 51m2 which was super huge - especially for Singapore. It was very luxurious and very comfortable for the 2 of us and our 2 young kids (6 and 2 years). We specially liked the window next to the bathtub, meant that we could actually enjoy the view while taking a bubble bath - and the bath comes complete with a head resting pillow !! Special thanks to Michelle (Reservations dept) for the complimentary Extra bed during our stay. Very friendly service from everyone specially the concierge made us feel at home. Great job you guys - keep it up !! No doubt about where we will stay next time ...

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with awesome views”
Reviews.Author: xtne
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Ritz Carlton was at a Marnia Bay facing Club Room on the 31st floor, it had great views of the bay area. For this stay, we got a suite at a corner on the 20th floor. Now Im torn on which room is better :) Nonetheless, the stay was as luxurious. From the Aqua di Parma toiletries, Nespresso machine with different capsules and the very soft bathrobes (I just wish they had it in Asian sizes too). The staff were very attentive to our needs, from the lobby all the way to the room. When they noticed that my daughter was getting bored, while waiting to get checked in, the staff gave her crayons and a coloring book. When my husband was trying to blow air into my daughter's floater, one got an air pump for us. I just wish they had a nice water play area near the pool for kids. In both our stay, there were always kids playing in the pool and sometimes they can go all over the place and cross those who are doing laps. Did I mention that the bed was glorious?Just the right firmness for us and there's an option of different kinds of pillow too. I have seem to read a review that says something about views of the F1 track. Yes their rooms have great views of it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideSC021
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, the room was fantastic with a fabulous view. Pool was magnificent and the regular service of cold towels and fruit skewers was great. We arrived early in the morning from our flight and were given our room straight away which was much appreciated. All staff were very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat place for a rest”
Reviews.Author: BeachFamily00
Reviews.Content: We use Singapore as an Island resort. The weather was 25 to 32 degrees. Little rain. On a smaller island you are stuck with a small number of resturants. On the island of Singapore you have 1,000's of places to choose from. The Ritz Carlton has a great pool that is not busy. The staff at the hotel are great. The food is varied & of a great standard. If you get sick of the Summer Parvilon you only have to step out the back door to the Marina shopping complex to find 20 other outlets. When choosing accomadation consider the club option. Break ,Lunch , dinner & drinks are served there & can cut cost a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NicoWawa
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Ritz Carlton was excellent! I spent 2 weeks there and I really felt like home The service was professional with a great attention regarding every part of your stay. Rooms view is breathtaking! The breakfast was delicious with a great variety of products. The swimming pool is beautiful. You're just 5 min by car from Marina Bay Sand and 10min from the city center. I will definitely come back there during my next stays in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: ABSViews
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Ritz as a stopover on our way to Thailand. We really enjoyed our experience there. Our room was very spacious with uninterrupted views over the Bay and Raffles area. The bathroom was great - we loved the view from the bath!. There are two shopping malls attached to the Hotel and an MRT station across the road making it easy for transport as it isn't the most conveniently located hotel around. The hotel was full yet the service did not falter. The staff were attentive and helpful. We enjoyed the delicious champagne brunch on Sunday - especially the foie gras tarts and free flowing 2002 Moet & Chandon. Yes, it was expensive ($12 coffee...) but overall we really enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate in recommending it to others (who can afford it).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: chbusytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights over a weekend, not for the first time; had quite a few service flaws which should not happen in a hotel of this standard. To mention a few: a problem having breakfast on Saturday or Sunday morning (as a hotel guest I could not get a table - nearby Mandarin Oriental was no problem). Pool area (part) was closed on Saturday at 4 pm and I could not get another chair (staff did not help at all, only commanded my away); another problem with the room being cleaned; another problem with not accurate front desk information, not great in treatment of repeat guests (vs other hotels), etc. etc. Compensating above, the hotel is very nice, conveniently located, some staff is very efficient, hence still an average rating.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will stay there again and again”
Reviews.Author: lvet0travel
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel in Singapure. The location is great. The rooms are some of the best of any hotels that I have ever stayed in and the views (bay view) are out of this world. The service was impeccable, specially Karen(the front lobby little karen) who became like a family member after only a few hours. the breakfast is great. Just be aware of the Maxi Cab which will cost $45 regardless of where you go so its great if you are going to the zoo or the airport but 5-10 times as much if you are just going to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “5 star view. 1 star internet. Great food!”
Reviews.Author: mjc1959
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver told us it was a six star hotel. Hmmm, it could rank as a 5 star hotel but in a 5 star hotel, everything is painless. It doesn't have to be superb or extravagant but you shouldn't have to worry about anything and any issue should be taken care of immediately. In which case this is a 2 star hotel in a 5 star location. The ritz carlton looks out over a beautiful marina, the restaurants are great, the rooms are pretty good -- but the internet access is just a money grabbing exercise that is beyond painful. The internet is a big part of my life (for better or worse) and in a 5 star hotel I should just hit "connect" and have access. I have four devices - ipad, laptop and two phones. For $30 a day i can buy a 3g sim card for each of them but most hotels you don't need to. The Ritz makes you go through four pages of "I agree," "purchase," "confirm your purchase" ad infinitum. Even that might be bearable if it worked and you had to do it just once. But no, I had to turn off wifi to get cable access. I had to enable pop ups to get wifi access and on a portable device it is just beyond painful. All in all I made seven phone calls during two days - the response was slow and in three cases non-existent, and I had to call again. By the time I left, I was simply stressed out. Why not just add $30 to my nightly rate? It felt like penny pinching gone mad. I am writing this from the garden hotel in guangzhou and even though those guys know how ti charge for any and everything, internet access is simple and free. I don't have a home. I live in hotels 12 months each year. I am a good customer most of the time. :) I will never again stay at that ritz or any other ritz. I will send a copy of this to ritz carlton general management. I just feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Service level gone done”
Reviews.Author: dtai010
Reviews.Content: I am normally quite satisfied with 5 star hotels in Singapore, but this time, the service was shocking. Arrived at 11:30pm, a bit late but there is only few guests in the lobby area at this hour. To start with, when I got off the taxi, not only that there is no one helping with the luggage, there is no one at the door at all. It's not automatic door, so I have to juggle with the door and luggage by myself. After I come in, I am not sure which way to the reception, and there is no one on sight who can offer direction. Then I went into the wrong direction, and was "politely" pointed the right direction. Finally I got to reception, when I was checking in, I see hotel staff walking the new guests in. I suppose this is the typical service one should get here, but where were they when I arrived?? Now checking in takes 10 mins, it starts with they overbooked my stay even after I made correction request. This part is fine, common mistake. I was then told they booked me in smoking room by mistake and will change it to non-smoking room for me. This is ok, but why does it take 5min to do this? While I was waiting, she was there chatting and talking with the guy next to her. All in all, this is a bad start of my experience in this hotel, the rest is fine, great room, clean, spacious etc. But for a 5 star hotel, this level of service is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “First Class in Marina Bay”
Reviews.Author: Oharn
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Singapore wakeboarding, seeing friends, shopping and just pure enjoying the place. Stayed the first two nights at Marina bay sands which was O.K. for that wow factor but the rest of my stay was in a magnificent room in the Ritz Carlton. From the moment you arrive at the front door into the lobby you really are treated as someone special. The room was fantastic, large, comfortable & superb facilities at your fingertips. The view from the bath itself was awesome! As usual the drinks & food are pricey (But of high quality) the breakfast each morning was superb, pretty much tried everything! My first stay here but definately not my last. Has even inspired me to stay at other Ritz Carlton locations.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever visited in Asia!”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Katharine - Guest relations on the registration desk on the day we arrived from the UK. We were tired and very early 9am - with check in not usually until 2pm. We'd even managed to misplace our booking information - nothing was too much trouble for her. Katharine was so helpful and friendly - found us an available room (a suite which we happily paid a little extra for), then guided us to the room/ showed us all the features and left us to rest. The room itself was just divine!! fantastic views/ luxuriously furnished/ spotlessly clean with huge fluffy white towels and quality toiletries! We simply cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was and how much we love this hotel. Every staff member is friendly and helpful and every part of the hotel is clean and comfortable to be in. We so look forward to our next visit to Singapore and stay at the Ritz Carlton Millenia. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: eriktera
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The rooms are immaculate and huge. The views are fantastic. The sheets are deliciously soft and smooth. Every hotel staff person meets and greets you with a sincere smile, hello, how are you today. All of my requests from the room (bathroom scale, peppermint tea, more chocolates, Ipod remote) were attended to within five minutes of my call. I've never seen room service so prompt. The gym was enormous with exercise equipment of every type. The lobby entertainment was subtle, unassuming, and gorgeous. It really is a pleasure to stay here at the "Ritz." I'll be back there every time that I can. My only complaint would be the cost of the buffet breakfast. $55 SGD is too pricey for my blood, and after the first morning, I walked over the mall next door for food. I was always happy and welcomed back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Time for an updated review from old fans..hmm”
Reviews.Author: TruebritSingapore
Reviews.Content: We've lived in Asia (mostly Singapore) for 12 years and it's one of our favourite hotels: we stay here, and have Christmas dinner pretty much every year. The staff are probably the best we've encountered, and as usual during our recent 2 week stay prior to leaving for good they were incredibly attentive. The rooms are wonderful, views can't be beaten, and the bathrooms..well, many reviewers have already said, they are amazing. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again but for one thing: suddenly, the price of incidentals has absolutely skyrocketed. It's ironic since the room rates are still very fair given the space, comfort, and service. But the in-room dining options are now absolutely ridiculous, and totally unjustifiable. Until recently one could always indulge in a late night bite to eat with drinks at a reasonable cost, so I don't know what's happened..perhaps we're indirectly paying for the recent bathroom upgrades. I won't embarrass the management by pasting the price of a small beer in this review (and that was before the triple plus !), but I was sorely tempted..let's see if there's a response to this message. Summary: stay for the rooms and staff, but my goodness beware the incidental costs. Shame...

Reviews.Title: “An all time favorite ... Slipping ever so slightly”
Reviews.Author: discovermore
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Singapore hotel and has been for a while. There is plenty going for it - grand, tasteful, great public spaces, nice pool, good rooms and light, great club floor and lounge, good restaurants and pride in cleanliness. Two things bothered me on my latest trip. The first was the noise from the open air stage on the marina and the traffic to the casino, the price of continued development of the area (and I was on a very high floor). The second was the seeming lapses in historically good service, for example, the inability to speed up check-in and check-out. I am not sure what it is but check-in was a 25 minute charade of going from front desk where I was front of queue to the club lounge where I waited 10 minutes for someone to show up. check out at the crack of dawn with no one in line took 15 minutes as some rookie fumbled through the steps while I needed to get off to the airport. I think symptomatic of a shift in mindset from service performance to service presence. I would not normally whine, but at this price point I need performance not smiles and bows!

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you don't mind spending a pretty penny”
Reviews.Author: JuliaVanderbilt
Reviews.Content: Let's get it off our chest right away--the Ritz Carlton is rather expensive in an expensive city to begin with. But once you've gotten over the hump of paying top dollar, you realize you get what you pay for. As it is, I found an excellent Club Room rate via Booking.com and was thoroughly pleased with my experience. I arrived at 1 pm and was told my room would be ready at around 230. Not very pleasant but I didn't want to be bothered. I dropped off my bag and walked to the adjacent mall...thirty minutes later, I got a call on my cellphone, saying my room was ready. I was brought to the 2nd highest floor in the building, the 31st and was shown the works. Looking at the pictures, you might think with all the beiges and pale woods that it's mostly plain and straight-forward design, almost Swedish in coldness. I'm here to tell you that the pictures do no justice to the finesse of materials and finish of the furnishings. Walls were covered in plush leather like coverings, the wood work was lacquered and burnished to high shine. The bathroom was immense with the most thoughtful of extras: a ziplock bag for carry-on toiletries, delicate face soaps alongside sturdier bath soaps, a bath tub pillow. The bathrobe was plush and warm at the same time, definitely tempting to take home. And yes, the slippers were the comfiest I had ever seen in an airconditioned room (not sure they will fare well in more humid climes). My rate included free Wifi which worked well and club access which was well worth every penny. The food offerings on the club floor were nonstop; from breakfast buffets to afternoon tea, to late evening chocolates and cordials. I enjoyed it a few times and cheered and toasted the view across to Marina Bay Sands. The pool is rather uninspired in this day and age of massive pools--but at least it was big and uncrowded and towels galore. The gym was quite complete and was hardly ever occupied when I was there. Public spaces were taken over by some giant business conference--suits pretty much filled the elevators at all hours but what can one do? If ever there was a gripe--it was with my toilet. It leaked on the first day. Engineering came quickly enough to fix it. However, the sorest point was left to discover late at night when I would hear the pipes from other rooms whooshing away. In mid-sleep one hardly wishes to be bothered--I reckoned my neighbors were away most of the daytime, but at night, the plumbing could be heard. Rather unacceptable in a room and rate of this level. Check out was smoothly handled on the club floor. I took a cab to the airport which took all of 17 minutes. A few days after I had filled up a review from the RC, I got a letter from the Manager apologizing for the plumbing with a kind offer to redress my discomfiture. I thought that was a great response and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Perfect with newly renovated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mandelmale
Reviews.Content: This first-class hotel is an important part of our memories. I proposed to my then fiancee 3 years ago, had our anniversary here and we were back as frequently as possible whenever we are on leave. The rooms before and after renovation appeal to me in their own ways and the service of the staff was excellent. Nothing was impossible for them, it is always a "I will see to it" for our requests. The food quality of room service, their Greenhouse and Summer Pavilion maintained their top notched level. As long as we do not have holidays overseas we will always come here to relax ourselves, immersing in the aura of Ritz-Carlton. I strongly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Should not arrive or depart hotel by subway”
Reviews.Author: oncati
Reviews.Content: Should not arrive or depart hotel by subway. I will try to write the most creative  and soft to this review!!  Overall this hotel is great all  *room (just renovate)    -very very huge ,can put six 3.5 feet bed inside)    - 2 metres sofa, big work station confront window( fax machine ) , new wood floor scent , very smooth carpet.    - about 5 metre window(very big) almost ceiling to floor.    - 46 inch in wall LED samsung TV and DVD player with iPod charger on work station.    - full snack bar and ice in ice box and coffee capsule maker.    - full lie down bath tube with marina bay view and giant mirror made 180 degree view of marina bay(no TV)     - separate shower with tube ( rain shower head and old style big shower head) , no bidet.    -full not brand name toiletries with spa sensation. * Cleanliness : Some stain of floor. This room just renovate, isn't it? (5 year old Mandarin oriental Tokyo so much better or 4 star Sheraton Hong Kong hotel is perfect clean)) * location (  promenade subway station exitA just behind hotel with marina bay view close to Marina bay sands just few walk.) * restaurant. (the most delicious scone available here)  * leisure:    - huge swimming pool ( it in tower shadow in the morning until noon )    - tropical garden feel like in oasis very perfect.    - well equipped fitness , sauna and steam room with fruit and lemon and orange in fresh water. And had shaving kit and men grooming ( except dental kit)    **5-6 star level hotel why not ever see in  the list to top of world hotel as Four seasons, Mandarin Oriental or Peninsula hotel? Yes, I try to find out why ? The answer is many tiny flaw. But assemble be big problem. That you should know and accept before check in in this hotel Such as 1.Arrival and departure flaw   - no upcoming message to me.   - location of this hotel is the best,the most beautiful marina bay view , promenade subway station just only behind across 4lane one way road * However,  I can't find entrance from the back door. No any sign board or staff to help you.  I ask available staff but no proper answer and help ( first staff : lobby in 3rd floor you can go by elevator (where?) ( second : this lift is out of order you should go by walk up by stair case , with Luggage???? This six star hotel). Very lucky that  the door of grand ballroom  opened  ( during decoration) I walk through and take the elevator to 3rd floor with myself) 2.Service flaw  - staff of this chain hotels call " ladies and Gentlemen serve ladies an gentlemens". This sentence made me decide select one to recieve this service. - when I touch to professional L&G. I feel special and true different other 6 star hotel . when i arrived to Lobby  from nervous @1st floor . Amaze with multiple separate counter L&G lead me to true Front with smile face in her eyes and lips. Introduce my room high as I request ( upgrade to club level floor ) and point to lift that I will go. ( no L&G came with me to introduce room ) and no wifi service introduce. - turn down service staff is very humble work very well in their job. - the conceirge is very best . I question the best way when I go to subway. Gentleman introduce and walk with me until end of hotel roof to point the way( the answer is  millennia walk through the PARCO mall). And when I receive my luggage (again I cannot find luggage-keeping area(it situate outside the hotel entrance). Lady in conceirge go for me to pick up luggage ( but cannot find luggage because staff in bell area are not there. I must go to find with myself and she made apologize ) - check out service  , I can wait queue it had gold tank of water and juice and glass with self service. L&G look busy and arrange me to right queue . At the  last sentence not is farewell and please visit again but only phrase " NEXT PERSON " I love this hotel. So MUCH . But I should consider myself that deserve to receive Ladies and Gentlemen service again or not. 3.room flaw  - no welcome amenities (fruit or chocolate or gift box) - no greeting card, have letter about restaurant , breakfast service but to other people , not to me) -no manual to introduce room ( you must find out switch light curtain blind or any thing by yourself as hide and seek , curtain &blind switch are at bed head. - No featherbed as described in Internet and after send request , their bed made some hurt to me in the morning. - toiletries not is brand name. Distribute by hotels supply. 4.Restaurant flaw. At afternoon tea. I taste the best scone here. But very take time between tea and scones. L&G look continue work ( <5 persons) when I call and question about my dish . She came with it suddenly. I think this is problem about quantity of staff ( is not quality)[K' Shiki restaurant of Mandarin oriental Tokyo can serve 4 course lunch menu< half hour] All this flaws ruin reputation of Ritz-Carlton hotel chain. If you did not want this problem should use car for arrival and depart. Believe me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder staycation 2nd time round”
Reviews.Author: LLY1
Reviews.Content: Big rooms with warm tones and big windows. Fantastic view of Singapore skyline. The bathrooms have the perfect fengshui. :-) With so many competing hotels in the area, it stands out with its exclusivity and value. Extra points for providing children amenities and menus. RC Millenia SG needs to upkeep the quality of front line staff, consistency and "the personal touch" to continue to stand out. For the 2 stays, we had encountered a few "doe-eyed" staff that needed some prompting for our requests. Nevertheless my 2 young children and husband are still wondering when we'll have our 3rd staycation in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Scott1734
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is an amazing hotel. The rooms are very spacious and are extremely well appointed. The high speed internet is extremely fast and the wireless connectivity is good throughout the hotel. The service is top notch and the breakfast croissants are amazing. The buffet breakfast is a little on the pricey side but the chef makes an excellent omelet. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: Philmar501
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the VIP or CIP service at the airport offered through the hotel and there began our 5 day luxury break....I felt so relaxed and looked after I can't tell you how lovely it was and it got better. The room was a suite with 3 rooms overlooking the bay with a fabulous view of the new marina sands hotel. Although the room was a tiny bit dated it was magnificent so clean and just breathtaking. Service impeccable. Can't fault a single thing. The club (which comes with some rooms) was amazing food was incredible, breakfasts were fantastic. A literally 2 minute walk to marina shopping centre and 5 minute walk to marina sands shopping centre it's a great location. We'll definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5 star experience... typical biz hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voondawg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference for 3 days and 4 nights in June, and this was my third stay here. As always, I'll address my gripes first, as those are what are most concerning to readers. Cons: No hallway to allow for privacy once doors are open... I like the way that there is hallway that leads to the bedroom area in a normal hotel room, but the doors in most standard deluxe rooms opens right into the sleeping area, with the bed right next to the doorway. Also, I find that the doors do not shut very easily. To the hotels credit, they on three occasions stopped by to notify me that the door was not fully closed, but I think that the engineers should ensure that doors that swing shut, should do so. Add the first two points together, and it's not a very comfortable room arrangement. Tough to find the safe. Slight mustiness/funny smell. I was in Room 2319. I would get the view facing the other way looking at Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer if I had a choice. Probably odd #s. Pros: 46" Samsung LED TV. Good blackout curtains. View of Singapore, both Marina Bay side, and other. Bathroom does offer a great view from the bathtub. Full toiletries. Easy entry with keyless card that does not need to be swiped. Ample electrical hookups, including bedside which allowed me to hook up my CPAP machine, which was very helpful. Service was regular and efficient. Gym was not quite 24 hours, but was a decent gym with clean equipment, with full tech on the bikes/ellipticals/treadmills. Trainers greet you by name which they glean from your sign-in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Raidian
Reviews.Content: New refurbished rooms are quite nice, however perhaps a bit too high tech/ futuristic at times. Finding the right light switch can be a challenge at times. TV is in a strange position and cannot be pivoted. Wifi is not free and very expensive, should be free when you are paying this much for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and great service”
Reviews.Author: green023
Reviews.Content: ight from the word go, our arrivals were pleasant. The front office made no mistake of our reservations though some of our team guests were booked from US,some from Japan . The views from all the rooms make you feel special. The bathrooms, a lot of small features make you feel special. They have mini meals throughout the day which makes one relaxed that you dont have to finish your meal when particularly the meeting is on and you could break anytime . The mini meals are fantastic. The service levels are one of the best experienced. The mini bar is checked every couple of hours and they dont wait for your instructions to refill. Impressed after a long time .Even 5 star hotels make mistakes ,but here there wasnt one instance of anything going wrong.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel but more for business/conference than holiday”
Reviews.Author: rogerrobert98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive and provides all the services that you could want. We found the surroundings very much a business centre though with transport so efficient in Singapore it is easy to get around the city state. A feature of the room design is the hexagonal window above the bath. This is alright if you are on the 26th floor but it is unfortunate that tthe view from ours was mainly of the multi-lane highway.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maratea
Reviews.Content: We only spent a night at the Millenia. The room was very spacious, the design cool, the view great, the service super friendly. We ordered room service and were happy with the service and quality. The breakfast on the next day was slightly overpriced for the average buffet quality you got and I found the atmosphere too busy. Overall, great stay and I will come back when in Singapore next time.

Reviews.Title: “Like an old lady with a facelift, you will see the beauty of her past times but also the oddity of today.”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: Definitely not the same calibre as the ritz in Madrid and of course the Ritz in Paris.. Not even in the same league as the newer ritz hotels in south east asia! This 15 year old property has undergone renovation processes, that can be seen but unfortunately that process still is going on at the floors we are staying with four rooms (1111 being right infront of us, etc) being repaired by hordes of workers that you will pass in the hall all the time and the smell of strong paint will welcome you home. Everytime. This hotel is mediocre not JUST because of the renovations, I think the guys that designed and trained the staff here don't really know the first thing about hotels. Zia the reception cannot give us non smoking king bed rooms that we booked for, and my wife actually called the day before. He KNOWS that we asked for it, because he said 'yes I received the notice'. He can do nothing but give us upgraded rooms on a smoking floor, and the floor when extensive renvation work is being done. Thank you. His version of double beds turns out to be twin beds. So we came all the way down to the reception to complain and he changed us one of the room to king beds. (that we asked for confirmed). Called room service, ordered the steak and two hot waters, naturally you will get ice cold waters. Room service was much below the standards of mandarin oriental. Not delicious, small(er) portions and quite expensive. Room design was cute, execution was flawed. Wooden floorboards was done to give an 'intimate' bedroom feeling but the creaking was nasty. I have floorboards at home and in my office but they hardly make a sound.. I guess this is the ritz way. Tv was put so the only one that would be comfortable watching it is the standing lamp. It would be ridiculous trying to watch it from the beds, and not much better from the sofa. Watching it for 20 minutes should not be a problem I guess, but why put a dvd in the room then?? We got harbour views, but 30% of the view is obstructed by ugly canopies that is installed in all windows. This I don't understand.. Why ruin the one thing people pay a premium for? Views! Your hotel is facing the marina, although mandarin oriental is positioned much better, why in the world would you want to sabotage your assets??? Picture a 30% censorship on the beautiful harborview rooms of the intercontinental hong kong... That is not just a blunder that is borderline criminal. The toilet door handle fell off when I wanted to open it, thank god it didn't smash my toes or my son's. Thank god my pregnant wife didn't vomit every morning because of the horrible paint smell. Thank god we all have a choice when it comes to hotels and for sure, in all sanity, we will never ever stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Georgiapazo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore for really just about 24 hours and decided to stay in a nice place. we had booked through expedia and had a "two king bed" room offer for 3 of us. on arrival we were told they did not have a 2 king-bed room. After minimal negotiation we were offered a complimentary cot, upgrade to a junior suite and three complimentary breakfast buffets. The suite was perfect. Cold, nice beds with great linen (most comfortable sleep I'd had in some time). the Spa was nice. pool was amazing. Breakfast was great. one of the best breakfast buffets I've ever had. Really had something for everyone (dim sum, western, european, eggs, yogurt, amazing cheeses and jams, good coffee). Overall a great stay...maybe not the BEST for value but nice all the same

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Reviewguy8
Reviews.Content: the stay at this hotel so far beat any that I have ever had earlier. The staff made the most insane effort to make our stay there beyond comfortable. Check in was smooth - room upgrade in line with Marriott gold elite membership was as expected. upon discovering that we were on a anniversary trip the management arranged champagne and other snacks in our room and drew a bath for us. location was extremely central and convenient for everything that we wanted - food shopping or just walking around. we were lucky enough to experience the Sunday brunch at the Ritz - its Incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ChestnutMatt
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in a 9th floor standard room with no breakfast. Large room with beautiful bathroom. As our room was a lower floor, traffic outside was constant hum, but not distracting. Would have been nicer to be on the water side. Electric blinds a nice touch. Wooden floors and decor feeling sparse/dated. Television at an odd angle from bed. Complementary overnight parking a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Finally!”
Reviews.Author: Grumpyz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I always had a soft spot for Ritz Carlton Singapore; we have spent many happy moments here whether in their restaurants or hotel rooms as weekend guests. We love Ritz so much that we chose to have our wedding here 2 years ago. Unfortunately, back then, the service at Rtiz left a lot to be desired and rooms were old and somewhat unkempt. It was no surprise to us to see Ritz falling out of the Top 10 hotels in Singapore at one point of time. With the refurnishing, I have to say I'm just so glad that Ritz has finally climbed its way up to the top 10 list again! We had an upgrade to a Premier suite as we had booked the Birthday Special Weekend gateway. And boy, does the suit looks different from the one we had on our wedding day. The Premier suite now looks cleaner and brighter. It also looks bigger with the clever placement of mirrors. On our last stay, we experienced cold food when the food was supposed to be hot or at least warm and even overheard staff complaining and using expletives while in service! But none of that this time around, breakfast was good, quality of food and service was way better than what we had experienced during our last stay. The wait staff were extremely polite and fast on clearing plates and topping of beverages. And my spouse loved the TV channels! All football lovers know that due to a bitter bidding war for the English Premier league, English football and ESPN are now with another service provider. To our surprise, Ritz offered channels from both service providers! The Sports channel were definitely a big bonus especially when many other 5-star hotels don't even have them. One grouse we had though as our room package came with birthday amenities and we had to call them up for it. It would have been better if they had asked me when's a good time for them to send it up to the room instead of us having to call them. I can't wait to return for my anniversary gateaway.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: TATA22
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my sister's graduation at Ritz Carlton Millenia and stayed there for 2 days. The luxurious hotel is very beautiful and we've got a free upgrade to a spacious room with a stunning view of Sands, Merlion and Esplanade! (So it's super convenient to travel around!) And thanks to Mr. Maricar Ofracio for his kindly arrangement of the wine, lovely cake and fruit for our celebration. The beds are so comfy that I fell asleep immediately after a tiring day of walking trip! (I couldn't sleep well in hotels usually!) The breakfast is great and I love the welcoming drinks & apples at the reception, lol! The girl named Riri at the reception is very friendly and helpful! I would recommend this hotel to all of you without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly refurbished, is this feng shui?”
Reviews.Author: adamthorne
Reviews.Content: I was staying here as an overnight on business but found the place so great I decided to stay for the weekend. Some of the reviews refer to aged rooms but so long as you can arrange / request a refurbished room there will be no disappointments. Not generally a subscriber to feng-shui or energy in rooms but the design, materials, aspect and detailing of the rooms made it for me, the best hotel room I'd ever stayed in. The service was great and the late night room service selection (late night arrival) very good. Further the room service isn't served on a plate but on a set table (on wheels) complete with flowers. The room was technically advanced with plugs for everything and a massive window over the bath made for a great view. Both the room and bathroom were generously sized. The lobby and eating areas are also lavishly decorated, very pleasant albeit busy. There are better pool facilities in other hotels and this was the only area where the service was a little slow, but this is nonetheless pleasant and green. The views from the harbour side are great but even the city side views are worthwhile. At around $250SGD per night this was not cheap but definitely worth it and a destination of choice for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. My room was large, well equiped and with a wonderful bathroom. The sevice is first class, The hotel has a good slection of restaurants of which the Chinese is first class. My only issue was that it seemed difficult to change the temperature of the air-con.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in Marina Bay. Catastrophic failure in conference,”
Reviews.Author: GGlen78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a stone's throw from the eye-catching Marina Bay Sands (the building with the amazing infinity pool). If you're lucky you may get a room with a view of this. I wasn't. At check-in the receptionist gave confusing info, which later proved incorrect -she stated that my room included only 1 breakfast, even though I was staying for 3 nights. I asked her repeatedly in plain, clear English, she maintained that this was the case. The room was great - massive - great big windows, with a magnificent bathroom. I second another reviewr's note that the hotel is awkward to get to on foot. The buffet lunch is to be recommended. I would have given this hotel a 'very good' rating, were it not for the fact that the projector screens did not work properly. My company had invited guests from all over the world to an important conference, The computer was hooked up to the AV system, but for some reason the 2 screens in the room kept losing the signal and kept flickering the image on the screen. It took about an hour to fix, but only 1 screen could be used. This is simply unforgiveable, given that thousands of dollars are being spent to organise this event - something like this should not happen. I have never seen anything like this happen before, even at the humblest of hotels. Ritz-Carlton - be warned- it is not just about form - it is also about substance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View(Marina Bay) /Nice Bathtub”
Reviews.Author: Viriyawong
Reviews.Content: Room is nice. Marina Bay view is fantastic. Breakfast should be up-grade. It's too normal. When you walk to Subway have to walk through marina shopping. A bit confusing. And easy walk to Marina Bay Sand.

Reviews.Title: “The best service you'll ever see!”
Reviews.Author: Baij_Patel
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Singapore is awesome! The room we had was huge and plush with cool features like an iPod dock and an hdmi port that you can hook your phone up to to show it off on the tv! We had two doubles and a huge bathroom. The only oddity was windows which people can see in from so no wandering around your room naked! The service in this hotel is phenomenal! Everyone says hello and smiles at you like they really mean it! A special thanks goes out to Anya in the lobby bar who really looked after us in the evenings and even bought a present for our daughter and our parents! Thanks! Breakfast was lovely with a huge buffet. The swimming pool was great and almost empty the whole time. We have pretty much agreed we won't stay anywhere else when we go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: elmasgrande
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, the rooms have this huge windows as advertised in the website. the rooms are comfortable and spacious. the service very attenttive. the only downside: if you like to walk, the entrance of the hotel is uncomfortable, since there is no walkway (you basically walk on the same street that cars). all the rest is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbishing could not save its name...”
Reviews.Author: Zaryline
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for one night on a weekend get-away on 30 Apr 11. Check-in was very unprofessional. This lady at the front desk took a long time to verify my details and even identified me wrongly for another guest despite showing her my identification card! Well my mood got better after entering the room located on the 26th floor. Realised that the room had been refurbished, thus injecting it a new look and fresh breath. Soon came the worst. As I was enjoying my TV programmes, I could hear distinctly heavy footsteps from the floor above. I was shocked for it was supposed to be a structurally excellent 5 stars hotel! The footsteps went on to the middle of the night....The following morning, I had my breakfast at the Greenhouse, the hotel cafe. I was really disappointed with the service there. One service staff actually ignored me when I was calling for him, claiming he would come back to me by saying "wait!" I merely requested him to re-fill my tea! Noody bothered to clear the finished plates which were left there like 30 minutes! Cafe was severely understaffed in the hotel's drive to cut cost and boost its profits, obviously. Overall, for a price of S$460 for a night with lousy service and untrained staff (whom Ritz terms as "their Ladies and Gentlemen"), it is definitely not worthy a stay nor a memorable experience. I could find better "Ladies and Gentlemen"with Pan Pacific or Amara Hotel in Singapore. I'm done with you, Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: faithfu7
Reviews.Content: We are from Singapore and we just came back from a one night stay at ritz! Went there for our 3rd year wedding annivesary and the staff act surprise us with a really nice cake. We had the room with the Marina bay view ! It was really pretty at night !! Wished I could stayed another day . Think they recently renovated the rooms so it was really nice n clean ! Thumbs up for their service !

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sassycat2011
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The service was amazing as was the room. It didn't hurt that we were given an upgrade to a corner one room suite. I wish we could have stayed longer. The concierge was so helpful arranging a car service, recommending sites and restaurants, and storing a package I sent in advance. The breakfast was amazing although I was grateful it was included in my nightly rate because it was expensive. However this is the Ritz so high meal and drink costs are to be expected. the location was also superb. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our best choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jacjac29
Reviews.Content: All their rooms have recently been refurbished, and the room looks so much spacious given strategic uses of mirrors. Room service is great - fast, more importantly, for those always in a hurry. Marina view rooms are the best, sometimes its possible to get a free upgrade, for example if you don't mind a twin room if you're travelling alone. The room window shades are now automated, which makes for a fantastic night view being revealed once you are in bed, allowing you to fall asleep amidst the low shimmering lights of the marina. Amazing. Only minor comment I have is that they have this FANTASTIC bath tub, but no bath salts. Who in the world carries bath salts when they travel? Otherwise, this is my first choice every time I travel to Singapore to work.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: jamora912
Reviews.Content: Pardon for the late review. Really wish to review here during our stay-cation that this hotel is really Worth your money. Great Service. Great Food Great Location.Great View

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room and good service overall from staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisj28
Reviews.Content: The room was huge and had both day and night blinds. Excellent bathroom with good amenities. Everyday room was cleaned n it was such a pleasure coming in to rest daily. Kudos to the cleaning staff. Liked the hotel location. The breakfast was just liked any other hotel's breakfast of the same standard. Reception staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Calvin_HK
Reviews.Content: This is a newly renovated hotel with excellent large rooms. The bathroom is huge with a separate shower and toilet. The bathtub is large with good view out the window. The service was excellent. No complaints. Location is excellent as with all the hotels at this area. Value is better than the hotel of the same class in Singapore mainly because they have just renovated the rooms. Sleep quality is OK because I think the bed/mattress is on the soft side but it is the same with most hotels. What we've used: 1.) Spa - The Spa was OK. It was a bit noisy in the message room where you can hear the staff outside. It is not really a tranquil spa by all means but this is not a spa hotel. 2.) Room Service - The service was excellent. The food arrived in a reasonable time and the food was good. 3.) Pool - The pool was nice and service was excellent. 4.) Breakfast - breakfast was good. It was included in our room rate otherwise it is extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, great staff, great food.”
Reviews.Author: DiverDanSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights on business. The room was excellent (I think there was some kind of upgrade) with plenty of space, walk in robe, large bathroom, bath looking out over the Marina and a King sized bed. Amenities in the room were good with own DVD player, charging dock for your apple gear and good wifi connectivity. Check in and out was a little ponderous but staff were trying to please. Room was not ready at 3pm for check in...hence the upgrade. Food in the main cafe was of very good quality with a very wide range as well. I do wish hotels would stop trying to cook every type of order for eggs in the morning on an individual basis...it just cayses a complete bottleneck...but many of them do it so this is not a specific crtitism of the Ritz-Carlton. Staff were very attentive and friendly and the hotel is very well appointed. Good meeting facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Is True To What One Would Expect.”
Reviews.Author: MonarchosSeven
Reviews.Content: This last visit to Singapore I decided to stay at The Ritz Carlton Millenia. It is exactly as you would expect, with a couple of surprises. It is modern, tall, and very "Singapore Immaculate." My suite was well appointed, and comfortable. If you are a person who loves spacious bathrooms when traveling, you will not be disappointed. The walls of my powder room were all glass, providing a vertigo inducing view of the city! I know that most that choose this hotel will love this feature... but I am a bit of a land- lover... so never mind me! It was very pretty to bathe in the moonlight, and seeing the city's lights, after a typical sticky and humid day! I did like it there, however, I prefer to reside in places that display more of whatever city's authentic charm. I was able to find some, poolside. It was small (in a good way) and loaded with beautiful and lush vegetation along the patio and surrounding areas. The sushi restaurant inside the hotel was the most incredible sushi I have ever tried. Very high quality. One thing that I must confess to not being fond of, is staff related. The hotel is rather large, and therefore hyper- staffed. Every time I would walk in or out, I felt obliged to speak. Normally, this would be a positive thing, but when you literally pass about ten to fifteen staff members, that from the moment you hit the lobby elevator, to your driver outside, that's a lot of obligatory dialogue! I know that they are trained to be hospitable, but after a long flight- and a difficult adjustment to the new time zone, I recall wishing that I could get from point A to point B, without practically speaking in my sleep! If you are into the "big hotel chain experience" than this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a week in March of 2011, as part of a longer business trip in Asia. I picked this hotel based on an attractive corporate rate, and also based on positive reviews. Check-in: A very warm welcome from the staff, as was the case every time I interacted with them. I had a marina view room with an amazing view of central Singapore. The staff helped me to my room and showed me all of its features. The Room: My room was huge, as was the bathroom! A nice king-sized bed that was very comfortable, and a large and airy bathroom with its own window and great views of the city. A nice walk-in closet and also a great workspace - probably the best of any hotel I've stayed at. Overall the room was amazing and I couldn't fault a thing. Amenities: I used the laundry service a couple of times and it was great. The pool area was very nice and also had great service from the staff. I did not use any other amenities. Dining: I ate twice at the Greenhouse buffet, which I would say was average for the price (over S$100 with drinks). The selection was good and items were re-stocked on a regular basis. As a solo traveller I didn't feel very welcome though. This was probably my only real complaint. Location: The location is good, but not great. The MRT is not very convenient, and it's not easy to walk in or out of the hotel (you have to walk on the road). This place clearly wasn't designed with pedestrians in mind. With that said, it was always easy to get a taxi, and additionally, I was able to walk to several shops and the MRT without much hassle. The hotel is very convenient for the Marina Bay Sands casino. Service: Everyone was very friendly and clearly had been well-trained to provide great service. Every request was met effortlessly and quickly. Verdict: Despite a couple of minor annoyances, I loved this hotel. I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality...”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the Far East for its quality of hotels and the Ritz is no exception. Great sized room, excellent restaurants - the Summer Pavillion has some of the best dim sum I have eaten. Helpful staff and a great location (but then in Singapore everything is a 10min cab ride). Cannot fault this hotel for anything...

Reviews.Title: “Kick A*s!”
Reviews.Author: ompong2
Reviews.Content: - Stayed a week on business. - Awesome room. I travel frequently in APAC and at the corp rate that I use this property blows away all the other 5 star places I've stayed- spacious, clean, well designed, impressive attention to tech and luxe detail, awesome view (insist on a room facing the marina), and everything worked. - Awesome location. If you feel like using the MRT the nearest station is 5mins away. Casino is across the bridge. Great bar at Marina Bay. - Awesome service. Attentive and helpful. - Can't comment much on the restaurants as I only had breakfast there, which was average but certainly not a dampener to the rest of the package. Heard great things about their Chinese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: winefrance
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for 7 days for a conference. We had the best service ever from the time we arrived there until we left. Anything we requested was done immediately.. The view of the bay and the city was awsome. The Room with king was huge so was the bathroom. We travel a lot and been to thoughout Europe and many asian countries. This tops it so far. The Last night they reccommended to eat in one of their restaurants for peking duck which i had desired and thought of going to china town. But we decided to try the restaurant at the hotel. I have had that in hong kong few years back. This was also very good and crispy and tasty. Excellent food and excellent hotel . The beds were one of a kind. You can just hide under those soft comfy comforters and pillows. We never lost our sleep inspite of the time change. We even purchased their towels to bring back. I wanted the duvet cover and pillow cases but i did not. I regretted it later.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the luxury service, leave for the local food”
Reviews.Author: JetShopper
Reviews.Content: Last December I stayed at the Ritz Carlton while attending a television conference at the Suntec Convention Center. The expo space is conveniently accessible by walking through a series of interconnected malls – you barely even have to step outside (an especially important feature in Singapore’s hot and humid weather). Besides enjoying the hotel’s close access to shopping, I also got a chance to explore the beautiful pool area which includes a cascading waterfall. While it might not be as new as the pool at the Mandarin Oriental, it has a tropical atmosphere surrounded by beautiful trees – an escape I appreciated after long days working and shopping. All hotel rooms are spacious, and all bathrooms feature that amazing window above the bath. Since I requested a room on a top floor, I had great views from every window. Like everyone I met in Singapore, the hotel staff was extremely gracious and accommodating. If you have any questions about getting around town, they are more than happy to help. Hotel room service offers many diverse food options: Chinese, Indian, Japanese, Thai, Malaysian, Korean and American! The food was good, but not amazing. To truly experience Singapore you must eat in a local restaurant or hawker stall. It was here that I had one of the most inexpensive and delicious meals of my life. Take a look at my photos and Singapore travel and shopping advice on TheJetShopper.com Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “magnificent view, neat design”
Reviews.Author: lumailae
Reviews.Content: The hotel is locet opposite the new MArina BAy Sands hotel and shopping/entertainment center. REspectively located rooms provied for a magnificent view. Hotel was recently very tastefully renovated. Some of the best interior and roomd esigns I have ever experienced. The pool with all the lush green around is similarly perfect. The gym verywell equipped. Staff are extremely service oreinted and attentive. The only disadvantage is the old windows panes which are one layer of gals only and provide very littel acoustice insulation. So you hear all the traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “A most tiring stay, and a never-ending string of bathroom problems!”
Reviews.Author: foldie
Reviews.Content: When I read past brickbats of this hotel, I didn't quite believe. Until I very recently stayed there myself! On my second night, used the bathtub with a view for a good soak, to only find out after that that the tub lever was faulty and the bathwater couldn't be drained away! Used a pencil to try to turn the lever, broke the pencil instead. Had to ask the Communications Dept (like Front Desk) to repair the tub the next morning. On the third night, it got worse. The bath toilet became alive and refused to be flushed. To our horrors, the toilet paper floated up and we were so worried it would flood the floor. Again in the middle of the night, we had to call to ask them to repair the loo the next day. On the fourth morning, we needed to use the toilet but itbwas not repaired, we had to ask for another toilet in another room. the night manager got an earful from me as I was embarrassed and angry that we had to put up with a clogged toilet bowl for the entire night and a half morning and even had to go to another toilet! Miguel, the Night Manager, tried to remedy the situation and offered a free night's stay. I really didn't expect a clogged toilet at the Ritz. This was not the end of our problems at the Ritz. We had to use the safe deposit on our second night and found it was not working so yes, again we had to ask them to repair it the next day. On our fifth day, while trying to rest during the day, lo and behold, the bathroom in the opposite room was being renovated! Incredible but true. From 10.30 am to 4 pm. Hammering and drilling. The whole works! This was clearly the last straw that broke the camel's back! Was it so hard to ask for a working condition bathroom and a quiet room for five days? At a six-star hotel? I am not sure now. I wrote a letter to express my disappointment to the GM, however I think he is probably too busy to bother with guest complaints either by letter or on Tripadvisor! Take a leaf from Royal Crowne Plaza at the Scotts. They really listen and pay attention to their guests' needs. Two bright sparks during our stay: Miguel, the Duty Manager was professional and efficient. Mr Sazali at the Bell Desk was really the only genuine staff who cared for his guests. He remembered his guests by name and attended to their requests quickly and with care and concern. Thank you Mr Sazali!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights and didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Rajivkj
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazing. The service is impeccable, the best I have ever experienced. The food was absolutely delicious. We had breakfast there twice and dinner and it was the best I had from hotel room service. We stayed there for two nights and didn't want to leave. It was the perfect end to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “The gold standard in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Connolly47
Reviews.Content: Lots of Singapore hotels claim to be world class but for frequesnt business travellers the Ritz remains the Gold Standard. Get on the club floor, a newly renovated room and a view of marina bay and you have it made. Not the Ritz Carlton Shanghai but better than the rest in Singapore. If you have only stayed in Ritz Carlton hotels in the US then you are in for a very pleasant surprise in Asia...a completely different experience....but when will hotel chains like this learn to stop ripping guests off with inetrnet charges that could fund a small nation

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: Having decided upon a luxurious christmas break, Mr and Mrs Snuffles happened upon a Christmas deal at the Ritz-Carlton in Singapore - three nights in a corner suite for the price of two. The suite was beautifully appointed with a comfortable sitting area, a luxurious bathroom and a bed so plumptious it was like sleeping in a cloud. There was some traffic noise from the road that runs alongside the Singapore Flyer but the view more than made up for this. The service was absolutely faultless - nothing was too much trouble - and the in-house Japanese restaurant was also first rate. Some small quibbles would be the lack of in-room entertainment (an iPod dock that didn't work, and if you wanted to see a film you had to go to reception to choose a DVD from a very limited selection held by the concierge). The spa was also somewhat functional.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home in Premier Suite - true five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjornstrom
Reviews.Content: We just checked out from Ritz-Carlton Singapore and we're really sorry to leave. This was our second stay in two weeks - we stayed two nights each time and got a complimentary upgrade to a Premier Suite on the second visit arriving at 01.30 at night from a late flight. Even though we had two short stays we truly felt welcome and were greeted by our names at all times. Amazing service from concierge to check-in and pool staff. We stayed at the JW Marriott in Khao Lak between our stays and that's also a five star but it doesn't match the Ritz-Carlton experience. Our Premier Suite was about 65m2 and a corner room with view over Marina Bay Sands & City from living room and bedroom. From the bathroom we saw the Singapore Flyer. The bathrobes are amazing - I'll try to order one from the hotel, never felt that material before. The room had two 46 inch TV:s, a Nespresso machine and Bose System. Free Wifi was included. In the drawers we found a fully stocked bar and Hediard Chocolates (#1!). The Ritz-Carlton is located next to the Millenia Shopping mall which is connected to the Suntec City mall so there's literally hundreds of stores within walking distance from the hotel. We took a 10 minute walk to the Marina Bay Sands shopping mall just across a small walking bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's Jewel Restored”
Reviews.Author: 300nitesayear
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Ritz over the last few years I was always favorably impressed by its location, outstanding service, great breakfast buffet and size/location of its health club/pool (one of the best health clubs you'll find around). Within walking distance of the CBD, indoor shopping mall and the Sands shops/casino it offers a balance between the vibrancy of Orchard Road and the peacefulness of Sentosa. What it lacked until recently was the age of its infrastructure and its outdated rooms. I can tell that has been completely remedied with a complete internal makeover of the rooms. Ritz now offers a wonderfully updated room, automatic blinds, lights, electronics coupled with new bedding, carpeting and IPTV. LIghter sleepers should ask for a room on the city end (vs. highway) but other than that I'd suggest that the Ritz is now the new best-in-class in Singapore with reasonable prices for a high-end hotel/resort. I've stayed at the St. Regis, new Fullerton Bay, Intercontinental and others over the years while the Ritz had lost its shine. I can tell you that all future stays will be at the Rtiz, the makeover is that good!

Reviews.Title: “most beautiful rooms and bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: stayed at the ritz for 2 nights, just after having stayed 2 nights at the Mandarion oriental- which i would chose next time in Singapore. LIKES: the ritz's rooms are some of the most beautiful ones i have ever stayed at- ask for the new re-furnished ones. they are really amazing. so are the bathrooms with the tubs and the huge windows. it was the reason why we picked the hotel, we really wanted to stay in those rooms. - fast elevators! - quiet - great views -a walk in closet!!! - high end materials on the walls (leather), bathrooms, the rug and the couch etc. -nice big and comfy bed -GREAT lightning. many features to adjust the lamps and lights which made the room look good in the magic hour and evening. their business center worked really well- though way TOOOOO COLD with the A/C!!! - such as the breakfast restaurant and the corridors! waste of energy and CO2 and well, as said already, just too cold! dislikes: -the breakfast was disappointing- with so great food in the city, it didi not live up to my expectations. - the sound of the tv in the room was bad and the entertainment system did not work - or at least we did not figure it out, how to plug our i phones/ i pads to listen to music. -the service was good.... but coming from 3 days at the mandarin oriental, it was just 'ok'. -the pool bar needs to be freshened up a bit and look more exclusive all in all, a great experience, but i woudl chose Mandarian oriental next time. the perfect combi would be : ritz carlton rooms located in the mandarin oriental hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: CPH360
Reviews.Content: We had a very memorable stay and truly enjoyed every single moment of it. I could keep listing the things that were magnificient about this wonderful property but to shorten it down to a minimum here are my highlights: nice large rooms with all you can wish for (and they all come with a nice view), wonderful breakfast, great staff, gorgeous Dale Chihuly collection, excellent location, grounds and facilities. Unfortunately we couldn't spoil ourselves in the Premier Suite Club Floor room during all of our stay so we tried the cheapest room category (Kalang Bay) as well and found that to be excellent value for our "breakfast included, low season, financial crisis" package price. The Kalang Bay rooms are identical to the Marina Bay rooms (just with another but also very nice view). Very spacious and what other hotels might categorize as a "Junior Suite" room or more. By the way: I recommend a visit to the food court at Marina Square Mall for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best”
Reviews.Author: AntonyG
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit, having stayed here 6 years ago, for a 2-day stopover to relax and recuperate after a hectic and exhausting trip through India. The RC certainly did that: i.e. relaxed us. Although there was some confusion at check-in since our pre-purchase of a Marina Bay view room had somehow slipped through the cracks (probably due to a mistake by the wholesaler), the reception had no hesitation in giving us our desired room after I showed our confirmation voucher. (Always travel with hard-copy of your electronic reservations!) We were given a newly refurbished room on level 13, and didn't have any problems with noise, unlike the previous reviewer. The room is a dream, with pretty much everything you need, can think of, and all in very convenient locations. The only things that baffled us slightly were the TV controls, and the contacts directory displayed on the phone's console, which didn't match the numbers printed on our "guest card", and which didn't always reach the desired location. (Selecting room service got us the "communications department" on one occasion.) Other than those very minor amusements, the hotel delivered in all respects, from the unfailingly polite and helpful staff, through to the food service. (We ate breakfasts at the hotel, and had one lunch there, as well as room service.) The location may not be the most convenient, given that you have to walk down the driveway to get to the street (wish we had known about that secret door mentioned in a recent review!), but many things are a short walk away, and, let's face it, walking is good for you. When we didn't feel like walking, a taxi would substitute, and taxis are pretty cheap in Singapore. As a bonus, when our flight home was delayed by 10 hours, the hotel extended our check-out to a suitable time, without an additional charge. I wouldn't hesitate to come here again ... this hotel ticks all the boxes for us.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and elegant hotel, with a warm heart”
Reviews.Author: anrinn
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in the world, stayed here 3 times. Amazing service, amazing rooms, huge with great views and a buffet breakfast to die for. The swimming pool is stunning and I cannot say enought about the staff. They are 5 star service personified. Stay here and you will have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms bring this place back!”
Reviews.Author: jameskdean
Reviews.Content: The service truly is Ritz-Carlton, but the hotel got a bit dated over time. However - the new renovation looks amazing and the service is top notch all the time. I like this place.

Reviews.Title: “pure luxury and top class services”
Reviews.Author: travelingmadam
Reviews.Content: for 3 days, from Oct 29-31st, I stayed at Ritz-Carlton Millenia Singapore with my parents for a short leisure break from work. we had a concert to attend nearby at Esplanade hall so we decided to choose nearby hotels around Marina Bay area. after reading reviews at TA and comparing the prices, we were so positive with our choices. turns out, it was not a mistake. we were completely hundred percent satisfied with RC Millenia Singapore. greeted by the front door man, I forgot his name but he was such a sweet and polite man. he knows all the directions and all the good attractions nearby, even when I was just about to get for a drink at Starbucks, he would gladly escort me to the secret doorway to Millenia walk/Marina square and asked me about anything else my parents and I needed. really a superb class service I did not even think about. about the room, I took the reconnect weekend package with $70 credits that could be used at the gift shop or restaurant. we were glad with that decision as it saved us almost 100-150 SGD per night. check in was excellent and fast. our room was on the 24th floor [2403] with the view of Kallang bay river. we did not choose Marina Bay view cause we wanted to experience another part of Singapore. room was amazingly huge of course with RC's standard. huge king size bed and comfortable sofas to sat on. another plus was the separate closet which was quite big even for two people. bathroom was undeniably the most comfiest I've ever known. huge bath tub with big window overlooking the spectacular view and automatic curtain. separate shower and toilet was also available. no complaints for the room whatsoever. turn down services at night was also another extra benefit staying at RC. we were asked whether we wanted extra water bottles or towels or even wanted ice cubes. amazingly once we were not there during the night from 7-10 pm and when we got back, our clothes that were scattered on the bed (lol) are neatly hanged on the hanger and they left us more water bottles, clean towels, ice cubes and even more extra chocolates. it was sweet indeed. for the hotel services, we did not try breakfast cause we always prefer to eat at local restaurants in the morning. we did try the gym and the swimming pool. no doubt the best in Singapore I think. there was also a whirlpool located nearby the pool and a bit hidden. the pool man was very polite and always ready to serve you even for your own little bit of non sense request. lol. we regret did not try the spa but hopefully someday we will. overall it was an amazing stay at RC Millenia Singapore. services were top class and not fake, they really treat and made you feel like a king. even to the smallest detail, such as asking where we wanted to go and how's our day for today, that was sweet yet another example of 5* hotel should be. the security guy who guard the back door to Millenia walk was also nice and helpful as well. during check out, there was a conference I believe held by Moet & Chandon so I was confused for a while where they moved the reception but the sweet concierge man escorted me and apologize for the mess. I told him it was okay but he insisted to secure my luggage for a while. at the payment, apparently there was a bit mistake on the bill so I was charged wrongly and I realized that when I was at the airport already. surprisingly, the reception man contacted me both through e-mail and phone, saying that they have charged the wrong bill. they have phoned the bank and without matter of minutes, corrected the bill and he even sent me 2 copies of transcript through PDF document. I was speechless yet happy. he even sent me another e-mail apologizing for the mistake. what a true top class services they have given. I will definitely stay again at RC Millenia Singapore when I have a chance. of course RC is an expensive hotel but really worth the money and the services you get.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best hotel I've stayed at...I typically stay in the Conrad and Mandarin O, but Ritz Carlton in terms of the rooms are a step above. Pros: 1) The rooms are superb, and in particular the bathrooms. Bathtub overlooks the harbour in floor-to-glass ceilings. High roof. Very spacious and comfortable. Although not cutting edge like the Upper House, still modern enough. 2) Service was fantastic 3) Did not have time for the pool / gym, but looked pretty nice Cons - location is a little bit out of the way and not close to public transport...though cabs are pretty cheap in singapore

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: 5starhotelreviews
Reviews.Content: Very elegant place with comfortable rooms and spectacular view, like you have center of Singapore on your palm, which is even more spectacular while taking bath during the night. Of course, try to stay on executive floors. Hotel is huge same as swimming pool. In general no objection, unless a bit grandiose stile. The Leon mark is everywhere, even on the toilet paper, what is honestly too much. Rather for stopover or business than for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Service is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter880
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Ritz-Carlton for 2 days on a business meeting. Very good location, at the center of everything. I could have anything I want in few minutes walk. They truly have excellent rooms, luxurious as I may say. I stayed in a deluxe room and I love what was given to me, such a wonderful view of Marina Bay. Short stay though but I love the treatment I received. I will stay here again whenever I will travel to Singapore for business purpose. However, I have to save big bucks to stay here longer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mooner80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite in October 2010. The suite was very spacious and well appointed. Our suite had a great view of the harbour. Not cheap, but nice if you want to stay somewhere special.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and professional staff sets this hotel apart from the rest”
Reviews.Author: ScrabbleAustralia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Singapore Airlines holiday program. We stayed two nights. I chose this hotel because of its historical reputation and the fact that my husband and I were celebrating a wedding anniversary. We arrived late afternoon and left early morning so did not have any problems accessing the rooms early or needing late check-outs.. We had a lovely room overlooking the river. The bathroom had similar views. Previous reviewers are right - the hotel is looking jaded - particularly the carpet in the reception area. I was a little disappointed with the size of the pool but the gym is excellent - has hand-towels and earphones and fruit available at no charge to residents. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel: the cost of the room was quite high and we thought it would be cheaper to eat elsewhere - and it was of course. We did have an evening meal there at 50% off because of the airline agreement. It was reasonable - not great. Simultaneously the buffet was also available which we didn't have but appeared very popular - particularly with people not resident in the hotel. We had not been to Singapore for over 15 years and of course much had changed. The area around the hotel is pretty built up and we made the mistake of walking out of the hotel and making our way to the Raffles Mall along the main road. If you come out of the hotel and then go into the Marina hotel you can access the malls through the hotel without walking in the heat. We didn't realise this until our return journey when we stayed at the Pan Pacific - across the road. (see review). If this review sounds a little 'ho hum' it's because I was and still am quite disappointed that although this is a very nice hotel it is the staff rather than the surroundings which make it impressive and I am not convinced that it gives full value for the $ which other hotels in Singapore provide in spades.

Reviews.Title: “a luxurious stay fit for royalty”
Reviews.Author: Bumahra
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons why we decided to go back to Singapore was this hotel. It is gorgeously located on the milenia bay river where you can get a room with a river view which is spectacular. Get a suite or jr suite and you can have free access to the lounges for breakfast and snacks which was very convenient for us. Everything about this hotel is perfect from the moment you step it. The staff are very proffessional and freindly and will always be there to assist you. The food in the hotel is very clean and delicious, sometimes you just want to keep eating in the hotel and not experience places elsewhere. Its walking distance to the Merlion attraction and the Singapore flight (eye) it is also within walking distance of the theatre or opera house in singapore. The rooms are quite clean and the bathrooms are spacious with marble fittings. The bathtub has a giant window as you can enjoy the beautiful scenary while soaking your tiredness away in the tub. Highly recommended for people who enjoy a certain standard of service

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay, but at a price! :)”
Reviews.Author: WanderingSoul83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for a week on a business trip. The hotel works out extremely convenient for anyone whose work is centred around Raffles as mine was. I would walk everyday from the hotel to Raffles Link in under 10mins. The Ritz is a great hotel with excellent rooms; I stayed in a Deluxe room overlooking the Marina Bay. The room was quite large had a huge windows which overlooked the Bay lending a wonderful touch to the room. Comfortable beds, a walk closet, an LCD is all that you should expect to see in your room. Even small details like a suit brush and small bar of swiss chocolate everyday were appreciable. I especially fell in love with the bathroom, which huge by aby standard! The bath tub was right next to the glass wall overlooking the Bay, giving you a phenomenal unobstructed view of Marina Bay.
