I used the restaurants a couple of times during my stay, the food and service was excellent. However it was quite pricey; expect a basic meal with a drink to cost you in excess of SG$100. Also no free internet access is a dampener. Ritz is a luxurious experience and it impresses by the amount of care that is taken of the guests and there stay; it however demands big bucks to make it happen.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service!”
Reviews.Author: JAKEParis
Reviews.Content: We chose the club floor. We arrived in a taxi from the airport - we were welcomed and bags immediately taken care of, escorted to the club lounge to check-in - welcome drink and taken to room with spectacular views over the harbour including from the bath! Club room enjoy meals and drinks almost non stop and although not cheap excellent value. Staff couldn't do enough for us - following day we checked out at normal time and our bags were taken care of - as flight not until late evening we retained club access until we collected luggage at 8pm. Courtious and efficient staff, real service . Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoelBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ritz between 29-31st Oct.2010. It was nice despite a few initial hick ups. My young family and I had been backpacking, when we arrived to the ritz at 2pm to check-in. We do not have any big, clumpsy luggage s with us when we strolled into the ritz. So I suppose, the staff did not expect us to be stay-in guest. We had to go round looking for the check-in counter which was situated away from the doorway. Check-in was brisk, but was not too friendly, I thought. Nobody showed us to the lift, nobody taught us how to use the security lock, ...until I actually had to ask for directions. And nobody showed us to our rooms, we had to search for it. Basically very non proactive, I thought. Maybe its because we did not arrived in a big fancy limousine with big fancy luggages? My two young kids and us arrived on backpacks... The rooms were good, as expected and we had an overall pleasant stay. The staff were very courteous and helpful... later in the day (after knowing that we were check-in guest) and through out the next 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: R0sey2010
Reviews.Content: it was actually 3 years ago we stayed at this hotel, but only got round to leaving a review! The hotel was actually absolutely fantastic, the only faults were that it was a 10/15 minute walk to where the actual places of interest were, so no real issue there. The scenery from our room was fantastic. The only problem we had was on arrival at the airport, I had booked a limousine transfer to the hotel for my partners 40th. It should have been the icing on the cake for her. Unfortunately, the Limo didn't turn up at all until over an hour later and several phone calls to the hotel, and they actually charged me full rate for it! Other than that, strongly recommend this hotel and especially Singapore. Try Raffles Hotel for a Singapore Sling!

Reviews.Title: “A truley wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: oogoooles
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Ritz, and every one of them was a treat! My partner checked in before me, but I was welcomed warmly with an escort and Iced Tea. Check in was swift and very courteous, and I was whisked away to our room overlooking the Skypark. The rooms were large, newly renovated, and decor was fantastic. The highlight of our room was by far the bathroom, where I relaxed every evening overlooking the lights of Singapore. In fact, it was so romantic here that my partner proposed! Breakfast was included in our stay, and it was a wonderful spread. However, we did eat dinner in the Greenhouse restaurant - and it was by far the best buffet meal I have ever had. It had everything you could possibly want to eat, and the desserts were a work of Art. Each evening we were greeted back in our room with turndown service. We had a problem with our toilet, which was fixed promptly within 10 minutes. The pool area is ageing, but a quick visit to the sauna and steam room was just as nice. The MRT is near the hotel, so visiting anywhere in Singapore was easy. With a quick walk you can reach the new casino, skypark and shopping malls. My stay at the Ritz was memorable, incredible, and I look forward to future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Singapore Luxury”
Reviews.Author: London Frequent Traveller
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton has to be one of the select group of ultimately luxurious Pacific Asian hotels, which means one of the best in the world. Rooms, appointments, service are all superlative. One black mark: my limousine failed to show at the airport, though I didn't book it personally so I can't hold this against the hotel management. And a minor niggle: the bedside lighting master switch is confusing (especially the control for the blinds!) and the night lighting is a little brighter than it needs to be. Footnote: the extremely negative review currently posted at the top has to refer to another hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Simply 'Out of the World' Experience. The hotel has set new benchmarks in luxury, comfort & hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: BCGeSource
Reviews.Content: “From the minute your taxi stops in the driveway of Ritz Carlton Millenia, you are warmly greeted at your car, at the door, and walked to the arrival desk and escorted to the ultra contemporary rooms, which had a stunning panoramic view of the Singapore skyline. The location of this hotel is simply superb with a choice of Marina Bay view and Kallang Bay view rooms. The drive from the airport was just about 20 minutes from the hotel. The proximity of the hotel to 3 shopping malls, Singapore Flyer-World's tallest ferris wheel, Casino & Shopping at Marina Sands Resort and Singapore's popular nightlife spots made our stay even better as we did not have to commute much on taxis. The morning buffet at Greenhouse was sumptous, well spread with an excellent range of breakfast delicacies. Overall, we were quite impressed by our stay here, and highly recommend this hotel if you want the best of both, a great hotel in a perfect location. We had a great experience staying here during our last visit to Singapore. Thanks to Ritz Carlton hospitality team for making our stay truly memorable. We would surely be back for a 'deja vu' experience.

Reviews.Title: “F1 Location Spot ON!”
Reviews.Author: alexinparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ritz for this years F1 and spent little time at the track, this hotel has an epic view from the roof bar and was a great experience to watch the race from here. Good restaurants in the hotel, 5 star service and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Lives upto the name”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Bim
Reviews.Content: I stayed heer from 2Sept till 8 Sept and it was just amazing... A bit high priced but again they deliverd world class service . I stayed on the 26 floor and the view from the room was amazing. Rooms were spacious . I would definately go back there . The pool is amazing . And the best part is most part of the city is easily acceassible from the hotel. he Concierge Staff were extremely helpful and were the best , All of my request were taken care of always .

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a great luxury choice for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: trav3l-lat3r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a family member who had stayed there previously and vouched for its luxury. We were not disappointed. The rooms were very large, especially for Singapore, and the beds were very comfortable. Practically one whole wall of our room was a window, offering a spectacular view of Singapore's skyscrapers, with the Merlion visible across the river. Particularly impressive was the fact that, thanks to another large window in the equally elegant bathroom, this breathtaking view of the city could also be enjoyed whilst relaxing in the bath! The overall decoration of the hotel is stylish and it has been looked after well. Staff were helpful and attentive and the pool was of a good size. However, we got the impression that the place was very focused on extracting as much money from you as possible. We were charged for breakfast even though we had not asked for it and had not taken it, although to be fair this was remedied promptly after bringing it to their attention. The fact that Internet access is not included in the room charge, and even worse is overpriced, was also disappointing. Nevertheless, if you have the money and are after a central location, large and elegant rooms and the best views of Singapore from your bathtub, the Ritz-Carlton is the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Ritz Carlton for many yeras on our trips to Singapore. We have always enjoyed our stays there. However over many years the hotel has not changed. It is now looking old and tired and in need of a refurbishment. However other than that, it is still an excellent hotel. The staff are very friendly and always helpful and the food is always excellent and it is well located for shops and other activities, close to MRT station etc.. In my opinion it no longer qualifies as a 5 star hotel due to its outdated decor and furnishings in both the rooms and public areas. We stayed in a suite on this visit and noted that the same old furnishings were still in place as we experienced several years ago. With so much choice in Singapore and many new hotels on offer at similar prices there are better choices available which offer better value for money. Never the less the Ritz Carlton is still a good hotel, just no longer 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulos!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thebarrs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and have been very impressed each time my last trip we stayed 2 weeks i still very high

Reviews.Title: “Great views and in the midst of a new city development”
Reviews.Author: Ming0861
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton in Singapore is without a doubt very luxurious and glamorous. The rooms are comfortable. The bathroon alone is like another room with fantastic views of the harbour. If you're not the type to feel guilty about using so much water, then indulge. There is probably not a better bathroom in town. The inaugural Youth Olympic Games were about to open while we were staying there, so there was this exciting view of this huge water arena cum platform that Singapore had built for the opening and closing ceremonies. We could see performers rehearsing from above. You can also see the new Marina Sands Resort cum casino and it is an easy walk to the Esplanande along water. It defnitesly gives the sense of Singapore as a very hip and happening city.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Oracle68
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore on the way back to Australia from Europe. We are frequent travellers to Singapore and stayed many of its hotels in the past (borth for work and leisure). The Ritz Carlton was a top hotel. Nothing, absolutely nothing to complain about. From the reception (we arrived at 6am after 13 hours flight and we were given a room for free to sleep till our rooms were available) to the guest relations (who spent 20 mins finding me and booking the German beer restaurant), everything was extremely nice. The staff even opened the Business Centre at 1am just for me (to allow me check my seats through the internet). What more can anyone ask for? I have included some photos to show you the views from the room - absolutely magnificent. Highly recommended and even though it is a bit expensive (even for Singapore standards), you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “when something went wrong The Ritz delivered beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable relaxing stay at this hotel. I loved many aspects of the property, the club lounge, the pool the service and warmth of the staff. It was what one would expect from a top brand name hotel nothing more, or nothing less. My main disappointment with the Ritz Carlton on this stay (and other top 5 star properties anywhere in the world on other stays) are the extorionate rates they charge for the use of a computer to check an email. The charge 15SG$ an hour to use a computer in their business center is a rip off. Thus I paid another 100SG$ per night to upgrade to a club room to have access to a computer. This antagonised me and would only encourage me to choose another property on a future visit. Please remember that not all people are on expense accounts and the facility to check an email is as important to some customers as a morning shower. As long as the Ritz Carlton or any other hotel for that matter continue to charge outrageous rates for the use of an internet I will not in principle use that facility again. Having said all that this hotel proved itself to be in a category and class of its own when something went wrong. Let me briefly tell you the story. I always travel with an Ipod and listening to music is an important feature of my holiday. On the day before I left I could not find my Ipod. I checked at the swimming pool to see if I had left it there, but to no avail. One hour after reporting it missing, I received a phone call from the head of housekeeping. They had indeed found my ipod. I had left it on my bed. It was removed with linen and towels and sadly went into the wash. This was my own fault for not taking better care of my own property. However the Ritz took complete responsibility for the damage that was done. The head of housekeeping offered to replace the Ipod, and she understood fully that I would miss my music on a long flight back to europe and was not going to allow that to happen. She bought tapes of all my favourite songs and artists. Over 300 songs were downloaded (in her own time) on to the new Ipod for me and then graciously given to me with a written apology, a bottle of wine and a sincere thank you, for my understanding that what happened was an unintentional accident. I am still over the moon with the graciousness by which the Ritz in Singapore handled this problem. The service provided to me with regard to this matter was beyond all reasonable expectations of what a hotel should deliver when something goes wrong. The matter was handled magnificently and the head of housekeeping is a credit to this beautiful hotel. I will never have a problem staying here again for such a service delivered with real quality and style. Please please do something about your crazy internet charges

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Amits
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Difficult to find something a miss. Outstanding rooms, large bathrooms with a deep tub overlooking the water. This is true luxury. Another great part of this hotel is the mini bar - priced perhaps like a duty free, very well stocked with wide variety and replenished as often as requested. SPAs small but nice and the massage is value for money compared to what one needs to pay outside for a massage. The buffet has wide variety and they try and please everyone. Overall very nice hotel and completely worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer Service, High Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jtcadv
Reviews.Content: All I can say is there is a reason "the Ritz" mean luxury. the hotel itself, the physical structure, it pretty typical and unremarkable for a Ritz or 5-star hotel, but the customer service is amazing. They were re-doing some bathrooms a couple of floors below and when I mentioned that evening at dinner I could hear some hammering, the waitress told her manager, who came over to our table and immediately volunteered, unsolicited, to move us to another room, and an upgrade at that. I was blown away by their friendliness, professionalism and courtesy. This, after staying 2 nights at the Marina Sand Casino across the river. There is no comparison. The Ritz (which was actually cheaper than the awful sands) was absolutely up to the task. there was nothing they couldn't do. I will not make the mistake of staying anywhere but here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from Ritz carlton”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: Pros : 1. Situated next to a shopping mall, Marina Bay 2. Huge room 3. Bvlgari toiletries 4. Wide variety of magazines provided in the rooms Cons : 1. Dated rooms 2. Breakfast buffet was not as impressive as other 5 stars i have tried 3. Very hard mattress....felt like sleeping on a plank There was a leakage in the toilet on the night we arrived. Called the front desk to complain/seek assistance but the only after 4th attempt...did the staff came. It was already past midnight and I was extremely exhausted...hoping to shower and go to bed. So you can imagine how irritated I was to face that kind of situation. Good thing was the duty manager managed to locate another room for me to switch to (cause the leakage was quite severe). The hotel maintenance sure needs to buck up!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best hotel i have ever visit!”
Reviews.Author: Michael-TCS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed and my wife at Ritz -Carlton Millenia Singapore for three days at a Singapore Airlines stop over in August 2009. I know that i am a little late but i must write some things for this hotel. There are no words how good this hotel is. I do not know where to start, from the beautiful room with the best view and the large bed (it is our first time that we sleep with the curtains open because we want to see the great view) the bathroom with the large window over looking at Singapores harbor. What can i say for the hotel staff! All the time we felt that anything we want we can have it. They also gave as a free night when we visit Singapore again. If i visit Singapore this year i will stay at Ritz -Carlton Millenia Singapore no matter the cost. I mustn't forget the person who make me feel like i have a friend in Singapore even if i was 9000 Km away from home and he is the reason that i choose Ritz -Carlton Millenia Singapore in my next trip is the bellhop. one of the best employs i have ever meet.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is indeed classy”
Reviews.Author: hgmoorthy
Reviews.Content: A classy hotel by all standards! Superb rooms especially if you are lucky to get the ones that face the Marina in Singapore. I was lucky. Bathrooms are very spacious.. cant blame you if you would want to relax there instead of the room! Amazing location and access to Singapore's happening downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelivable !! Dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: escube_studio
Reviews.Content: It's a dream place to stay....everything is nice !!! Just haven on earth !!

Reviews.Title: “didnt enjoy my stay there :(”
Reviews.Author: Nuzst
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 nights in Ritz carlton over an weekend. As it was Singapore's school holidays, the hotel is overwhelmed with families with young children. We need to queue about 20-30mins for breakfast, for 2 days. Our room is located near the elevator, and constantly able to hear people walking and talking pass our room. Also traffic noise can be heard from our room which is on 25 flr. One of the night, one of the rooms on our floor is so noisy till 12am! Screams and shouting can be heard even from our room. But after numerous complaint calls to the reception, the noise stopped. However, the hotel service is good, especially the concierge & front desk. Bed is comfy and bathroom is spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: JoeCool_KL
Reviews.Content: This hotel as very nice and large rooms which provide the luxury expected. The bathroom is large with bath tub, shower and double sink. It is located within the Marina area which has lots of shopping centers, convention centers as well as the new Sands casino. Being a 6 star hotel, I did expect more in terms of the ambience. However, the hotel lobby was quite sterile and small. The staff were cordial but not as personal and friendly as other Ritz Carlton hotels or 5 star hotel chains. I would stay in this hotel due to the location especially if you have meetings at the Marina area or want to be within the Marina area. However, for the price - I would have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to look above the skyline in Singapore , stay in Ritz Carlton Millenia”
Reviews.Author: Sharad_agn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ritz for a couple of days and I enjoyed the panoramic view from the room windows and all the same from the large window by the bathtub . My previous stays in other hotels seemed to loose charm in front of Ritz. The staff is friendly and the buffets served catered to our likings. Room service was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Cruise end”
Reviews.Author: Anita-JanieH
Reviews.Content: The R-C Millenia was awesome. Hubby bought me a champagne/rose petal bath for my birthday(actually in 1998). What luxury with an amazing view of the city lights from the bath and our room.

Reviews.Title: “well-deserved six stars”
Reviews.Author: gbarbastathis
Reviews.Content: The RC continually earns is reputation. Personalized service, excellent amenities, helpful staff, and excellent food options whether at the Greenhouse or room service or the other restaurants nearby. I stay there quite often and feel I've been spoiled ... few hotels in Singapore or elsewhere could possibly match it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 5 star hotels with incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: bunechca
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit in this hotel – in February of 2010 – on the back way from Boracay. As for me, I adore this hotel and consider it one the best 5 star hotel in the world. Their standards of service and hospitality force you to feel yourself the most important guest – a member of the family. We made reservation with Singapore stopover holidays and upgraded for additional payment on Club suite with Marina Bay view. First time we lived in standard Club room and this time we wanted to try difference. I like luxury and I really got it here. When our taxi approached the hotel we were greeted and invited on the club floor where during we were sipping Champaign Moet and Chan don, staff made our check in. Here I first time tried club service and understood that it is very comfortable and worth money, because you get exclusive service and “free” breakfast, internet, appetizers during the whole day and alcoholic drinks. Besides, now trying different Club Lounge services in many hotels, I can say that so far Ritz Club standards are faultless. So we were accompanied in our suite on the 29 floor. It was exquisite accommodation: two rooms – large and spacious drawing room and bed room with huge king size bed. Bathroom was extraordinary large with windows, 2 sinks, bath and shower. The only complaint was very small toilet room comparing to such grand size of bathroom. It was such pleasure to lay in bath and enjoy watching what happened outside. The bed was very comfy, linen was excellent. The view of Marina bay was breathtaking. Big LCD with DVD was in bed room and one more LCD in drawing room. All furniture, design was top notch. Room cleaned of course very efficient. As for me, I liked our room very much. Club staff and the dishes which offer in Club lounge costs additional attention. I still remember some of them Fadly, Jallee and Amira – they do their best to satisfy your needs. They gave me a good advice what to see and where to dine and which club to visit. Very, very pleasant people. Breakfast and dishes during the whole day are changing every day. The chef offers every day something new. Everything was very delicious. Their evening appetizers and dishes were enough for us and we didn’t go to other restaurants. We didn’t visited Gym but saw that it was large and well equipped with training apparatus. Swimming pool had rather large size and enough quantity of Chaise lounges around. Some people don’t like the location of Ritz Carlton, but I think they have a very comfortable one. Near Krys Flyer, Marina Bay – 10 minutes walk from nearest MRT station. And you have outstanding view from your room either Marina Bay or Callang Bay. In the whole, it is luxurious, top notch proper 5 star hotel, but the price is rather high. I can recommend it whose who likes the highest level of hospitality and standards.

Reviews.Title: “What you can expect from this brand is...”
Reviews.Author: JollapParis
Reviews.Content: What you can expect from this brand is delivered. I nonetheless miss some kind of personality that would tell me that this place is unique, but I guess that' s over what we are dealing with here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Have Every Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: VickyN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz pre-cruise for 3 nights. I was in a Club Level room with Kallang Bay View. I cannot say enough about this hotel. The staff was amazing; their service was impeccable and their friendliness a joy. By all means, book a Club room! I never needed to eat or drink outside the hotel due to the constant array of delectable food and beverage offerings in the lounge. My room was just as advertised; 8 pillows and all! The tub, with the hex window over the tub, was a thrill to see in person! After 25 hours of travel time, it was the first thing I enjoyed after I finished the wine and the complimentary tasty bites that were delivered shortly after I arrived in my room. I had originally booked a Marina Bay View room but when prices dropped on the Kallang Bay room, I switched. I was happy with the great view of Kallang Bay as the Club Lounge has the Marina Bay view so I was able to enjoy both. As a side note, the hop-on hop off bus is a great way to see the city and the Night Safari with dinner should not be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: lanjiaolang
Reviews.Content: The Good: Check-in was a breeze, they even had drink dispensers opposite the reception counter serving gatorade, flavoured ice tea (the bottled type) and ice water. Requested for a late check out and an extension was given till 2pm the next day. Nice views of the marina bay from both the room and the toilet. Nice room with a sofa and work desk. Plenty of toiletries including toothbrush sets. Mostly helpful staff who answered questions with a smile and took the extra trouble when seeking directions. Nice gym with sauna and steam room. Pool was well landscaped and has a heated jacuzzi. The Bad: Location isn't exactly in the midst of the action but with the opening of the new MRT station across the road, it does make travel more accessible. Morning sun is blocked by the hotel building, so don't expect a tan till late morning. Some tiles in the pool are uneven, so care has to be taken when wading in the pool They do not clean under the cupboards often, so there is a visible layer of dust under there. The doors are paper thin, from outside the room (doors closed) i was conversing with my friend who was taking a bath. The guy (with an almost incomprehensible accent) came around to ring my doorbell asking to replenish the mini bar at 1+pm when i was getting ready to check out. Obviously they do not check how long does each guest stay or else he would have known to come and replenish it after i checked out. Free parking was limited to one exit per stay, which i found rather inconvenient. Overall, a nice, decent hotel, but would not recommend it for its lack of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The best club experience in the world!”
Reviews.Author: djhm
Reviews.Content: We had some problems but the staff genuinely wanted to make certain problems were solved and we were satisfied with the outcomes. We booked 2 suites and 2 club rooms and all were well maintained and had great views. The rest of our hotel experiences were normal for 5 star places but the Ritz Club experience was in a class of its own. We spent quite a lot of time in the club and were totally impressed at the level of professionalism and service from all of the club staff. We had some particular favourites including Fadley but all were great. We have stayed in the Presidential Suite at the Hong Kong Hyatt and the Ritz Club staff excelled even beyond the HK Hyatt staff - now that's saying something! Congratulations Ritz Carlton Millenia - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “5 star? I'm not so sure.”
Reviews.Author: teetoose
Reviews.Content: I sent the following email to them only to get a "thank you appreciate your feedback" kind of response.. 1. Staff comes in to check minibar everyday. He knocks the door but basically did not give enough time for me to respond. So first problem, why check everyday even when I’m staying for more than 1 day? Isn’t there a more efficient way of doing this? Secondly, do not assume there’s no one in the room even when it’s during the day time. Thirdly, he comes at 11.10am even on that day I’m supposed to check out which I assume there will be another check of the minibar upon checking out. Very hardworking but totally unnecessary. 2. The toilet flush handle gets stuck every now and then. Resulting in waste of water and I have to go “unstuck” the handle a few times. 3.There doesn’t seem to be an accessible power point for the kettle. If it’s there it’s not visible to us. The kettle also takes too long to boil, please upgrade your equipments. 4.Cable TV reception is not good. It’s fuzzy and the picture gets “hanged” a few times when I watched the discovery channel. 5.Occasional sounds of drilling around the area. Albeit just a few times. 6.Curtains are not easy to draw, they are just too heavy. It seems to need some oiling. 7.Touchscreen at the gym’s treadmill is not working well. I used the one closest to the mirror. I can’t change the TV channels for nuts. Probably spent more calories pressing the screen than running on the machine. The only “5 star” thing in the entire experience are the views from your room and the responsiveness and quality of your staffs (except some in the restaurant) at the lobby and at the front office. They are often friendly, helpful and always attempt to resolve any issues or questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Large Rooms, Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1andTwins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 3 nights for Easter Break (left on Good Friday). Booked a package from Hong Kong and got an excellent deal, considering 5 seats (2 adults + 3 children) and 2 connecting rooms including breakfast. Check in was fairly smooth, had to wait a few minutes for the 2nd room to be ready. Two connecting rooms (through additional hallway giving a lot of extra space) on 8th floor. Though close to escalators which you could hear but definitely not too loud. Room service was speedy, kids options on room too. Great size rooms with large bathrooms with excellent view. Separate shower and toilet. Extra bed took another 2 phone calls (and many apologies). Staff genuinely interested, talking to the kids, remembering their names. Coloring books, crayons, pencils, everything was available for them. Special (more choice) kids menu in restaurant as well. Great breakfast buffet with plenty of choice and good quality products. Price level for f&b on the higher end but then it's a 5* hotel and it's the Ritz. Alcohol is pretty expensive compared to food, also at other places. Nice pool area with comfortable beds, good towels, call service, etc (no life guard). Nice waterfall, also to cancel out the noise from the street, I think. Kids had a good time. Efficient service for both housekeeping and turn down service. Overall, all you could expect from the Ritz. Hotel is not brand new, probably a few years old, which you can tell here and there if you look carefully, but very clean, well kept and maintained. A good choice for business travelers, but definitely suitable for children as well. A new MRT station close by with open soon. We used a lot of taxis to travel to different areas. Esplanade Mall (with a few restaurants) and a few other malls are within walking distance. Next door to Mandarin Oriental and Pan Pacific. Free wifi in public areas and was able to use free internet and printing in business center as well. Requested a late check out (for at least one room) and got one free of charge for one room until 4 pm, even though Good Friday seemed like a busy day with lots of arrivals. Speedy, correct check out. Would definitely recommend, especially if you get a deal that is to good too miss out on.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: abhishekpradhanap
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel I ve ever stayed. In regards to hospitality, management everything it was beyond the expectation

Reviews.Title: “brand disconnect”
Reviews.Author: Atul1998
Reviews.Content: Landed on a redeye from new york city, and got a room, good view/well appointed. Got ready off to work, return after all day of work, crash into bed. At midnight major disturbance. Room opposite to me was occupied by some locals, who seemed to be packing and repacking cases of toys etc, in the foyer, creating a ruckus, with kids running around screaming, complete mess in the hallway. Staff are helping this family in creating the ruckus, apologized but sound doesnt abate. Call to night manager to no avail. Bad enough for me to switch out of the room, they cant accomodate and too late to switch out of the hotel as i was flying to HK. Later i get a note with apologies from the manager, but thats it. I would a) expected some immediate corrective action at the time and b) take the room charge off the bill (couldnt sleep) - despite it being the firm's money, its the gesture. Completely disappointed with the brand promise - come on, its the Ritz?

Reviews.Title: “Suite very nice but crowed Club Floor Lounge”
Reviews.Author: WaikikiMan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in a Club Floor Suite. The room was very clean and well appointed. However, I would prefer the cable internet connection be in the main room and not the bedroom. The toilet is located in a very small room off the main bathroom. I noticed a small floor rug around the toilet that blocked the door from opening and closing. I suggest the hotel discard placing a floor rug around the toilet. I also suggest the hotel update the shower stall to provide a handheld shower instead of fixed to the wall. Very nice views from the room, very comfortable bed and main hallway was quiet. The Club Lounge was very crowded a breakfast and other servings. I noticed each day the cook ran out of items to cook omelletes about 40 minutes before closing and did not replenish. Hot snacks also ran out at lunch serving and dinner serving with an hour or so and were not replenished. I was somewhat surprised to see children are allowed on the club floor as that is discouraged at other hotels in Singapore like Swissotel/Fairmont and Pan Pacific club floors. Check-out on the Club Floor was not smooth. I suggest there be a dedicated area for guests to sit when checking out instead of the lounge food service area, which is distracting for the staff as well as guests. Upon check-out, staff seemed unaware from my booking that hotel car to airport was included in the rate. I will stay at the Ritz Millenia again but hope the Club Floor Lounge is not so crowded next time. Contrary to other reviewers, I thought the Club Floor Suite was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel with great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: RestEasyPerth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Ritz in a Kalang Bay View Room with our 7 month old boy. Hotel itself is beautiful with stunning art work throughout and facilities including pool and fitness centre are excellent. Pool is 25 mts with a 1.4mt depth throughout which was great when wading with our baby but is equally good for swimming laps. Plenty of lounges surrounding pool and busiest on weekends. Fitness centre was fantastic with all modern equipment, great sauna, steamroom and the change room provides toiletries, lockers and robes - v.nice. Jacuzzi and cold plunge pool attached to main pool area. The room itself is very large, more like a suite which suited us perfectly when it came to extra room for our baby to play on floor and room for the cot. Couch by the big open window faces opposite the king sized bed. The windows really made the room special for us, especially the one over the bath. We did not find any of the fit out antiquated or tired, but rather classy and timeless. The staff were always friendly in a sincere manner and ready to assist. The food at the buffet breakfast was extensive in choice and quality to taste (I couldn't stay away from the multitude of cheeses offered). The best part of our stay at the Ritz though was the attention to detail, the small things. For example, the turn down service which included putting cute little book marks on our bed and turning the tv on and turning it to face the bed for our return. Also, greeting us by name on occasion which we didn't expect in a large capacity hotel. Sitting us at a booth at breakfast each morning because they remembered we prefered that. Location is great, connecting right on to Marina Square shopping centre and a stones throw from Suntec city for more restaurants and shopping (and laundry places). No down side to our stay at all. We would definately return given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sensitiveKowloon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed every bit, nice and clean. Very pricy though, not for everyone, I felt it after spending three days. Staff very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Go there for the view (and pay for it)”
Reviews.Author: ze_shark
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night there on our way back from Langkawi. Location is great, the view from our room too as we took the upgrade. Room feels luxurious, but in a kitsch kind of way with lots of gold plating around. Service is good, but the feel of the lobby and breakfast restaurant is still very industrious, busy, not quite the cosy and serene atmosphere one would expect. Staff was accommodating, kept our luggage and allowed us to change in the fitness center before heading to the airport for our midnight flight. Still, paying so much for a very ordinary breakfast and small details like ludicrously expensive internet and 8$ for a simple coke can from the minibar gave me the distant impression that I was getting milked. Still, a great experience for the view and a practical location to go wandering around in the colonial district.

Reviews.Title: “Club rooms not worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: HatSisters
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel to be near the fireworks for New Years Eve and we really were! A great location – but a bit of a walk to the nearest Metro station. Good room – and of course wonderful bathroom – although a bit dated – generally all in need of refurbishment. We stayed in a club room but the club lounge was really very crowded and noisy – so we went down to the main restaurant and had breakfast in our room. The club lounge seemed to be a family feeding station – all the staff were very helpful and courteous but the set times in the lounge for pre dinner drinks and canapés (really a free kids size meal) and after dinner drinks meant that it wasn’t a relaxed or sophisticated affair – everyone seemed to want to get as much free food as possible! No wifi in the rooms. Public spaces in need of refurbishment eg lift carpets threadbare. On the plus side there is much good art in the hotel (Hockney etc) and a free ipod tour from the main desk is well worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Average room for the price but Club Lounge service impeccable”
Reviews.Author: shaunsia
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel during the Chinese New Year eve and overall it was an unforgettable experience from cleaniness of the hotel to professionalism of the staffs. Let me start off by commenting on the arrival and check-in. The lobby does give you that grandeur and 'Ritz-Carlton' feel and I must say the only hotel lobby in Singapore that is able to match will be the Fullerton. I was escorted to the lobby check-in desk and offered a drink. When checking in I was told that since I have booked a Club Room my check-in will be on the Club Floor. Check-in on the Club Floor was nice, sitting comfortably in the Club Lounge while waiting for the staff to bring me my room key. I was also granted a late check-out at 3 pm. Everything was perfect till I stepped into my room. The moment I entered the room, the first thought was the room looks much smaller than I had perceived, and it did not help that the room although looks very clean and tidy, is mediocre at best and does not feel opulent at all. The only comfort thing was the bathroom bathtub, which give you an unobstructed view of the marina and it was really heavenly to soak in the bathtub with a view at night. I must say the bath amenities was also abit disappointing, where they come in miniscule size and not very well stocked. The pressure on the shower head was another glitch for me, as it was not stable and throughout my shower I have to constantly adjust the pressure. I must give credit to the bed, very very comfortable with lots of pillows. They do have pillow menu but I couldn't be bothered to change. One of the nicest Club Lounge I have been to. They have private rooms if you want some privacy or engage in meeting. The Club Lounge have five servings of food per day, along with unlimited flow of champagne. I was not too impressed with the selection of food as they are quite limited, but the quality was good. The check-out was done in a manner where other hotels could follow. All you need to do is to tell any staff on the Club Floor you are checking out, and then just take a sit and enjoy your food and champage, while the staff prepare your bill and bring it personally to you desk. No unnecessary queue you will experience (see my other review on Conrad Singapore). Overall it was a great experience and if it is your first time in Singapore looking for luxurious hotel stay this is a must try, provided that you spend abit more to stay in the Club Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Rooms in need of renovation, not Ritzy”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: I had a short one night stay in Singapore on transit and decided to try out the Ritz Carlton Millenia. One of Ritz Carlton first few properties in Asia, the design of the hotel was groundbreaking during the time of it’s opening in the 90s and among the distinctive feature is the famed bathroom with a view. During that time, Singapore had very limited selection of contemporary luxury hotels and the Ritz Carlton Millenia was a pioneer. Arrival I arrived by taxi from the airport and a friendly but a bit robotic female staff escorted me first to the counter for check-in. Later I was told I should check-in at the club level because I booked a club room. However, at the club lounge, I was told to wait while she apparently go looking for the staff that can help me with the check-in. There is no dedicated check-in desk at the club lounge for some strange reasons. After like a 5 to 10 mins wait ( too long for me ), I got the keys and another staff escorted me to my room. The Room Well, the room might be described flatteringly as “understated luxury” but to me, it’s very dull and plain. To put it critically, it’s worn out, tired, faded and in other words, not “Ritzy”. Don’t get me wrong, all the basics are there. There’s a comfortable king size bed with quality linens, a sofa seating area and a good-size work desk. The air condition is quiet and work well. The bathroom, which the RC Singapore is so famous for also fail to impress me. Sure, the bathtub with the Octagonal window by the side remains an eye-catching and distinctive design feature. But it’s not a full ensuite. There’s only a single basin. The shower cubicle doesn’t have rainforest shower or shower stick. Toiletries (Bvlgari) are of the miniscule type. The marble is worn out and faded. This is a bathroom that had seen better days. At least the towels are fluffy and the water pressure adequate. There are also major problems with the design and layout of the room. Starting with the Tv ( a 37” LCD ) that was chucked inside a armoire and positioned in such a awkward position that the only place to watch the Tv comfortably is from the working desk. The plugs are awkwardly positioned at the back of the sofa chair and the back wall of the desk. Why aren’t these plugs positioned at the side of the table or build into the work desk? For a Ritz Carlton room, I am seriously unimpressed. The room does not convey any sense of luxury to me. It’s more like a 3 or 4 star hotel room from appearance. Really, the whole room is just crying out for a renovation and it has not been renovated and refreshed since the 90s. One thing good is that the view is very nice, perhaps the nicest I’ve seen in Singapore. The room I booked has a great view of the Kallang bay area with a six lane highway. I can only assume the Marina Bay view will be much better but the room rate is also corresponding much higher. The Club Lounge The Ritz Carlton Millenia has the reputation of hosting one of the best club lounge in Singapore. Overall it’s a reasonably good size lounge and is nice and cozy and served a good selection of food and drinks during meal times. But it doesn’t have the size and grandeur of the better club lounges that I have experienced, including it’s sister property in Jakarta. I’ve only tried their evening cocktail which is just OK. There’s also free flow of champagne for those that are interested in this. It gets a bit crowded too because frankly speaking, the lounge isn’t that large, again just knock down a few rooms and converted into a club lounge kind of thing. The Common Areas This is one area that the hotel is holding up quite well. Those giant hanging structures are quite impressive. The hotel also house an impressive art collection ( more than 4,500 pieces I was told ). The gym is well equipped with the latest technogym equipment. Swimming pool area has a resort feel to it with cabanas but I feel the size is a bit on the small side. Service Other than the initial check-in hiccups, service is otherwise prompt and efficient. I didn’t need to wait for anything. Most of the staff are consistently polite and friendly although I notice the club lounge staff do seems a bit more friendly towards the Caucasian guests. However, as this is a short stay so to be fair, I can’t say too much of the service. Conclusion For a premier luxury hotel of the Ritz Carlton chain, this hotel is distinctly average. Perhaps the hotel’s age explained the less than glamorous room condition but the equally old Four Seasons have rooms in much better condition. And if compare with the way more luxurious and brand new St Regis, it seriously fall short. Until the hotel decided to renovate or at least refresh the rooms, I’ll give it a 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Singapore - period.”
Reviews.Author: deepfriedpuppy
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively to Singapore and eventually living there for 3 years, I will tell you in my opinion this is the best 5* hotel in Singapore. I returned to Singapore with my young family in January and split my stay between Resorts World Sentosa and The Ritz-Carlton. In truth, I should have probably spent my whole stay at thr Ritz-Carlton because it is simply exceptional. It was always my preferred hotel to stay in; the attention to detail, the level of service and the spectacular view from the large rooms is worth every penny (make sure you book a room with a view). Little details such as the staff remembering your name really adds to the experience. Location is great , restaurants fantastic and it is one of my favourite hotels in the world. Take my advice if you are reading this and not sure about your choice in Singapore, its the only one to book. In fairness, the Mandarin Oriental does a decent job and so does The Fullerton, but the Ritz-Cartlon does the job the best. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Luxury But Internet Connection a Headache”
Reviews.Author: Jetspin
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ritz-Carlton for a little over a week for business. Excellent service and large, clean, comfortable room and bathroom to spread out and make myself at home. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the sheets crisp and fresh -- perfect after working all day and into the night. Staff very friendly and helpful and the exec lounge always had good food, wine and champagne available. My one big gripe is about the internet connection. It took me and most of my colleagues days to figure out how to weave the hotel connection past our company's firewall. I'm not technical and don't understand these things but it shouldn't be that hard. It's always a relief when you plug into a hotel network and it works the first time...unfortunately no such luck at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Ritz-Carlton recently. It is now hands down my favourite hotel in Singapore! I had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental last year, and was bowled over by the experience. However, the Ritz-Carlton holds the edge over MO. In terms of restaurants, MO may have a slight upper hand, but the rooms at the Ritz-Carlton win the day. The rooms are huge, and the bathrooms are enormous! The rooms are in the older tyle, but are classy, well maintained and a real treat. When I stayed at MO, I thought that the service levels were phenomenal, but the Ritz-Carlton matches them in every respect and then some! Being greeted by name when you arrive from the airport (no idea how they did that!) is just the beginning of the experience. My only (trivial) complaint was that the choice of imported beers at the lounge was limitd when contrasted with MO's fantastic list - something I hope they will work on. This is one hotel that I will definitely be returning to.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay at the Ritz with the Family”
Reviews.Author: KiwiFromDownUnder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for 5 days in Jan 2010 - and it was good, but not great. We stayed in a huge club suite with family + young children, and so had access to the club facilities on the top floor. The club lounge is really nice with awesome views, but there's a few things that really annoyed me. They allow you to stay in the club lounge even after checkout - you have to ask - very useful when your departing flight is at 11:00PM, and you can relax in the lounge. The biggest annoyance was stale drinks in the lounge - the staff reuse open cans of soft drink, so when ordering a drink - you can expect stale coke with your whisky. This really annoys me, because I'm paying $150 extra per day for club facilities - and I get stale soft drinks!!! No way mate. Also, the cleaning of the club lounge is not the best (food on carpet, etc). The other disappointment is the swimming pool - not child friendly, really bland and the furniture is cheap and crappy. Much better pool facilites at other 5 star resorts such as the Shangri-La in Orchard. Next time will most likely stay at other 5 star hotels nearer to Orchard next time, as the shopping malls around Ritz are cheap and cheerful. In hindsight, we spent each day taking at taxi to Orchard (much better shopping), so will stay closer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Excellent Service - Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cat0205
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz on a stopover to Australia with Singapore airlines so was good value. Also received a discount on food in the hotel. The staff are excellent and very attentive whenever you require anything. The room was very clean and immaculate. Both the bedroom and bathroom were large and spacious. Lovely swimming pool. Easy walking distance to restaurants and transport to tourist places. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stopover in Singapore - great views!!”
Reviews.Author: brooke103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took advantage of the low rates for hotels via the "Singapore Stopover" promotion from Singapore Airlines. We had an overnight there on our way to the Maldives, and couldn't pass up an opportunity to try the Ritz-Carlton there. Even though we arrived at 1am or so, the front desk staff were friendly and courteous, and we felt we were being treated as though we were arriving during normal hours (not always the case in some hotels). The rooms were large and chic - with spectacular views of Singapore. We were on a higher floor, and we just couldn't get over how far we could see! The bathtub was also in the window with the huge window and amazing views - very nice bathroom. The winner - the shower! The shower head had the most pressure of any hotel we've ever stayed in. It was WONDERFUL! The breakfast was nice, though we noticed most guests seemed to be businessmen and not on vacation like ourselves. The location was great - we walked to the Singapore Flyer and seemed to be very close via cab to almost anything....although I think that's the case anywhere in Singapore. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: anujdubey
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a night and the stay was just perfect and amazing in a well done room! though we didnt have the breakfast , but i presume that it has a good food, the location is very close to the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “High-class”
Reviews.Author: chuprasov
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. All rooms as well as bathrooms have amazing panoramic windows. So it was possible to relax taking a bath and enjoy the view. We were staying at the Hotel in December during the Christmas and NY eve. The hotel was looking festive and had nice decoration. A huge Christmas tree in foyer and a huge pie in the bar, Christmas chorus. Location of the hotel is the ideal, few minutes walking from Esplanade and observation wheel.

Reviews.Title: “Opulant with nice touches”
Reviews.Author: TravellingQuoll
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly (but sometimes it's nice not to chat!!) and efficient, although room service was a tad eclectic . Room was well appointed, very roomy, with good quality (if a little worn) furnishings. The view will be good once the construction site over the bay is finished! Although if I were to stay there again I'd chose the Kallang Bay view. The pool is very nice, set in greenery and completely screened from view. We were able to use the gym locker rooms to shower between check out and our flight, which was great. The location isn't very good unless you're going everywhere by taxi. It's quite a walk to the nearest MRT and after a day and night at the zoo it's a long way!! Experienced the buffet breakfast just for the hell of it.... wouldn't bother again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingTaxman
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton is a mirror image of Singapore. It is rich, clean, new and perfect. Almost a little too perfect... The staff is attentive, polite and plentiful. There is not much wrong with the place! The breakfast buffet is grand, albeit expensive. Singapore is a very clean city, where everyone respects the rules and no one crosses the street on a red light. The Ritz-Carlton fits right in if you are looking for high-end perfection. To my taste, all of it is a little surreal and overly "sanitized", but that is not the hotel's fault! As mentioned by many others, the views from the bathtub is truly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: PassionateVoyager
Reviews.Content: The service of the staff was excellent and customer oriented. The feeling was like everyone is dying to serve the guests. The room was very large with seperate walk-in closet. Beds and pillows were comfortable. The level of cleanliness was up to the mark. Bath tub besides the huge glass window with city view was pretty cool. The hotel is bit old but has been maintained very well.

Reviews.Title: “Weekday brunch”
Reviews.Author: 1K
Reviews.Content: Joined friends staying at te Ritz yesterday for brunch..we had to choose the main resturant as the only other option offered was poolside and it was pouring down. Beautiful room and fantastic food but very lacklustre service to be honest. Not enough staff on duty meant that many dishes were not replenished and we had to wait on three separate occasions for the chef to slice meats. The waiter had to be told not to reach accross someone still eating to retrieve a plate...and the only other time we were approached by staff was to say the buffet was closing in 15 minutes and exactely 15 minutes later the whole place was a crashing, banging clear in and we were unable to finish our coffees in peace. Very disappointing and at $S70 a head very pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: EMBMaryland_DC
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. Open, spacious, incredibly attentive and gracious staff, etc... My room was beautiful and everything you know or expect of Ritz-Carltons if you're accustomed to those in the US. The hotel is adjacent to tons of shopping and other hotels, and very accessible to other key areas. The location is walkable and feels safe. It is, of course, extremely expensive. But most people who end up there are expecting that so won't be so shocked by the sticker price (on things like the buffet breakfast or lunch for instance.) The food is great - if you do take advantage of the buffets they're really terrific. If you're travelling on business and you opt for the executive transfer/pick-up from the airport you will be treated like a visiting celebrity and whisked through a VIP custom area to a waiting sedan. The height of luxury. Of course, for 1/4th the price you can just take a cab but that's nowhere near as much fun!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back to Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: Lobby was very average. Even the lift and corridor looks average. A little aged i must say. But once I entered into the room, I was amazed! Room have lots of sunlights and very very spacious. Probably bout 40 sqm ? Best was amazing! One of the very best I've slept on. Just love those hotels with the feather topper. The best part of the hotel is the amazing view from the bathtub. Makes u feel like a million dollar! Having a soak while over wine gazing at the view... And the uses Bvlgari toiletries! What a pampering hotel. Shower was powerful and TV channels are great. The pool is big enuf as most singapore hotels have small pool. They even have a hot jacuzzi and a cold pool! Really ice cold. For the hot and cold theraphy i guess. Located next to a big shopping centre with endless food supplies. Will come back to Ritz again!

Reviews.Title: “Rescued by the Staff”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for work - been here before for same trip, was interested to see if they'd updated the hotel - they haven't - poor location for the CBD - need a taxi everywhere - arranged to be collected from the airport and would strongly recommend this, especially if 2 more - whisked through immigration, bags collected for you and had express check in room very, very tired - it was non smoking room but certainly not non smoking floor - the view was great - but bath faced the wall instead of the cityscape - stupid - huge shower with excellent pressure - lots of towels - bed comfy, pillows too soft (too old?) food was ok (only had breakfast) -horrendously expensive though and not worth the price - US$10 for a draught beer, and not even a pint - crazy - no real nice outside area either unless you are smoking - a few tables out front more of an afterthought than anything - silly for a city like Singapore overall the only thing that rescued this place was a fantastic rate and the excellent staff - but you expect great service at all Ritz Carltons so that should be a given - its the hardware here that lets its down

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a mind blowing place to be”
Reviews.Author: Priyank007
Reviews.Content: The moment we stepped into this hotel with my family and friends on our annual vacation, we always knew we have made the correct decision to stay here. The staff has been very friendly and helpful and they escorted us to our room. We had taken an upgarde to the club rooms by paying just 90SGD extra per room which included all day meals n snacks at the club lounge (which was so much worth it) The room was so big, roomy and luxurious. The bathroom was even a bigger surpise. It was huge and so royal, perhaps the best bathroom I have ever seen in my entire hotel stay. The tub was huge (almost like a private jacuzzi) and facing the marina bay thorugh a tranparent window. It gave a feeling as if we were having a shower right on the marine bay. I sank in the tub and relaxed for hours reading my book and sipping on my wine. All th other accessories provided (ie. shower gel, soaps, slippers, robes etc) were top of the line and of great quality (BVLGARI). We realized that such treatment is common even in regular rooms. The view was spelndid and the rooms were very comfortable, which made us stay one whole day just in the room. A great hotel. Worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient!”
Reviews.Author: anirban72
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The location is the best possible, overlooking the Marina, and after the mysterious driveway which gives nothing away, one arrives at this spectacular hotel. The staff and the service is flawless. The lobby is smallish (but its Singapore!). The room is gorgeous, the view is breathtaking. The bathroom overlooks the Marina, and nowhere can you get a better view than soaking in the tub! I wish I stayed longer, as this was truly an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: ozFinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of Singapore Airlines Singapore Stopover program on the way back from our honeymoon in Bali. If we'd known in advance what we know now we would have spent much more time in Singapore and less in Bali. The staff at Check-in were very friendly and upon finding out we were there for our honeymoon upgraded our room to one with a city view and on a higher level. The view itself was quite stunning, especially at night, looking out over the new casino construction, the Marina Bay and the Singapore CBD. The room itself was quite spacious, but the TV was in an odd position relative to the bed and the sofa, and couldn't really be comfortably viewed from either of them. My wife found the bed to be a little bit too hard for her liking, I however thought it was just fine. The wonderful windows next to the bath were a nice touch. I would suspect that certain rooms might have some privacy issues, however given the position of our room I didn't find this to be a problem, and there are blinds that can be drawn if you're so inclined. I did quite enjoy luxuriating in the tub with a book looking out over Singapore. We didn't eat in the hotel as there were many restaurants and stalls that we wished to try out in our too short time in the city state. However when I was down at the pool I looked at the menu there and thought the pricing to be rather excessive... Seriously, S$10 for a glass of soft drink?? I would suspect this pricing to be standard through-out the hotel. The daily charges for internet access were again rather expensive, however it does seem to be in keeping with charges at similar level hotels around the world. The hotel itself is a short walk away from the Marina Plaza, which was described as shabby by my guide book. We thought it was quite good and it did satiate my desire for Carl's Jr... Yes, I went to Singapore and got an American hamburger... Cheaper than flying to the US for it! The walk to the SMRT is longer but not unreasonably so. From there it's easy to reach most of the city. It's also a short walk to the Singapore Flyer, which we enjoyed on both occasions that we rode it (once at night and then again during the day). We felt that we explored the Marina Bay area quite well during our stay at the Ritz-Carlton and thus when we return we would stay in a different area. However we would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedWetherby
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe this hotel. Everything was absolutely perfect and for a small cost we had access to the Ritz-Carlton Club on the 32nd floor where the food and drink were exceptional. The service and staff were outstanding and nothing was too much trouble. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel - it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Six stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: erwin_g
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Ritz Carlton Singapore a few times, and it never disappoints me. The room was great, bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was simply fantastic. The hotel is close to Suntec City, Marina Mandarin, and within walking distance to Raffles Hotel, Bugis Junction, the Marina. Buses, trains are available within walking distance. It's not, however, within walking distance to Orchard Road shopping district, but that's not a big loss at all, considering Orchard Road can be congested often.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougieCavan
Reviews.Content: stayed here as part of a stop over to new zealand, reaaly fanatastic, rooms were beautiful, lovely staff, great swimming pool and fantastic buffet breakfast, close to shooping areas

Reviews.Title: “Well-Run 5-star Property, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I've always thought this hotel to be a lovely enclave. One comes straight off the East Coast Parkway from the airport almost directly to the hotel, after passing the Marina Square and Raffles Link malls, and as one approaches one comes up an impeccably manicured driveway closed off from the city by tropical shrubbery, providing a sense of privacy. The lobby is very impressive, with the entrance backlit by light streaming in from a huge hexagonal window from behind. Turning to the check-in area to the right, one is reminded of a cross between a classical European palace and the modernist impression of a train station, with a long, decoratively paneled vaulted arch running the length of the corridor (think of the Bank of China's lobby in Hong Kong, but suffused with light instead of in darkness). I've been staying at this hotel off and on for a decade, since it opened. When it opened it was at the frontier of hotel design, with its rooms having broad ceiling-to-floor windows, wooden veneer floors, and iconic bathrooms with Death Star-like huge hexagonal windows for its bathtubs, now overlooking the massive (but actually rather quiet) construction site that is the Las Vegas Sands Venetian Hotel going up further up the Marina Bay. The site does not dominate the view, mind, and is still a wonderful spectacle of the Singapore CBD, particularly at night. The hotel still sets standards in terms of the functionality as well as the attractiveness of the room's design, and it still appears relatively modern, and the flooring has been kept to a high standard with no wear and tear. But truth be told the design is now no longer avant garde, and to retain its original design cachet the hotel will at some point need to update its rooms' design touches in order to recapture the original magic. But I still think its triangular shaped showers are the best designed I've seen, roomy and preventing spillage of water into the rest of the bathroom, while still being able to turn on the water from the outside. And hard to beat the tubs for a soak in any business hotel. The staff are so obliging and helpful to a fault, and they genuinely seemed to anticipate my needs, from the patient check-in staff, the business center personnel, or the kind server in the Greenhouse restaurant in the morning that remembered that I liked a cappuccino with my breakfast. The gym is not huge but was very attractive and had modern machines, as well as the cold towels and fruit flavored iced waters that are becoming de rigeur in Asian hotels. The breakfast by the way does have a lovely mix of western and singaporean dishes, as well as the obligatory japanese and congee sections. I do still genuinely love this hotel, and found that despite it being primarily a business hotel, the staff were very accommodative to parents with young children. Child seats were brought to our table with no questions asked. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Asian Hotel in need of top notch staff”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern luxurious hotel and would typically represent the lap of luxury for anyone who does not travel in Asia much. The hardware is generally first rate, but the the owners again seem to think that the more people who stand outside the lifts saying "good morning" the better the service must be. once had six people saying Good Morning. But as per usual, the staff have little real idea what truly first class service is. Its fine, but the less ritzy Oriental next door is probably a much better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: megurogirl
Reviews.Content: The members of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They attended to guests' needs promptly and efficiently. They were extremely warm -- always greeting people with a smile -- and very polite. They obviously aimed to please and were successful at it. We always had a good feeling when dealing with the people of this hotel. The room was very spacious and comfortable. It was the bathroom, however, that was the best part. The bathtub was right next to a huge window with a view of the river. It was certainly not your regular bathroom. It was amazing. The buffet spread was overwhelming (in a good way). There was so much to choose from and everything we tried was quite good. Our stay at this hotel was definitely a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: aiguebelle
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the service! The room was spacious and had a full view of the Marina Bay area, which was really beautiful at night. The toilets were awesome, with a full sized glass window that also looked out to the Marina Bay area. There was even an automated button to lower or draw the blinds to the toilet. Service was excellent. After we were checked in, the receptionist immediately offered to help us with our bags (we were each carrying a small duffel). We were showed to our room and personally and given a quick explanation of the room, its features and the uses of the different switches in the room. excellent! we were made to feel like the hotel really cared. Breakfast selection was huge. there was a large variety of hot food, cereals, juices and even ice cream. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: MEW58
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton has the largest standard rooms we have seen. They are well equiped, well laid out with good facilities. The bathrooms are excellent, again very big with quality toiletries. We found all the staff to be very friendly with good service. The hotel is clean and well maintained. There is a good swimming pool and an excellent gym. It is a good location as it is connected to both Marina Square and Suntec City shopping centres and less than a ten minute walk to the City Hall train station. Breakfast selection was very good and of a high quality. The only criticism we would have is that the air conditioning can be a bit cool.

Reviews.Title: “Value but not that Ritzy!”
Reviews.Author: DebCC
Reviews.Content: This si a good hotel with very good service but not quite as fancy as you would hope. The decor is too beige for me and very bland. We had a very large room (definately would work well if you needed a roll away bed etc) but the furnishings are dated. The Club lounge is very good value for money and the Spa staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but not quite top marks”
Reviews.Author: timlips
Reviews.Content: Overall, the service is professional, but impersonal - perhaps difficult to achieve in such a large hotel. For a five star hotel, for example, I would have expected the suitcase to have been put on the stand. Small detail - but you are paying a big price. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious and well appointed. The decor seemed a little worn and the technology a little dated - no wireless network access in the rooms. The breakfast buffet seemed to be a bit of "holiday camp" buffet for the price. At the moment, the harbour side is a giant building site for the new casino's and the work can be heard in the harbourside rooms during the day. I was disappointed that on my last day in the hotel, traffic restrictions were in place - so apparently it was hard to get taxis. I was given a choice of waiting for an hour or paying 5 times the going rate for one of the row of mercs (not operated by the hotel) that were waiting on hand. Not a big deal - but does make you feel as though the hotel wasn't exactly on your side.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and very beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: JoyColarte
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at Ritz, I was stunned by the well-designed garden. The staffs were very nice and hospitable and they always wear the best smiles in the world. I felt like I am at home. I've travelled a lot and been to many countries already. So far, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed. It has spacious bedrooms and very comfortable. It's quite expensive but I think it's worth because this hotel is very beautiful I was able to see the best views of the city. I do loved the spacious room and the best thing, I could see the scenic views while I was relaxing or having a shower. I stayed just for a night because I have to proceed to Kuala Lumpur. However, it is one of the best experiences I had-celebrating my birthday at Ritz! If ever I would have the chance to visit Singapore again, I would definitely stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel with sneaky tricks”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamonr
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for Xmas 2007.When we arrived we were informed in a very casual fashion that the rooms we had reserved and had already been paid for , were unavailable and that we would have to settle for inferior rooms. After a rather unpleasant discussion , we got 2 of the reserved rooms , we were never compensated for the other city-facing room. Sadly , we were also informed that ALL the X-mas activities were already fully booked at least a month in advance by local people who get a special package from the hotel. We had NONE of the special x-mas meals at the hotel .These tricks should be beneath a hotel of this stature!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Well Maintained "Older" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maptraveler
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent at this hotel. Didn't have time to try any of the restaurants. Pool was very large, though very crowded, including many Japanese guests, and some from other places in Asia, the US, and Europe. Room was very large and spacious as was the bathroom and walk in closet (for a hotel room). Unusual were the hard wood floors in the room. I rather liked that, and despite the clatter from walking on it with shoes, apparently you could not hear the footstep sounds coming from any of the adjacent rooms. The TV was a nice large flat screen LCD; although it was one of the leading Japanese brands (I think Sharp or Panasonic), fast moving images still blurred. The desk was set up nicely with some stationary, and mini office supplies. Internet speed was very fast and had no problems connecting. Plug converter provided also. Bathroom has a huge window at the bathtub, which is another unique touch. Bathroom was in good condition, though did have a slightly dated '80s kind of feel to it. I was slightly annoyed that housekeeping did not replenish the Bulgari toiletries very fully. The staff warned that there may be a queue for taxis in the morning, I had no such problems. The location is convenient as well, being a short taxi ride or a long (hot) walk to the CBD. It is also only a few minutes walk to the Esplanade entertainment complex.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated but hard to beat the views”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton has the best views in the City. It is definitely worth the extra $ for a high floor Marina view. The views from the bathtubs at this property are legendary. Service is good, F&B quality is good, and fitness facilities are quite nice. The breakfast buffet is exceptional (though service gets spotty at peak times). The only issues / problems with the property are: - rooms are a bit dated / old and don't have updated outlets / plugs - bathrooms only have one sink - not the most convenient property for tourist sights (e.g., China Town and Orchard); however, taxis are convenient and it is easy to walk from the Ritz down the River to the Quays. The hotel is in a good location for accessing the aiport -- very close to the expressway so only need 15 minutes to get to Changi. If you are a fan of Chihuly, you will love the property. His work is scattered throughout the public spaces and has been incorporated into the design of the inner-gardens. This is isn't my favorite hotel in Singapore but it is a good choice and the views can't be beat. My picks for the city are: Classic / Historical: Raffles or the Fullerton Modern: the Scarlet Easy Access to Orchard: the Four Seasons Resort living: the Sentosa Business: the Four Seasons, Ritz or Mandarin Oriental (the Hyatt and Shangri-La also have good reputations but I haven's stayed at them so can't comment)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sparvar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a special deal (stopover with singapore airlines which worked out at a bargain price of around £100 a night) in August 2007. The hotel is fantastic, leisure facilities and outdoor swimming pool were amazing, this place cannot be faulted. Standard rooms and views are superb. My only comments is that this hotel like Singapore in general felt a little soul-less and too clean. (and I'm sure many will disagree but it's my opinion!). All else aside I would highly recommend this place, it's perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: bk_ny_family
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel I ever stayed in. Stayed there on business. This hotel is pure opulence and elegance, you will not be disappointed in the accomodations and service. My room had a separate bath which was the same size as the bedroom/living area. The bathroom had a separate marble encased jacuzzi bathtub overlooking the singapore skyline and roadways below. The food at the restaurant was impeccable. And most important of all was the amazing service. Every member of the hotel staff greeted me and knew exactly who I was. I was spellbound when the bellhop greeted me by name! I had never had that experience ever. You could approach any member of the staff (housekeeping, etc) and request something and then it would be fulfilled immediately. If I ever had a reason to travel to Singapore - I would not hesitate for a minute to return back to the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be one of the Best”
Reviews.Author: cham3b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the past year on business and the hotel continues to be one of the best in Singapore. The rooms are very large, the service is outstanding and the location is convenient for almost anything you want to do in Singapore.
