If there is a niggle, it is the breakfast buffet which is expensive and which caters a little too much to the Westerner - more local food for breakfast please! Other than that, it is hard to beat and I will continue to use it every time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service, club lounge is well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: loveluxuryholidays_9
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton in Singapore is beautiful! From the moment you walk through the doors the staff are so polite and welcoming and the hotel is lovely! We went for a club room and the club food is excellent. You are fed all day and all the food is prepared to a very high standard, served in beautiful surroundings of the club lounge which overlooks most of Singapore! The club lounge serves breakfast (continental and egg chef), light lunch (sandwiches, fruit and soup), afternoon tea (scones, sandwiches, fruit), evening snacks (noodle soup, fish, rice, veg) and, my favourite, a chocolate buffet before bedtime! Free drinks are also included. Unfortunately our stay in Singapore was very short so we did not get to use the swimming pool (which looked beautiful) or sample the afternoon tea in the main lobby (which also looked amazing), but we will defiantly be back! If you want to treat yourself to a bit of luxury on holiday the Ritz in Singapore most certainly delivers!

Reviews.Title: “Must Try Harder”
Reviews.Author: maxmonza
Reviews.Content: We had read some of the reviews before our stay but decided to take the plunge as the large rooms was attractive for us and we enjoyed an excellent corporate rate. Stayed for a week in early August 2009. We took 2 rooms on the Marina Bay side as these were the only ones which offered a "connecting" option. Unlike most hotels, this means that your rooms open into a small vestibule-like area which then has another set of doors that lead to the main corridor. Useful for us as we had a place to stash strollers, outside shoes, brollies etc and it gave the kids a bit more space to rampage. Thumbs up for the size of the rooms as well. Unfortunately this meant that we had to deal with a little bit of noise from the casino construction going on out in the Marina Bay as well as a bit more (unexpected) noise from the National Day rehearsals taking place on a large stage just opposite our room. We were on the 17th floor and could still hear the dance music/songs etc. To be fair, they stopped by about 10 pm but our 3+ year old and not quite 2 year old sleep fairly early (and lightly!). Still, it was fun to watch especially when the kids were in the bath. Agree that the interiors of the guest rooms need a thorough refurb. Wood floor panels were starting to rise a little in the bedroom and the curtains need a good yank (with resulting rope burn!) to open and close. Minor stains on the sofas. We enjoyed the flat screen tvs (no probs with watching from either the bed or the sofa as they swivel) and the DVD player was great. Hotel volunteered to put humidifiers in each of our rooms (as we were on a smoking floor) - which was terrific. Except we had to remind them every night to top up the water. I suppose we could have done it ourselves but I wasn't keen on messing about with the hotel's machines. Thought it would've been part of the normal evening turndown service but we had that only on our first night. For the rest of our stay, there was no evening turndown. Surprising for a Ritz Carlton. Service was generally inconsistent. We had great service some days and indifferent service on others. On the indifferent days, my husband said it reminded him of how some hotels in Europe hire college students to do the housekeeping - it's not quite the same, somehow. Some days the rooms didn't get done till lunch time. One evening, I was bathing the kids and didn't hear the door bell. I then found a card pushed under our door saying that housekeeping had tried to provide us with "evening service" but were unable to do so. No issue with that. However, the card said that they had called round at 7.30 pm. But it was only 6 pm when I found the card. Perhaps someone wanted to finish her evening round early? Broadband connection in the rooms was fast and stable and included in our corporate rate. Bed - comfy and lots of pillows. Duvet was strangely not in a duvet cover but sandwiched between 2 sheets. The airconditioning was a little temperamental too. Toiletries varied in quality. Some days, we got generic Ritz Carlton packaged stuff. Others, we got Bulgari. As I said earlier, inconsistent. Water pressure in the separate shower cubicle was poor but it was excellent in the bath tub. And there was a very useful bath tub pillow for soaking. Sanitaryware definitely needs an overhaul. Complimentary buffet breakfast was OK. Not great and not Ritz Carlton standard. Egg station had a single man (coping magnificently - I must say) to deal with the breakfast hordes. Surely the Ritz Carlton could afford to put another person on to help? The poor chap had to keep apologising for keeping people waiting (though there wasn't too much of a wait). Also there was the odd bluebottle or 2 in residence. Some local breakfast options would've hit the spot eg. roti canai, thosai, nasi lemak, chee cheong fun. We didn't check out the swimming pool or the gym. Lobby and most public areas were great. Violinist playing the lobby on the 2 evenings we happened to stroll through.

Reviews.Title: “Definately be back”
Reviews.Author: trisha009
Reviews.Content: The staff couldnt be more helpful we only stayed a few night on route to Australia but i found it to absolutely fantastic. We had young children with us and the staff could not be more helpful or friendly. The view is amazing, cant recommend enough

Reviews.Title: “Elegant luxury and wonderful service in the heart of Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: aautio
Reviews.Content: The location is very good and the level of service and the friendliness and efficiency of the staff are just incredible. The hotel has basically everything one could ask for, including great restaurants and bars, a well-equipped fitness centre and very nice conference facilities. The lobbies and public spaces are grand and the rooms are spacious and very well equipped. It's not cheap, but you wouldn't expect a 5-star to be. Only thing I was missing was wireless broadband connection, but a cable connection was available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Skyline Views”
Reviews.Author: ElHutch1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Junior suite for a couple of nights, amazing views from the room through big octagonal windows - really the perfect view of the Singapore skyline. Service was amazing, I only stayed two nights but they remembered my name every time I went past the door or needed a taxi. Location is fine, a 10 minute stroll down to the marina area and restaurants of boat quay. Pool area is ok, but nothing incredible. Have stayed in Raffles and Shangri-La previously and it all depends on what is your priority. The pool area of the Shangri-La is way better & Raffles obviously wins hands down for tradition. However the Ritz-Carlton holds it's own for a modern hotel with all the luxuries you expect. For more great views or a fancy meal head to the Equinox complex at The Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “This place has issues. Definitely better 5 star hotels out there.”
Reviews.Author: WattsyHK
Reviews.Content: My husband has stayed here numerous times on business over the past 6m months, this is my 3rd visit. Food is OK, but not great considering the price. Have noticed decline in quality of produce used. Not good taste/quality. Still well presented and cooked, but not hte quality of ingredients you would expect in a 5 star place. You can see the cost cutting in a few areas is really affecting the guest experience. The main areas are big and were once grand, but seem dull and unwelcoming to me. Staff here are always great and helpful with a good standard of care. But even that does make up for being unable to fix problems. The biggest disappointment is the rooms. Big, nice bathroom but otherwise a letdown. We are on our 3rd room in a 6 night stay. First room, the noise was so bad from construction that my husband had to move during the middle of the night to try and get some rest. Loud construction noise at 2am - YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. The hotel has no excuse for not warning you in advance that there may well be noise for the Harbour facing rooms. Also it was not possible to change the temperature in the room. So next day I arrive to join my husband while he was at work. He had left instructions that were agreed to that the hotel staff would move his posessions to the new room at some point during the day and that when I arrived late afternoon I would be sent to the new room, not the old one .Guess what, I arrived, the hotel had done nothing and I was sent to the old room. I thought it was odd that I was facing right onto the noisy construction and my husband had packed his case, so luckily rather than unpacking all my stuff I phoned my husband to check. Lucky I did. So I called the front desk and asked why I was sent to the wrong room and would they please sort it out. So a member of staff came to take me and all our luggage to the new room. New room was at least facing the city so less noisy. But again be warned, all the rooms are very noisy from people walking down the corridors, shouting, and room doors slamming loudly. No soundproofing. So new room was even more shabby and run down than the last one. It seems they all are to some degree or another. They are being refurbished soon I hear. They are 3 star quality right now, so would suggest staying here once that is done. Not only that, but this room was also dirty, The carpet had what I can only describe as a big crusty vomit stain on it. Like another reviewer I did NOT want to walk on the carpet with bare feet, it was nasty. All rooms are very worn out. Chipped and flaking, peeling etc. Bads design and layout. Cannot view TV from the bed, half the picture is cut off. also bad picture on TV. Cannot watch from the sofa either as its 90 degrees to one side. the bed in this room also had nasty nasty stains on the headboard, very clear what they were. Revolting. Once again the air conditioning does not work. Does not matter what temperature you set the unit to, it stays at 22 degrees. The clock in the the room has a thermostat so it was pretty hard for the dumb staff to continue arguing with us that it was working and fixed. But they tried bless them. Oh yes, all fixed. Really. So we moved rooms again! The filth and stuffy air was too much. This time the THIRD room was a bit less dirty, but just as tired and guess what - aircon fixed at 22 degrees. Finally a manager admitted that it is not possible to change the temperature in the rooms. At which point my husband was very upset as they had pushed us around to 3 different rooms by now -eating into our holiday time. They could have said the aircon was set and saved us all that hassle. Disgraceful way to treat guests. So now we are stuck in our stuffy room with no windows and no way to change the temperature. Very clear they try and cover up the fact that the aircon temp iS FIXED in every room to try and save money. And we got a random unknown phone call in the middle of the night to wake us up. Then on Sunday morning, at 7.30am we were loudly awoken by a PA system right below our window. Went on for a few hours as triathlon runners headed off. Would have been a nice sight if it wasn't for the fact we needed some sleep due to the construction noise, night time phone call, noisy guests and lack of fresh air! The toiletries in the room are very poor, quality, unusable. So make sure you bring your own. Cocktails down by the pool were terrible, Bad ingredients, super expensive, badly made and tasted vile. All served in a plastic cup and not even a cherry floating in the muck for the price! But the pool, trees, loungers and gym are all nice. Last night we had 2 cocktails in the bar area and they were great. This place must be losing regular customers a lot. A senior manager just called me volunteering to listen to the tale of woe. He offered us dinner in the hotel restaurant tonight for the two of us. I said great, but please please can someone just fix the air conditioning?? We have been here 6 days in 3 rooms and still nothing. I am prepared to ignore the 'manly' stains on the headboard and carpet. But I just want to have some cool air and get some sleep. Off to the (very nice!) gym now to work out the frustrations!

Reviews.Title: “best city”
Reviews.Author: spaflorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect services you feel like it royalty in there, the only complain is that the furniture in the hotel have to change, because are very very old, the signature restaurant is one of the best for cantonese food, great food and out standing service, they have a super nice manager her name is Winnie and she knows all about the food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Antinous96
Reviews.Content: We decided to stop over in Singapore on the way to Cambodia and settled on the Ritz Carlton Hotel. The public areas of the hotel are quite spectacular with amazing contemporary artworks by the likes of Frank Stella and astounding glass installations by Dale Chihuly. The rooms are luxurious if a little worn out and in need of some refreshing. The hotel is situated a little out of the very heart of town- but taxis are so cheap in Singapore it really wasn’t an issue for us. The highlight of the hotel was the amazing staff- who seemed to almost outnumber the guests- nothing was ever too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “A Supurb adventure and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: gosesis
Reviews.Content: it was the most wonderful stay in a hotel . I have traveled the world newyork vancouver etc but the view the service the staff undescribable. just perfecto! We shall return. Blu and gee robins

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: About ten years ago, I stayed with a friend at this hotel and we have been talking about it ever since, in particular about an incident in the lobby. That morning on our second day we came out the elevator and were addressed by name by a staff member of the hotel. This is a large hotel and such an experience I had never had before. This month I returned for the first time and that experience ten years ago was only a small peak of the superior service I have experienced during this visit. In fact I was so overwhelmed by the service in this hotel that I canceled and changed my travel plan, just to return to this hotel a few days later and enjoy it's spectacular environment, facilities, staff and service for another four days. During both stays we stayed in a gorgeous one bedroom suite facing the harbor. The rooms are exceptionally spacious, with walk in closet, beautiful bathroom, tasteful and classy furnishings and spectacular comfy bed. I understand that an overhaul of the rooms is under way, but I have to say it is quite remarkable that after 12 or 13 years (since the hotel opened) the decor has kept up to be tasteful and stylish withstanding fashion and decoration trends of the last decade. Something that can not be said of most hotels. What may have colored my experience at this hotel is the fact that I booked the club floor. I am familiar to the club-floor concept, but the Ritz Carlton Singapore has given me new meaning to the club-floor-experience. The Club Lounge on the top floor of the building is exceptionally well appointed with beautiful furnishings and fabrics. It is spacious and offers different areas, both table seating and comfortable lounge seating. Check-in takes place here as well. Food servings are of very high quality and despite having spent here about 7 days in the last month I never had a feeling the the food offer was repetitive. On many occasions there is a chef in the lounge preparing fresh food right there and then. The food is themed by day, giving it a good variation. Despite the lounge being busy one day with a large group the food offer was always ample. I must say that I sampled some of the best food from the region here at the lounge. In addition the lounge provides drinks all day long including champagne from breakfast to the late evening. Not just any champagne: Moet & Chandon, how classy! Although the hotel surpassed my expectations in all the above ways, the real and fundamental difference to any experience I have ever had before at any other hotel is the Club floor staff. During my stay I met some of the warmest, most gracious, professional and funny people. The Club floor team is what really makes this hotel to a one of a kind. I felt no reason to venture out into Singapore. I kept returning to the lounge for breakfast, lunch, tea, dinner, desert, cocktails. At all times the staff made me feel comfortable, happy and I do not remember having had so many laughs with hotel employees ever before. The passion in the people that work here can not be trained, it is clear to me that they really enjoy their work, form an exceptionally close team and are driven by passion, professionalism, ambition and happyness. What a difference to the average hotel. At the same time the staff was very observant and always looked for ways to exceed our expectations. Little things like informing housekeeping when you walk in for breakfast so your room is made while you have breakfast, anticipating your specific needs in every way, just incredible. Other than the room and the club lounge I really enjoyed the pool. It's gorgeous, large, lush and exceptionally well designed. Remarkably empty for such a large hotel, only during the weekends it seemed a bit busier. Pool staff was lovely and providing water, a friendly talk or there to assist in any way. Although I have a rigid gym routine and the hotel has fantastic Cybex equipped gym, I didn't make it to the gym once.. I was simply to relaxed. Also during my staff I kept being approached by the very friendly people of guest relations addressing me by name informing about my stay or just having a chat. I felt so looked after by. But other staff as well, from front door to health club, all are so warm, friendly and funny. There seems a looseness in their approach and manners that you would not expect in such a 'formal' hotel, yet it works its magic. Leaving this hotel was hard, especially when seeing all the club floor staff lined up at the front door to say good bye. Now that was just unbelievable. All I can say is, if you want to be blown away by a hotel experience, book this hotel and definitely go for the club floor. It is exceptional value. There will be no regrets only a strong feeling wanting to return to this hotel paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: faithz17
Reviews.Content: maybe my expectations were too high, but i was disappointed with my stay as it's a supposedly 6 star hotel. it's ok for a 5 star hotel but just not there yet as a 6 star. somehow the service wasn't personal, like the smiles all not really warm if there were smiles in the first place... and they couldn't even get a simple thing right like the fact that breakfast was included in our reservation, not once but TWICE... room wise, we had a kallang bay view room... room was big, but somehow the furnishings were a bit plain, like it's nice but doesn't show luxury, definitely not what one would expect to pay for SGD$350++... but it was spacious, even with a living room area, had my 2 brothers- and 2 sisters-in-law and 4 kids over at one point and still had enough space to host everyone... bed wise, surprisingly normal... linens were good, but the bed itself a bit too firm almost hard, prefer my bed to have be full down so it's comfy yet gives enough back support... (in fact i would say the bed in The Sentosa is much nicer... see my other review) another thing, the bed side clock was slow by 20 mins... it's a small thing you can forgive in a 3 star hotel, but for a 6 star, i feel that the attention to detail is lacking. one thing nice, was the evening turndown service, where they placed a bookmark on the duvet for your bedtime reading, which i thought was a nice touch. Bathroom on the other hand, was FANTASTIC... full marble furnishings, bathtub with a view of the kallang bay (we were on the 19th floor)... though hubby had a bit of problem with the blinds, they will refuse to close facing down and will auto open up a bit... maybe the setting was to ensure that our view is not blocked, but hubby was very conservative! lol... not sure if there's supposed to be a protective film layer to prevent others on the surrounding buildings from looking in... Pool was honestly disappointing... when we reached there, it was like, that's it? it's a 1.4m deep pool, seemed a little worn... but one nice touch was the heated jacuzzi... service wise, i'm surprised that towels were just placed on a table for guests to help themselves, rather than having a pool assistant to offer them to guests, which was what i experienced in a 4 star hotel previously... don't see why a 4 star hotel can provide such service and a "6 star" hotel cannot? overall, if the rate is like around $200, maybe will stay again, but most likely will prefer to try Oriental or Pan Pac... but the cheapest internet rate is like $350++ no breakfast, definitely not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms + Great view + Excellent Staff & Service = Heaven !”
Reviews.Author: Indian_Star
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Early April 09. I have actually stayed there a few times earlier for business and have liked it so much that i was very keen to visit it for a holiday with my parents. This enabled me to spend more time at the hotel and make use of all the facilities. The staff is extremely courteous, caring and polite. altough my check in was at 2 PM, they were kind enough to give our rooms to us at 9.30 AM. The chef took special care in arranging Vegetarian (Jain) food for us. The rooms are so large and spacious that one does not even feel like getting out of the hotel. We had a room on the 20th floor and we had a fantastic view of the city. The gym and pool are also fantastic. We had a great time...too bad it was only for 3 days ! Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Puttin' on the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: tylerthomas
Reviews.Content: After a two week SE Asia cruise we decided to stay a few more days in Singapore and picked out the Millenia. Once again that old Ritz magic was there with from the moment our cab arrived and they had our name. Bellmen, clerks and the check in all called us by name and escorted us to the Club Level for check in. Everything was handled quickly, discretely and smoothly while offering us food from the Club. The room was splendid and the service level was high for our entire stay. Just asking a question brought forth material to assist us in selecting where to go, eat and tour. Their location is terrific right across from the Flyer and near two large Malls as well as most of the tours. At night you have the entire city skyline lit up as if just for you. If you are in this part of the world, don't pass on the opportunity to indulge yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Treatment Is Good”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: Have $ go for the Club Level. Good food and drinks + better service. Booked the room during peak season, hotel was overcrowded. Luckily I straight away upgraded to Club Level, cut the queues, higher service. Totally worth the additional money I had to pay for. Will take the Kallang View, Marina Bay View was rather boring with all the construction work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, one of the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Namratas80
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ritz Carlto on a business trip to Singapore. The hotel is rich in interior and rooms are spacious with a good view. food is good and staff is friendly, By far the best hotel in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “this is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeben
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived this hotel was fantastic.Big thanks to Archie for a great welcome, very professional, warm and expediant. The staff are AMAZING!! To run a hotel of this size and have staff that know your name at all times , greet you at all times and always but always the service is fantastic .the management must be doing something very right...The rooms are large, very very clean and have an amazing view. One big suggestion , book club floor this benefit is well worth it, not just for the great food and service but you get to meet some fun people, must say EDDIE is a must see, he is the best, also loved Sarah and the girls there, well done to management for your staff!!!! We stayed in Paris for three weeks proir to this and loved it but funny thing is we miss the people here.! We will stay again as we felt part of the family and that you dont get very often. We travel often, far and wide but we LOVE this hotel .Hope you do too> Take our advice and stay here. PS taxi farres are soo cheap and singapore so small who cares if it costs $5.00 for a cab to somewhere, the locatoin here is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: cktiki
Reviews.Content: The ritz in singapore is definitely one of the best in the city. the rooms are nice and spacious, the bathroom with its large windows and huge tubs are excellent. the breakfast spread was also superb. the best part however was the friendly and helpful staff. right from the time you enter the hotel lobby there is always willing and available to help you and answer any question you may have. the hotel is not near the main orchard area like of the others but i dont think that makes a difference. distances in singapore and not very much and cabs are easy and innexpensive. in fact the ritz was pretty close to clarke the main places for nice bars and places to eat and also close to the vivo city shopping mall.. all in all a good choice for stay in singapore if you are on holiday or on business.. i would definitely return...

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: marty99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a Club room this month. Overall its an excellent hotel and I would struggle to find any faults . The room had large panoramic windows and a spacious bathroom with almost as good viewsas from the club lounge . Service was pretty impeccable from all the staff we met esp at the lounge which made the stay great value serving drinks and good quality food in the evening. The location on the marina is very convenient and I preferred its aspect to those we saw around Orchard Rd. The pool provided a welcome break from the heat and humidity of the city and I would happily suggest the RC to anyone looking for a great break in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Right Place for right people”
Reviews.Author: amit2207
Reviews.Content: It's perfect place in down town. close to subway, attached to best shopping mall and best priced.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in singapore... couldnt get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: ckotadia
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in singapore... Ever room is exquisite with perfect view of the singapore river, the F1 circuit, the merlion and the flyer wheel. bathroom tubs overlook the city and are state of the art the staff is extremely curtious and manerly excellent food

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DannyDelhi
Reviews.Content: This is one place you will remember for its hospitality. One of the best places in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, disappoitning experience”
Reviews.Author: ANUJ_MITHANI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in July 2007, during an important business trip to Singapore with clients. We had pre-booked rooms, so expected to check in early on landing into Singapore from Mumbai, quickly freshen up and have breakfast and rush to a set of meetings starting early in the day. To my utter dismay, rooms were NOT ready, we had to pressure them into releasing two rooms so we could keep our schedule and discovered that other guests had similar experiences too - it appeared the Ritz had overbooked and was blaming it on some technical error with their reservation systems! Very unusual for a hotel chain of this standard. The management were profusely apologetic afterwads but the damage had been done. Otherwise great location, spacious rooms and terrific views of the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Wingshear
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the Ritz Carlton. The third time I have been there. Now Ritz does not go overboard on loyal customers...ie, the second time I was there six months ago no one recognised me but this time they did. It helped that I had mailed in earlier ! I like the way the hotel has created a small tropical island feel by planting thick foliage around the hotel. Its not too much but enough to create a sense of greenery. Most hotels manage their customer interactions quite well but Ritz does it cleanly and professionally. There is a sense that you are being looked after and cared for. The rooms are perhaps the best part of the Ritz, particularly the Club level. The Marina Bay view and the bathrooms are to die for. The bathtubs open out completely and you can look at the city as you are bathing. The only hitch is that my room was facing the Kallang Bay side which in turn has the Singapore Flyer or Singapore's London Eye turning silently. The lady checking me in told me that be careful, "people carry binoculars in the Flyer and they look this side too." The view is again outstanding. The only hitch is that Singapore's casino (part of Las Vegas Sense group) is also being built on one side of the bay so while you see the skyline on the right side, the left side is a maze of ugly cranes and half constructed buildings - three big ones. At some point (next year I thought I heard) it will become a glittering complex. The other good part is the location. The Ritz is just half an hour away from the airport and everything in turn is close by (guess everything in Singapore is). So its a great location to base yourself.) There is one good restaurant on the ground floor, its good, nothing outstanding or memorable, in Singapore one tends to go out to do the adventerous stuff like the open carts a walking distance away, or Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. One did breakfast at the Club level dining room on the 32nd floor. Where again the feeling is like a private dining room in parts with a great view... The pool looks nice from above but I didn't use it. Its surrounded by trees and plants so once again a nice feel. All in all, I would recommend a stay, for relaxation or if you are visiting Singapore for shopping and other things. Overall, its good value for money as long as they keep the rates under, say $400 - $500 Sing a room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Almost fabulous . . .”
Reviews.Author: Pausanias
Reviews.Content: On our outward journey to New Zealand we had chosen the Mandarin Oriental (qv), an old favourite of ours, though this time we found its brutalist 1980s lobby and inward-looking restaurants a little dated. So, nine weeks later, on our return journey, we went next door to the Ritz and were given deluxe corner suite 926 with breakfast and a late check-out of 8pm. All for S$450. Not bad huh? The suite was essentially magnificent, blessed with Cinerama views of the Marina and the anchorage beyond. The legendary Ritz bathroom did not disappoint, there were two TVs, a separate sitting room, deep sofas, a proper writing desk, free internet, a walk-in wardrobe etc etc etc. There were a few niggles - slight scuffing everywhere and an absence of electric plug sockets so you had to put your kettle on the floor. Not that the kettle worked. Nor did the battery-powered weighing scales. And there were only two tissues in the box. Apart from this, it was fabulous. While this hotel might be a huge tower block, it’s quite sympathetic to look at and the public areas and restaurants are airily spectacular. The buffet breakfast was par for the course, not historic, and the Chinese food was decidedly in the artsy modern vogue, rather than the traditional and arguably tastier Cantonese style. A hamburger the next day was horrible. Service was on the cusp of kowtowing groveldom. From our room to the breakfast I reckon we were bowed to and given a ‘Good morning!’ by at least 20 members of staff. One of the main reasons we chose the Ritz was the pool, a lovely green and largely shaded oasis that seemed a better prospect than the Mandarin. And so it was, for an hour. Then the screaming kids arrived and wars over sunbeds broke out. We endured it for another hour. And not once did anyone offer us water, or coffee or anything. There wasn’t an Evian facial spray in sight. The total absence of pool service in a hotel like this was surprising and marks it down in our view.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover en route to New Zealand”
Reviews.Author: keela
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay using the Singapore Airlines stopover package. I arrived at the hotel at around 8am. My room was not ready but I was offered the use of the Leisure facility and I was able to shower and change here. The Staff were extremely courteous to me I was given a tour of the hotel with an explanation of the facilities. I was offered juice or coffee and really made to feel very welcome. My room was ready at around 11am and my bags had been delivered. The room was an end of a corridor and I think larger due to this. I loved it and the bathroom especially. I had read so much about the bathrooms but I was not disappointed. Each evening I sat in the bath with the light out and enjoyed the view which was fantastic. I never take a bath at home but the sheer atmosphere was not to be missed. I showered in the morning and this was also large with good water pressure. The bed was wonderful so comfortable and with fine linens. The sofa and the rugs were a little worn but for me this was not a major problem. There was a large TV and tea and coffee facilities which I was delighted to see. I didn't eat in the hotel but chose to explore and found many interesting places to eat. I had booked afternoon tea at Raffles and this was the highlight of the trip for me. I enjoyed my time in Singapore and staying at the Ritz especially. The staff were very attentive and also willing to do anything to make my stay comfortable. Excellent doorman who greeted me with either have a good day or have you had a good day! On my final afternoon I used the outside facility to sit in the sun and relax as I had an overnight flight to Auckland. Very comfortable loungers! I had a problem with a phone card I purchased. I was told that I could use it from my room both by the Concierge and one of the Hotel receptionist. On checking out I had a huge bill of around $140. Apparently I didn't know that when I used an outside line there was a local call charge for this. I told them that this had not been explained to me and also I had made many mistaken calls due to the code etc. The Receptionist spoke to several people and I was then told that this charge would be removed. An excellent response and during the time I was waiting I was again offered coffee and juice. The staff were extremely apologetic and I can't praise them highly enough. I had my bags collected from my room and they were stored in a safe place when I came to check out. A very nice young man again. Whilst waiting for my taxi to the Airport I was offered a seat inside as it was very hot outside and given a bottle of iced water. Another nice touch. All in all I had a wonderful stay at the Ritz and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. For me it was the staff and the level of service they offered which impressed me most.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night in this hotel. All was remarkable, a good breakfast, the helpful and kind personnel (especially concierge). Nearby very good, though very expensive restaurant My Humble House (in Espanada). Fascinating views (from bedroom and bathroom). Nearby, aside Pan Pacific, is massage salon with remarkable foot massage and fish foot massage. This is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevetheChauffeur
Reviews.Content: What can I say , this hotel is fabulous, the staff, the decor, everything was just perfect ! Beautiful room with every facility you could imagine...It's not cheap and the marina view was somewhat spoilt by a huge new building development being constructed( it is a city location) But I still loved the place. Ask for a high floor and marine view , you wont be disapointed with the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View - a must”
Reviews.Author: karenbeanpole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (couldn't afford more but wish we had stayed 2). Cannot fault it from the moment we stepped out of our taxi. Impeccable service (not overpowering but they were just there for you). Amazing room with view of harbour from bedroom and bathroom. The most comfortable bed we have ever slept on in our lives!! With the most comfortable pillows. Extra large tv and dvd player (we didn't have time for those!). Bathroom had a separate shower unit as well. Very plush. Very clean. The fitness centre is very good, very well equipped. There is also a sauna and steam room. Jacuzzi is by the pool. If you need a chair, the staff prepare it for you... there is no end to luxury there. Stay there at least once in your life - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Singapore marina”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo V
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Singapore, this one we choose this new hotel located in the marina. This is a little mistake if you are in Singapore for shopping there are more central location, but beside this is a great hotel. Rooms are very spacious, I had a marina view just great, with a fantastic bathroom and unbelievable shower, but the bath withe a great window overlooking the marina was really impressive. The staff also was great they tried hard to remember my Italian name and the concierge also suggested good restaurants. The breakfast is a wise choice for 50 Singapore dollars you can have a real brunch, unfortunately close at 10.30 A.M. so don't be late or you go for lunch. I also consider very expensive the business center and the INTERNET connection in the room, at this price of hotel must be included in the rate. Overall is pricey also if you get exactly what you pay for. If take a taxi to the central Orchard Road for shopping is not a problem and you like de luxe hotel, this is a great choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Iulia_Ro
Reviews.Content: I spent recently 2 nights at Ritz Carlton Singapore. The location is Marina Bay area and it's connected to the mall and all conference and entertainment facilities of Suntec City area. The services are excellent (although I think they exagerate a little with the security but I suppose they have their reasons). The rooms are amazing specially the view and windows concept (huge window in the bath area). I had great expectation from this hotel and they meet all of them. I think it's a great hotel for meetings & events but also suitable for leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in October. The hotel's location is a tad remote, although there are shopping malls within walking distance it is some distance from Orchard road (but only 10 mins by taxi). The common areas are very nice and glitzy but starting to show their age and a refurbishment wouldnt do any harm. Rooms are large and spacious, big LCD Tvs and quality furnishings (which dont appear to have changed in over 12 years since it opened and showing signs of wear and tear). Beds and linen are comfy and top notch. The bathrooms (taking up half the room) are legendary for their view (marina bay rooms) but beginning to show their age. Floorboards are a nice change from carpet and there is a big walk in closet and safe. Generic toiletries (unless u stay on a club flr or a suite) are functional but very disappointing for a hotel of this class and price bracket. Prices have crept up over the years with no commensurate increase in value. The pool and gym are well equipped and there is also a day spa. Their function rooms are a fav with local celebrities and yuppies alike. Staff are extremely friendly and attentive, without being OTT. Have stayed here many times over the years and noticed the service levels improving over the previous trips. There are loads of 5 star properties in Singapore and many would have better rooms and amenities, but none can match the Ritz for its combination of views and space - their std guestrooms are noticably larger than the MO across the road and none of its peers offers a great view of marina bay from the bathtub. Its not perfect and some areas need work but its delivers consistently high standards across all areas.

Reviews.Title: “The ritz is overrated”
Reviews.Author: yatiyatu
Reviews.Content: I went to the ritz with my husband for one night to celebrate his birthday and also our 1st year wedding anniversary. We took up the christmas on ice package as there was some promo for the credit card that I have. This is what was supposed to be included in our package as found on their website. This festive season, treat your loved ones to a unique ice-skating experience in Kallang Ice World before returning to the luxurious confines of our guestrooms. The Christmas On Ice package includes: * A one-night stay in a Deluxe Kallang Bay View Room * Buffet breakfast for two adults and two children (below 12 years of age) * Colouring book and crayon set for the children (maximum of 2 sets per reservation) * In-room Christmas amenity * 15 percent off The Ritz-Carlton Gift Collection * 20 percent off Kallang Ice World entry fee for adults and complimentary tickets for two children (below 12 years of age) Seems worth it right? WRONG! First thing when we were checking in, the front desk officer who was serving us looked like she couldn't be bothered to serve another fellow singaporean. While all the other officers actually made an effort to escort the other guests(in front of our eyes) to the elevator, she just told me and my husband that our room is on the 5th floor. Yeah small matter, i know where the elevator was but it made me feel inferior. Nevermind that, when we got to the room, it was crap. The room was crap, the view was crap and half of the rug had a stain that looked like a dog had just relieved itself on it.The wooden floor creaked so loudly when i walked. The tv was not LCD and come on, it was the 5th floor!The hotel lobby is on the 3rd floor so my room was practically the first storey of guest rooms. I requested for a higher floor when i made the reservation and i was really unhappy. So, i made some calls to the front desk to request a higher floor and we waited for like more than 2 hrs to be upgraded to the 29th floor marina view room. Compliments to Mr Manjit for that:) To be honest yes, the room was excellent. The view was splendid. The bathroom was nice but half of the furniture looked a little old.They really need to do some upgrading to their furniture.Anyways, so it was my husband's bday and they sent us a little bday cake for us to enjoy. Thank you for that. However, we were promised some christmas amenity as shown on the package and some vouchers for the ice skating thing but they gave us nothing except for the bday cake. So, i called front desk to enquire and they told me the bday cake was actually the christmas amenity. WHAT. THE. CRAP. When I went to pan pac recently for my bday they actually gave me a bday cake without having me to book some stupid christmas package. So, all in all what I actually got for CHRISTMAS ON ICE package was a 1 night room stay and buffet breakfast. Funny, i would have thought BED AND BREAKFAST would be a better name for the package. I would truly not recommend this hotel because you can get so much better for a lower price at neighbouring hotels. Happy Holidays!!

Reviews.Title: “Still as good as ever”
Reviews.Author: MM2H
Reviews.Content: We hadn't stayed at this hotel for almost five years and all our previous stays had been excellent so we were looking forward to returning. We weren't disappointed. I know that they don't actually remember who we are, but when you get out of the airport limo and are greeted with Welcome back Mr and Mrs G... it still knocks my socks off. I don't know how they do it but it makes for a very personal start. We arrived well ahead of normal check-in time but there was no problem. We sat with a refreshing drink, chatting to one of the concierge team whilst the check-in was completed. We had a corner room on the 9th floor and the room exudes quality. After ten years of operation without a major re-fit, the room was a little tired (and only a little) around the edges and we commented to this effect on our feedback form. A few days later we received an e-mail from the GM, assuring us that a major renovation is due in 2010 and apologising for our findings. We included breakfasts in our tariff and for a hotel of this class in this location I feel they are good value. There is a very wide choice of Asian and Western dishes and all of the food is high quality, the service is professional and discreet and the surroundings are very pleasant - no squealing kids here, charging around the tables! When the new MRT eventually opens, almost next door, it will give the hotel a much more convenient location, although it is still currently possible to get to the MRT at City Hall with only the first few hundred metres outdoors, the rest being via various malls. So maybe since our last visit it's looking a bit tired in places, who isn't? With a refit planned for next year and the new MRT line, we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Lived upo to standard”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at Ritz Carlton and found it again up to the usual high standard of this chain. This hotel is well located in the Marina bay area with excellent views over the harbour. Rooms could not be faulted as is usual with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: maddog2000
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ritz Carton for a business conference. For that, the hotel was ok, but I would want to go there privately. The hotel is a bit run down and everything looks a bit old. Location is very central. Probably the worst Ritz Carlton I have visited so far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: 1FourFun
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here through Singapore Airlines and received an extremely good rate of $850 for three nights. We stayed on the city facing side and enjoyed the view, the bay side had tons of construction and would have been IMO an ugly view. The room was fantastic! Wood floors, spacious, huge bathroom, nice flat screen, lots of hotel products available for the guest. The pool was very beautiful; We sat by the pool and enjoyed ourselves one evening. We had one round of drinks - two beers and two mixed drinks and the bill was $62 (yikes), so we (there were two couples) quickly decided to come up with another idea. We found a grocery store and purchased a few bottles and mixers and threw ourselves a pool side party. We were low key about it by leaving our stuff in the room and bringing 'water' bottles to the pool, we wanted to have fun, and were in no position to spend $800 on an evening of drinks! We teased each other about being low end Ritz guests, but I am glad we stayed there! We had room service one night and the spaghetti carbanara was yummy. We had the Ritz breakfast another morning and I wished we had just ordered the buffet - it was almost the same price after everything was said and done; the buffet offered way more variety. There is a little place outside the mall entrance to the Ritz that is a foot reflexology/Fish Spa. I highly recommend going. The fish spa was a really wild experience, my girlfriend and I giggled the whole time, glad I did it! Ask for Richard for foot reflexology, my god it was a fantastic treatment!!! The prices are reasonable. If you stayed on floors 15 or higher facing the city then you can see the world's largest fountain. We were a little too low. I highly recommend this hotel, all was clean. The staff was amazing, I have never been told 'good morning' and 'good evening' so many times, LOL! If we had a question it was immediately answered in a friendly and helpful way. Just a tip...Do the city duck tour the first day you arrive, yes it is touristy, but it allows you to get a good feel for the city and then you can figure out where you want to go the rest of the days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: GBMember
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were attending a conference at the Suntec centre, and it is a convenient walk from the hotel through the shopping mall. It is also a short distance from the Singapore Flyer, which is a giant observation wheel, and well worth a visit. We were very pleased with the hotel. When we arrived, we wanted to change some details of our booking, and it was no problem. We were given exactly what we wanted. We used the club lounge, and this was well worth while, as it included internet access, breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails and the location had spectacular views. The club lounge staff were all hugely helpful, spending ages, for example, choosing a restaurant for us and booking it. The room was very big, and very well furnished and the bathroom was spectacular. But the bath is located under the huge window, which made me a bit uneasy as I am afraid of heights. It was easier to cope with after I closed the blinds. There are lots of staff everywhere who are constantly available to help guests, which makes everything feel very smooth. We were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meshellby
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay recently in Singapore at The Ritz Carlton, in a great location just 15 - 20 mins walk away from the Boat Quay/Clarke Quay areas (and that was with a buggy!). The room and bathroom had fabulous views over Marina Bay, lovely soak in the bath overlooking the city at sunset! We found the check in service to be very smooth and concierge service very helpful when we needed to arrange a babysitting service. Overall, all the staff were really helpful and friendly. I think that the only niggle was the price of the buffet breakfast if its not included in your deal, great selection but a little on the high side - but that encouraged us to go out and explore more options!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: meowcsj
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Chinese New year getaway. Great room with nice view and layout. Huge bath room with nice scenery. Most comfy bed I have ever sleep in. There was queue at morning breakfast. Orange juice was served when queuing up. Waitress goes extra mile to get me a fresh orange juice when they clear the buffet counter before I finished my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Some concierge behind the desk need to communicate”
Reviews.Author: vb527
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Ritz for our honeymoon after discovering a great deal through Singapore Airline Stopover Holiday. Initial impression on the place and services were absolutely immaculate. The concierge that helped us when we checked in was great. Unfortunately the subsequent concierge service was less than perfect. We decided to use the concierge service to help us with our internet check in as we wanted particular seats on our long haul flight to London. Unfortunately, due to lack of communication, we ended up with seats 2nd last row from the back of the plane, where we didn't want. As the seatings were now confirmed, we were unable to change the location. Normally on a short flight, we wouldn't have minded, unfortunately this is a 13hr flight! We ended up with the most uncomfortable flight experience which dampened our trip a bit. I wished the concierge would have given us a call before confirming those seats. Otherwise, all of the floor staff were very polite, friendly and extremely helpful. Greeted all the guests when they walk by, and opening doors etc. We had a room in the Kelang View side, which we thought was quite nice. Room is slightly dated, but the bathroom is still nice and modern. Nicest mattress we've ever slept on! Only noise we could hear at night are people walking in the hallway. Maybe a reposition of the bed in the room would minimise these noise? Overall a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good views and service”
Reviews.Author: Junkster
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our stay at the Ritz Carlton as we travel to Singapore often but have never stayed there. The check-in didn't go as smoothly as we had hoped - we booked a king room non smoking and the receptionist said they only had a twin room available. We showed her our confirmation and she seemed to be very put out when she was trying to find us another room. Unfortunately, this took nearly half an hour to sort out (she didn't speak to us again) and five other people checked in while we were waiting. Apart from the check-in problem we were very happy with the service from staff. Staff were extremely helpful and remembered your name. We managed to get a lovely spacious room on the 30th floor with great views. However, the room was a little dated , the wooden floor had warped and there was some water damage to the walls. It was a bit noisy (you could hear people in the next room in the shower) and noise from the casino construction site. It appears that the windows don't have double glazing. Our friends had sent us a fruit basket which was delivered to our room. We asked if we could have it cut up and they took it away and brought it back on a trolley looking spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just as Nice as the First”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a stop over on a dive trip to Indonesia a few years back and then again on a stopover on the way to our honeymoon in Bali. Both times I enjoyed the wonderful design (nothing like the traditional RCs in the U.S. -- which I also enjoy), the huge bathrooms and wonderful views of the city. The hotel is a little bit of a walk to the merlion and other central city sites, but not that big a deal. There were absolute no service issues or disappointments of any kind on either visit. It is right next to a shopping center where we sampled some local breakfast food and enjoyed that as well as the fine dining in the hotel itself. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We've always loved it - but this last time was a real let down.”
Reviews.Author: sh_dell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Singapore Ritz Carlton on Aug 22 - Aug 24th, 2008. We've stayed there many times before, and we've always enjoyed our stay. While making the reservation online, we've requested for a King Bed - Non Smoking Club room. Upon check-in, the room given to us, had a very strong smoke-smell. We asked for a different room and we waited outside our room. In about 15 minutes or so, a Club concierge came and took us to our new room. It's slightly bigger than our first room, and most of all, it smelled nice. After a while, we then found out that the "Menu" option didn't work from our TV. It took a couple visits from the engineers and they said they'd call us to see when they can fix it. Hours passed, we didn't get a call back. We finally tried the Menu on the TV and it was working. At night when the engineer finally called, we told them the TV has been fixed. Friday night - we're at the club enjoying our in-room dining food. They turned off the lights because the fireworks were about to start. A club staff asked if we could still see okay. We said we're fine, and we'll just wait a while since the fireworks would only take 15 minutes. We're able to enjoy the fireworks because it was dark in the clubroom - there's no glare from the mirrors. There's some music that was being played, and it was timed nicely with the fireworks. Saturday night - we're at the club again, waiting for the fireworks. The lights were never turned off/dimmed. And there's no music like it was on Friday. We're seeing our reflections in the mirror because of the lights in the club. While we're checking out on Sunday, I mentioned this to one of the male club staff. And he said, "because some of our guests were still eating, we could not turn off the lights." We then said," well we were eating on Friday night, but you turned off the lights anyway." He repeated the same comments, and we left it at that. I'm assuming there's some VIP guest that 'reserved' the corner dining area at the Club. I noticed the staff were surrounding the couple with the baby and everyone kept greeting them. I'm guessing the lights were left on for them. I don't think this is fair for the other Club guests. If there's a VIP guest with special requests, then the VIP guest should dine in his room instead of sacrificing everyone's enjoyment at the Club. I think it's a selfish gesture and I don't understand why the Club staff obliged the request. The lights should be dimmed for the fireworks as it was on Friday night. So, we've decided we're not returning to Ritz Carlton Singapore, since we don't feel that we're being fairly treated as other guests. It's quite sad actually, we've always loved the Ritz and we've been going there for years, but I guess it's time to move on and find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Marina view rock concerts”
Reviews.Author: singapore9
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with top notch staff overall and an excellent fitness facility. My major complaint is that they do not warn guests with a view of the Marina (roughtly 1/2 the hotel's rooms and apparently all of their suites) that there are frequent concerts on a floating stage directly outside the hotel, that go late into the night. On the first night I checked in, complete with 12 hours of jet lag, I was horrified to realize that a rock cover band was warming up for a show by 6pm. When I asked about it, the concierge said that it would not be over until 11pm as if they were telling me about something as benign as what time the sun would come up. They did rectify the situation immediately by giving me a separate room to sleep in that night, but I was very upset that the hotel does not disclose this nuisance before booked this "5 star" room, and that on top of that, no one at the hotel prior to my inquiry said anything about it. I'm pretty young compared to their average clientele, so if it bothered me...well you get the picuture.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: DZA_A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Premier Suite for 5 days in January. We booked the hotel's Limo service for airport arrival and were picked up by the airport's indoor transportation (electric vehicle) as soon as we stepped foot off the plane, then were transported to luggage, then to the car that was waiting for us. We entered the hotel doors and were greeted by name by the hotel doormen, which was a nice first impression. Check-in took a while even though we were the only people checking in. The suite was nice, plenty of room, but a little tired. It could use a facelift. Great views though, and a comfortable bed. The service was good and staff were friendly, but not over the top. Breakfast had a nice variety, but the poor egg chef did not have a clue what he was doing. We ordered a hard-boiled egg, 3 times, and it came back soft and runny all 3 times, so we gave up. The other eggs/omelettes we ordered were not very good either. Otherwise, the breakfast was ok, but not great. We've traveled to Singapore several times and usually stay in the Orchard Rd/Scotts Rd area and thought we would try a different location for a change. We definitely prefer the Orchard/Scotts area. The shopping in Orchard Rd is better than the shopping in the Marina/Ritz Millenia area. (But this will depend on what you what you are shopping for. High end brands are in Orchard.) We stayed in the Grand Hyatt, Orchard Rd, before the Ritz and we prefer the Hyatt. The rooms at the Hyatt seem newer and fresher, the food is better, and the Hyatt location is convenient. We enjoyed our stay at the Ritz, but unfortunately the hotel fell just short of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but expected more..”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a reputation of being luxurious. Once you mention that you are staying at the Ritz-Carlton, locals here will say, "Woh...nice hotel"... Check in was prompt although I arrived early. I was accommpanied to the room by a friendly and helpful gentleman called Jacob (if I remember correctly). Nice. Room was large and they have large windows. Huge bathrooms with more than usual toileteries including a wooden hairbrush. Views are good esp on a high floor Beds clean and comfortable. You wont expect anything less for this kind of hotels. Staff were helpful and courteous all round. Breakfast at the Greenhouse. Wide selection but lack depth and flavour. Well, the best food in Singapore are at the road sides and kopitiams (coffee shops). Worse food at the hotels! Nice large pool surrounded by trees. Overall, nothing much to fault them except that it is far to walk to the City Hall train station. May be tough to find a taxi at peak times. Trains are reliable and good but you have to walk quite a bit if you know the right directions. Aim for the highrise Swissotel building and you will find the station. Internet is expensive SGD30 for a day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stays”
Reviews.Author: ParisCy
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton in Singapore is an excellent hotel, located off Marina Bay, a sea side area with lots of nice restaurants and clubs. Overall, the staff is overly polite, and helpful. The standard rooms are more like one bedroom apartments, with separate bath, shower, wardrobe, and full comfort facilities, including LCD TV and DVD. The hotel;s restaurants are excellent also. There is a superb chinese restaurant there. Also, the breakfast is mind blowing. There is an ulimited selection from whatever you can imagine, from english breakfast to full chinese breakfast. The view from the rooms is incredible, either you see the highway road with elevated bridges, or the excellent marina bay, with all the restaurants and bars. Overall, Ritz is a 5/5 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: LondonSW35
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great staff that was genuinly friendly and happy to help. Everything was so smooth, from check-in, check-outs etc. Rooms were large, maybe a bit more business than leisure, but still very modern and clean. Bathrooms are huge! The views from our room was amazing, facing the downtown area of Singapore. The pool area is nice, a great little oasis in the middle of Singapore. We don't have anything negative to say about this hotel, except maybe the dining area/breakfast resturant which was a bit boring and maybe not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. We got exactly what we expected for the price we paid, which is not something you get too often.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Leno4ka
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel set in Marina district. The service was outstanding from the moment we arrived at the front door to checking out. The room was large, and very comfortable. Bath is great! The bath tube right under a huge octagonal window overlooking the city

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: baliben
Reviews.Content: High points to the Ritz Carlton for their impeccable service. Every employee that I encountered during my stay was not only polite and helpful, but also smiling - a very rare find in hotels these days. I arrived early in the morning after taking a red eye flight and was offered an early check-in. Ordered room service for breakfast and the order arrived in 12 minutes. The operator taking the order noticed that I did not want coffee or tea (included in the price) so instead offered me an extra orange juice at no charge. It may seem trivial, but I always believe its the little things that sets service apart. Ordered room service again for lunch later in the trip and food arrived quickly as well. Room and bathroom are extremely spacious and offer great views of Marina Bay (and the Sands development going up accross the bay). On my day of check-out I was departing on a mid-night flight so had reserved the room for an additional day. Unsolicted, the check-out staff offered me half price for my last day. Overall, great rooms, prompt service and friendly staff. Will definitely return when I am in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Life of the rich and famous”
Reviews.Author: sunnytop
Reviews.Content: Staying at the luxurious Ritz-Carlton was beyond my imagination. The selection of the hotel was made so much easier by the reviews submitted via this site. The location was great - a view of the water, in the middle of several great shopping areas, near the MRT. From the moment you arrive at the Ritz you are treated as a VIP. Everything in the hotel is elegant. The rooms are amazingly large. The bathroom with a full size bath and separate large shower, double basins all the lotions and potions you could possibly want, separate toilet and large window offering spectaculars views and fitted out in marble tiles was out of this world. The staff were exceptionally friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfast we enjoyed at the hotel had everything on offer and was presented beautifully. The meals were a bit expensive for our budget but the nearby shopping malls had pleanty to choose from.. If you are looking for luxury - look no further. Complimentary water is supplied daily.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, Cheap breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Nat1975
Reviews.Content: I was in SG for business trip Apr 16-25. I normally stayed at The Fullerton but my colleague recommended that the bathroom has spectacular view of SG skyline. So I decide to try The Ritz. The hotel itself is pretty old, as if it reached its top in the 90s and never rejuvenated thereafter. The room is spacious but the décor was so wrong. The sofa and TV was laid in-line meaning that I had to turn my head 90 degree in order to watch it. Bedside table was so tiny and was occupied with some stuff i.e telephone, note pad and chucky lamb which didn’t provide me enough light to read. Working table , again filled with bulky stuff like unusable lamp, hotel/city guide. There are not enough outlets to charge my cell-phone, laptop and digital camera. I went into the bath room, of course the bathtub sits right next to the large window but I was recommended by the hotel staff to put the shade down as the near by buildings are infamous of peeping hotel’s guest. The toiletry was the worst I’ve ever seen in the 6-stared hotel. It came in colorful / cheap packaging. I asked house keeping if they had other kinds of shampoo/soap. The answer is no. So, I had to go out and bought my own relyable shampoo at Watson store. The shower was nothing but ordinary. The weighing scale was broken. The blanket was smelly, some kind of stir-fried food. It was my bad luck that the construction was next to my window. Even though I was on 26 fl. I was irritated by the rumbled machine at nite. This is not the hotel’s false, but they should have warned me about this so I opted to stay on the other side or perhaps change the hotel. The breakfast stunned me most. Well, I have the Fullerton to compare to; especially they charge exactly the same price. The breakfast is cheap, they have the muesli with canned fruits and this is not acceptable. The pasty is noting special. All I have to say the service is superb though. The breakfast lunge looked a bit dim with weird décor especially the creepy green alien-liked installed on the wall. I have no sense of Art, perhaps. I stayed only 2 nites instead of 9 and I moved to the Fullerton. Seemed like The Fullerton had it all; I didn’t have to turn my neck to watch tv, I had enough space on my desk. The wash room is very nice with large round showerhead of rain-dome type. The toiletry was not that superb but better than the ritz. The pillow and blanket smelled good and comfy. The breakfast was superb where the freshly squeezed juice ‘s available. I scraped the honey out of honeycomb. And above all, I could sit out side and enjoyed the view of the Boat Quey. I guess it’s enough about my comments. Only the service at the ritz is superb, everything else needs improvement though

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of Ritz Carlton title”
Reviews.Author: MangoRacin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really looking tired and definately not up to the Ritz Carlton standard I've experienced in other cities. On arrival the check-in clerk attempted to give me a room with single beds when I had confirmed King bed. After some debate they then tried to get me to upgrade to a higher room class (at extra cost) to meet my room request. in the end they relected and provided a king room at the booked rate, however the room was adjacent to the lift. Normally this wouldn't bother me, but since the room had polished floors, noise was a problem coming under the door. Gym is well appointed with quality equipment. Outdoor pool is also great. Views are good from the room, and expecially the bathroom where you can lie in the bath and take in the awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Something special”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton on a stopover to Europe. We were thrilled with the hotel. We booked a room on the club floor and were given an upgrade to a suite when we arrived. I was in heaven. The service is excellent, the rooms spotless, just what you would expect from a five star hotel. It is a little out of the way if you like to stroll Orchard Road, but there is great shopping nearby such as Suntec city which has direct access from the hotel. The club level is superb, the food fantastic and it is a quiet haven after a hectic day shopping. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel on a stopover on the way back from Europe. I arrived there at about 11am and the check-in staff tell me that they only had smoking or single bedded rooms available for me. i was so tired from a long flight the last thing i needed is to be messed around at check-in. I asked how long i would have to wait until the room i book became free and was told i that it was only a request and they don't guarantee room types, but for a king room i would have to wait until 1pm. Then i was offered an upgrade for $100.00, when i agreed she then said that i would have to wait 1 hour for that (what a joke). I said forget it and went for a walk around Singapore for a few hours. when i returned they had a room ready for me and said they had upgraded me for free. The room was great very large with a lounge room, bedroom, very large bathroom with walk in robe and toilet, it had two plasma TV's and a bose cd player. I ordered room service and apart from it being quite expensive the food was really nice. The room had great views out over Singapore harbor and the bathroom has a view out over the Singapore big wheel (London eye thing). The other thing is there is no free internet at this hotel, even in the hotel lobby you have to pay and its not cheep at all, the joke was that from my room i could get the signal from Singapore's free internet service that they have around town. I must say that i really did enjoy this place but other than the staff, the location is great as far as a view from your hotel room but as far as being close to the shopping malls or other buildings its a bit of a walk or taxi. I would not stay here again, there is better places in better locations and with great Singapore staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jcn2045
Reviews.Content: I was a little reluctant seeing the less positive reviews, but after staying almost a week, I really can't criticize the hotel. The service is excellent, comparing well to the other hotels in the area I have stayed in (fincluding the Four Seasons, what's now the Fairmont , and the Intercontinental). The rooms and location are not so much better; I preferred the corner room at the Four Seasons, but the views at the Ritz-Carlton are spectacular. What is a step above is the politeness and service, though I am not sure that if I had to pay myself that the cost difference would be worth it. A nice bonus -- it's easy (even with the current construction) to have a nice 6-10 mile run along the river (mostly) away from the traffic and exhaust. Easily a step above most other Singapore hotels, and a place I would consider staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of city Luxury and what a view”
Reviews.Author: Like_luxury
Reviews.Content: After extensive research I decided I wanted to stay at the Ritz Carlton in Singapore for our three day break on the way to Australia. It was worth the money. We stayed in a premier suite with an amazing view, separate living area and bedroom, beautiful bathroom and a large exeptionally comfortable bed. I stayed with my husband and 2 year old daughter and it was fantastic. It is more of an adult experience, however they accomodated the needs of my daughter very well and she had a real cot instead of one of the horrible travel cots and they provided free fresh milk for her, delivered to the room when ever we needed it. The pool was lovely and the customer service fantastic though the congierge was slightly smug sometimes. I couldn't fault anything and considering I have just received my money back from our hotel in Dubai I think I can say I am pretty picky. It is 5 star, it is luxurious but go for th suite for the extra comfort. We dined out in the night food markets near the opera house and did all the normal touristy things and I recommend asking the staff about where to eat as we found some amazing places because of this. Singapore is fantastic and I would definately stay at the Ritz again.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent hotel - ever”
Reviews.Author: SeymourPlaces
Reviews.Content: Leaving Singapore after 7 days was fine, but checking out of this mind blowing hotel was a sad moment! From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by the attentive and warm staff, and they provided the most excellent service during our entire stay. Everything can be described in superlatives: The location, the view from the room (make sure you get as high a floor as possible), the service, the food, the gym, pool and spa, the care they take of you and they hotel – simply perplexing and of a constant high standard. To keep all these overwhelming experiences in a gentle balance, the atmosphere of the hotel could be best described as quiet and serene, with wonderful artwork. If you get the chance – indulge in the luxury of this hotel for at least one time in your life! Not cheap, but definitely money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, overrated and smelly”
Reviews.Author: lynamc
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore for 3 nights in February 2008 to see my Brother and Family who live there now. Lacking availability at the Shangri La we stayed in The Ritz Carlton. It's a lovely hotel but I feel that it is more suitable for corporate/business travelers than visitors. We stayed in a smoking room which smelled really terrible. Regardless of the rights/wrongs of smoking there is absolutely no excuse for this in a 5 star hotel. It shows a slack approach which is unwarranted in a hotel of this class. The carpet was also stained and clearly hadn't been cleaned in ages. Aside from this the room was okay with a splendid view over the marina, - especially at night. The bathroom was large and very well appointed with an excellent shower. Oddly we had lovely big thick fluffy towels on the first night which were replaced on subsequent nights by less impressive specimens. We found the staff to be very pleasant and welcoming especially the concierge and door staff. The bar is quite popular in the evenings and we found the restaurants nice, if pricy (as you’d expect). There is some building noise from the construction going on in the Marina (a casino?), but it’s only during the day thankfully. We had a nice if unremarkable stay at the Ritz Carlton Millennium, smell aside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sean_irl
Reviews.Content: Only getting around to writing this review now. We stayed in the Ritz Carlton for 6 days in total over two trips, breaking the journey to and from Oz. Its an outstanding hotel with excellent service, food and a superb location. Booked a deluxe room on the Marina Side...i'd recommend paying the extra bit for the marina side. The view is excellent! Ideal for a break from a long haul flight and suitably located for shopping. Its connected to one of many shopping centres. Would not hesitate in staying there again....not the cheapest, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Despite criticism on tripadvisor - hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Big_Apple
Reviews.Content: One week work-trip stay. Fine location. Train and Raffles mall - lots of restaurants etc just across street. Half the price of the Stamford. Liked the pool, nice to sit around and relax after work. HearldT newspaper every morning at breakfast was good. Breakfast - usual hotel fare - fine. Room - fine. Quiet. Couldn't sleep due to jet-lag but cannot blame hotel. Nice bathroom. Clean. Fittings aging but perfectly acceptable. Suggestions to improve hotel: heat the pool. It's freezing (so is Stamford's, mind you). Provide more coffee/tea/decaf in room (this can only cost cents). Good overall. Business travellers can keep expenses down and holiday-makers note that it's a central location.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable beds ever, for a good nights sleep stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lulublue32
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in and they knew who we were without us telling them we were seriously impressed. The room, on first sight, looked a little basic, but it was a good size and had to be the most comfortable room we had ever stayed in. The bed was out of this world for comfort, i believe it is something to do with the standard use of two matresses in Ritz Carlton Hotels. The bathroom was also special (although i was a little disappointed there was no tv in the bathroom as shown on the website) with an oversized bath set against floor to ceiling windows with a remarkable view over the city. Location was ok, with plenty to do nearby and various types of places to eat in the evening. There are other hotels i would like to try when i next go back to Singapore, but if i end up at this one again i won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGal5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ritz Carlton for 5 nights in total, 4 nights over New Year and then back again for one overnight prior to the connection back to Australia. On this trip we stayed at 3 different hotels in Malaysia and Singapore and had thought that the Ritz Carlton would be the pick of the bunch (the other two were Shangrila properties).
