After reading a number of reviews prior to choosing the hotel I got the impression this was going to be a highlight of the trip. Wrong! Whilst the entranceway to the hotel is very promising and slick effusive welcome set the scene, it proceeds to go downhill from there. Reception area/lounge is tired looking by day when the worn and dirty carpet is more noticeable as is the long gloomy halls to the guestrooms. Had we checked in by night we would have been distracted by the lights of the Singapore skyline, really a superb vista. The room looks quite inviting by night and it is certainly large with a large bathroom which is still very good (and has the much talked about window above the bath) but still way short of 5 star standard. By daylight the view of cranes and construction is not very appealing and the room seems almost dirty but that is because the carpet is stained and worn. I noticed the lamp shades were crooked, chipped wood cabinets, not very nice towels..far removed from what we expected. Everything looked...worn. The driver from the airport had even stated that it was a 6 star hotel so therefore I was convinced that we had been put in some unrenovated room by mistake and even went down to reception to request viewing another. I couldn't believe that they all looked like this, but they did! Whilst the service remained impeccable, the hotel is sorely in need of a refurb . If we hadn't paid in advance we would have relocated immediately and only the thought of paying for two hotels a night disuaded us from doing. Although I did contact my travel agent to continue to explore this option the Ritz Carlton wouldn't consider reducing our stay or refunding any monies. I would go as far as saying the hotel spoiled our enjoyment of Singapore as we hated coming back home at the end of the day and my husband refused to walk around in bare feet on the carpet because if looked and felt so dusty. What has happed to Ritz Carlton chain? I know of at least two hotels in Australia where their establishment used to be top notch and are now way down the rung. I will never take the risk at another one. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kast0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Christmas Eve. The hotel is magnificent and thou it was packed due to the holidays, service were impeccable. We stayed on the Club Level (level 29) with its own concierge and Club lounge where 5 different food presentations are laid out each day. We were just expecting a few nibbles but every food presentation has a great spread. The Club lounge is a quiet oasis, through the day; Moet & Chandon champagne was served throughout. We spent quite a bit of time in the lounge just indulging ourselves with champagne & the great view overlooking Marina bay. Pool was small (and packed with kids) but service staffs were so attentive. Ever so ready to offer towels and water with a smile. Club Room was huge and came with Bvlgari toiletries and every amenity you could imagine. Butler drew a bubble bath for us and it was so romantic soaking in the bath with the great view offered by the huge window in the bathroom. Overall I would say this is one great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Starting To Fade”
Reviews.Author: Tatsumi
Reviews.Content: Despite all the glowing reviews, this is not a hotel in the same class as Claridge's or the Connaught in London, or the Raffles in Singapore (or other Ritz Carltons for that matter). Ground-breaking architecture and stunning bathrooms with windows overlooking the skyline were a real draw when the property opened 10 years ago, but a decade of wear and tear are starting to take their toll. My room on the 24th floor overlooked the harbor with its superb view. However, know that if you stay on this side of the hotel, the 24 hour construction noise from the casino project (still only just finishing the foundations) means a high noise level. The hotel's ventilation system also produces a low-pitched rumbling which can be annoying. Stains on carpets and furniture, peeling wallpaper in a few places, and filthy blinds above the 'bathtub window' are signs of the threads of decay being spun. The rooms are spacious & comfortable, but poor design means that the room doors open directly into the room (no foyer or hall) by the bed. Slamming doors and any noise in the hall can be extremely disruptive. Thoughtful staff and deftly-served room service, but the food is as expensive as London and small in portions (one piece of toast constituted a toast order, and note you pay $5 extra if you want 'premium' maple syrup with your waffles/pancakes instead of sugar syrup). The hotel lacks a cozy bar or place where a solitary traveler can relax; the lounge for drinks/tea is hard by the reception desks, and requests for a light meal there brought baffled stares. The Chinese restaurant is excellent; the other choice being the noisy, large buffet-oriented restaurant, always jammed with Singaporean families. Generous buffet, but $55 is steep. Limited ala carte menu & slow service. I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton many times over the years since it opened, and you can chart its subtle decline by the change in clientele, which now seems to consist mostly of package tourists and conventioneers, as opposed to the top-drawer business people when the property opened. Location will be great when the new circle line underground opens in early 2008, but right now it's a very long hoof to the nearest MRT station, and taxis can be hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but ok room and ok food only.”
Reviews.Author: Gingersnaps
Reviews.Content: My husband & I visit S'pore 2 to 3 times a year because of my family and friends. We've stayed at Four Seasons( Regent before), Pan Pacific, Shangri-la , Marriott and Grand Hyatt(our most frequent choice because of Gold Passport and proximity to Orchard). Service in the Ritz is much above average for S'pore Hotels. Four Seasons would be a close second. The rest actually have rather medicore service if not poor. All the F& B outlets have great service, food is not as good in the coffee house but the Chinese Restaurant is very good. Yet to try the Japanese rest. We did eat at the lunch buffet with friends at the Oscars in the nearby Conrad Hotel which also seemed like they've got good service. Seldom encounter good buffet but they do. Room is large and clean(love the mostly woodern floor concept, so much easier to keep it cleaner which I love, reduces mildew. It does offer good view. Good quality down duvet, it's of an actual breathable quality and and don't just COVER and suffocate u . Good hairdryer. Bed is a bit hard for my liking and pillows are too soft for my liking . Some concierge staff (Edmund and Janice)are very very helpful but some female (Clarissa and 2 others) and one male staff are not particularly helpful, bordering on rude. THis is the only negative feedback I have of this Hotel which is too bad if not would be an excellent experience in my view. The superior service in most areas I've encountered will still make me come back to try but the Conrad and Mandarin Oriental next door also interests my husband and I to try as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BrettnKay-Shanghai
Reviews.Content: High expectations staying, here but I'd say they were met. The service is very professional, the hotel well-maintained, and the rooms have all the amenities. The pool is not too fancy, but just very pleasant, with a great hot and cold jacuzzi. Also great service in the pool area. With my wife and 2 kids, we booked a suite, and it was well worth it. The bathtub overlooked the city lights (see photos), and the main room overlooked the entrance to the Singapore river. Room service was prompt and delicious. One night we booked a sitter, and she was very good, and made us feel safe. Even gave the kids some gifts. It was a quick taxi ride to Orchard Road or Boat Quay, and we walked up to the Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is a cracker”
Reviews.Author: SimonWise
Reviews.Content: Liked the Ritz. Great unbrellas, nice breakfast. Room with proper sheets. Bit pricey so get someone else to pay. Would like to go back as long as I wasn't paying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: georgie_girl1
Reviews.Content: OK, if you've read any other reviews about this hotel, you probably know by now that the bathroom is pretty much the best thing about it. It's true -- it's big, with a glorious view of the city from the massive window by the large bathtub. The bathtub is spiffily designed too, with the taps along the outer edge of the tub so that you don't have to lean in to manipulate them. There are nice little extras like a hairbrush, mouthwash, a loofah and bath salts. The lighting isn't very good though, not being bright enough for the size of the room. And while you may enjoy the view while soaking naked in the tub, be aware that anyone in the nearby office building can easily see you. There's a separate shower, which is always nice, but the shower head, while looking very impressive, is lacklustre in performance. The room itself isn't particularly impressive. I certainly expected better of the Ritz and for the price I paid. The floor is wooden and largely uncarpeted, which means it's not very soundproof or child-friendly either. The bed is higher than normal, which means it also isn't very child-friendly. Housekeeping is disappointingly inefficient, not attending to one's room even when one is gone for several hours. And if you're wondering where the kettle is (and the measly number of complimentary tea bags), look under the TV in the cabinet. Don't expect it to be near the ice bucket, the drinking glasses, or the fridge. Breakfast was disappointing too. The selection was mediocre, as was the quality. Nothing compared to the range at Swissotel The Stamford, which even included salmon. The stuff on offer at the Ritz was average, and much of it was cheap. The staff were very courteous though. In fact, the hotel staff is general were very helpful and polite. Their efforts, however, were not enough to mask the middling, unexceptional quality of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel should be like!”
Reviews.Author: HK79
Reviews.Content: After years of recommendations from friends, I decided to try Ritz Carlton Singapore for a two night stay. While it is expensive (for Singapore), it's an impressive hotel. Excellent accommodation, service, food, and location. Ask for a room that faces city side, and enjoy the massive bath(room) overlooking the city through the massive windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpth
Reviews.Content: Just Great! I went there for a business trip. Every hotel were fully booked due to a convention, so I had to stay at the Ritz I enjoyed it! The service is great, staff call you by your name. The room is very nice, with the bathroom offering a nice view of the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: I'm inclined to agree with Ikura's assessment that this place sets the standard for 5* accomodation. It's not perfect, but it sets the bar pretty high. My room, which I think was one of the hotel's most basic (a relative term, obviously), was the same size as a junior suite at a Fairmont or Oberoi - it was very large. Better still was the bathroom, which, unlike the vast majority of hotels, had a window. And what a window: from my bath, I was able to enjoy a sweeping vista across the city, over the marina and out to sea; perfect after a hard day of slogging round town. And all for a price that wouldn't get you 3 stars in most of the world's major cities. Furthermore, the staff are second to none for charm and efficiency. In this context, the few small niggles seem so minor that I'm almost embarassed to list them. But in the interests of completeness I'll do so anyway: for a hotel that prides itself on its art collection, the expanse of unadorned, beige walls in my room was faintly depressing, and made the room appear unfinished; a squashed fly on the wall of my bathroom when I arrived on Monday was still there when I checked out on Friday; and breakfast - a few third rate pastries and a limited selection dull fruit (mostly from tins) - was a pretty poor effort. I am aware that only North Americans and the British really have any idea how to make breakfast, but most international hotels, wherever they are, manage to cater to international tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doydy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our trip from Bali and I must say this is a great hotel. Everything here is 5 star. The room is excellent with a great view of Singapore. Location was also great and within walking distance to marina square. Will definitely recommend this to anyone who is going to Singapore for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Singapores Finest”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellerDU
Reviews.Content: Our stopover on the way home to Australia was excellent due to the Ritz Carlton. We booked our stopover as part of the Singapore Airlines fare. The hotel is true luxury. Upon checking in we discovered that our room was a double not a twin, this was fixed up in less than 5 minutes and our luggage brought to the correct room. Room service was excellent. Rooms have everything you need and more, no less than 60 things ranging from shoe horns to slippers! Bathrooms have terrific view of Singapore. Staff treat all guests equally and introduce themselves by first name, a nice touch. Location is excellent for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nacho_Bilbao
Reviews.Content: Folowing our holidays trip we came from Bangkok and then to Singapore. Although you will see that the hotel is located just over the harbour, then you will notice that everything is really close in Singapore and you will be in the city centre in just a walking distance. It's just what you expect from a Ritz hotel, really high quality, professionality and nice details to make your experience up to your expectations. We were in a deluxe room in the 20th floor with a view to the harbour. The room is big, xxl king size bed and a really comfortable bathroom with a shower apart and a bath where you can relax viewing the sunset over the harbour. Food was good, but we experienced more out from the hotel. I know that Singapore is one of the most civilised countries in Asia, but believe me if I tell you that in this hotel you will find the asian luxe with our western standards. In conclusion, a bit expensive, but in the end it's a Ritz...

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveller21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for 4 nights and were lucky enough to have Marina Bay view rooms for Singapore's National Day celebrations. It was great to watch the celebrations and fireworks display with one of the best seats in Singapore. The local taxi drivers were very envious as they only get to see it on TV. I was told that tickets themselves are nearly impossible to obtain. The Ritz Carlton is a classy and high quality hotel in every respect. The bedrooms are spacious with very comfortable beds and wonderful bathrooms. The baths are directly next to panoramic windows which offer good views of Singapore. The quality of the view is slightly reduced by the building site that will become Singapore's new casino. The facilities throughout are excellent whether it be the bedroom or the leisure facilities such as the pool or gym. The staff were however even better than the facilities. They were always ready to help and even anticipate your needs. They even noticed when I returned from a trip out and my daughter was not with me ( she was sleeping off some jet lag). It really showed an exceptional level of observation. On another occasion we were running late for a show at the theatre and I asked a man in the shopping mall for directions. He showed us a short cut and even insisted on walking us through the mall and out to the main road. He turned out to be the Ritz Carlton Head of Catering. What more can I say ! If I was to be critical I would say that some of the carpets and fittings in the rooms and througout the hotel are looking a little worn out and that the food ( apart from the excellent breakfast buffet) was good rather than exceptional. Maybe it was catering to western tastes a little too much ! Overall this was an excellent hotel and amongest the best I have stayed in. I would certainly consider staying here again in a city with many excellent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: SFBayTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Millenia for the last night of our trip to Asia. It was everything I would expect from a Ritz. Great location, beautiful room, impeccable service and great food. We were on the 22nd floor and had a great view of the marina. The room was large, with a sitting area and luxurious bathroom. It really does look like the photos you see on their website! Since it's a little pricey, we only splurged one night but it was the perfect ending to our stay. Overall, I definitely feel like it was worth it! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: RobbieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so wonderful - so modern - so clean and the staff were so genuine . SInpagore is a lovely destination and this hotel only made it a majical experience. I have stayed in many other 5 star hotels - but this really made my jaw drop! - From the magic room with an hexagional window with views to the bay and city sky line - marble bathroom - with many little extras - even mouth wash , hairbrush, and bath crystals !! the Gym is unreal - looking onto the pool - and they even follow you around giving you refills of water ! I am known to be a rather high maintenance person - as I am told ! - and I could not fault this hotel - please stay there and experience this for yourself...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent service , Excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayouchka4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for a month and yet cannot get bored of this magnificent place !! Location is perfect , is near every thing.. Biggest shopping malls are just minutes away, walking distance to every single attraction in the city.. As a product , it has the classiest and finest taste, rooms are spacious and view is wonderful. Hotel staff is very welcoming, always smiling and at your service.. in general, The Ritz- Carlton Millenia Singapore is just the place to be, to feel home away from home!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: MarvinHC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different hotels in Singapore but the Ritz Carlton is in a different league alltogether. The rooms are huge, very nicely decorated and well maintained. I had a room with a view on the harbour with the special feature of the bathtub being right to the window with a beautiful view. AMAZING! Also, the breakfast is stunning, a choice I have never experienced anywhere else before or after. Only small downside: I stayed for 2 weeks and turned off the aircondition on the first day, but it took almost a week to get to a temperature which I found ok (I am European, I don't mind it being a bit warmer ;-) )

Reviews.Title: “Singapore in Style...Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Meet-the-Furkids
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd trip to Singapore & The Ritz certainly didn’t disappoint. Arriving at around 3pm in the afternoon, check-in was extremely efficient, despite a busy lobby & reception area. We had a Ritz Carlton Club room with Marina View & the room was just fantastic! Located on the 29th floor (32 is top floor), the panoramic, romantic view of downtown was just amazing. The rooms are very spacious, with wooden flooring & light decor, creating a modern, fresh ambience. The beds are elevated to allow guests to fully appreciate the stunning view from the picture window, & they are very comfortable, with crisp linen Rooms have a sofa/dining area & a well located desk area. Flat Screen TV / DVD player / Clock Radio / In room Safe / Mobile Phone / Kettle are all standard features. Walk in wardrobe is excellent – lots of hanging space & room for 2 large suitcases. Iron & Board provided. Mini Bar is expensive (find me one that isn’t!), but there is ample room to store your own drinks / chocs. The bathroom really is amazing. With separate large shower cubicle & private toilet, it is beyond spacious. Bulgari Amenities provided in Club Rooms. Hairdryer in bathroom - good quality, you can definitely leave your own at home! The bathtub is to die for! A waterfall style tap fills the tub rapidly & once in, I realised how deep the tub really is. The view is again, stunning from the bathroom window, particularly when enjoyed with a glass of champagne! Do note though, that the windows are 2 way, so if one wants privacy, do drop the blind whilst you bathe…I just turned off the bathroom light & soaked up the view! Housekeeping was very good – always came back to find neatly folded clothes & shoes put away! Evening turn down service, provides club room guests with bottled water & snacks. It’s this kind of attention to detail, that help to make a stay memorable. We used room service on one occasion, & the food was served hot, with silver cutlery & fine china as standard. We had one problem with the room during our stay, when the toilet broke – maintenance fixed it within 15 minutes of us ringing up to report it. That is extreme efficiency. The Ritz Carlton Club lounge offers 5 food & beverage presentations each day. Simply put, this means that food & drink is available from 7am til 11pm. Breakfast in the club lounge was very good – Egg chef on hand to prepare fresh, exactly how you wanted. There was also a wide variety of fruits/pastries/hot items. Afternoon tea was delicious, with warm scones & fresh cream. Late night chocolates with cocktails looking out over the marina, was a special experience. The staff in the club lounge were very attentive & greeted all guests personally. The hotel Spa & gym/pool area are very good. We had massages on arrival & the Spa staff were very friendly & hospitable. Spent some time around the pool towards the end of our stay, & it was relaxed & tranquil. We didn’t eat in any of the hotel restaurants, however, the food served in the club lounge was a taster from some of them & I can highly recommend. Fresh, tasty & without fuss. The Ritz is located in the Marina Bay area, close to Suntec City & the Esplanade Theatre. A 10 minute walk through the air conditioned City Link Underground Mall gets you to City Hall MRT station. From here, the whole of Singapore is easily accessible, by efficient, good value public transport. In summary, this is possibly, the best hotel I have ever stayed in so far, whilst on a City break. The staff go above & beyond, to make you feel welcome. The rooms are unquestionably grand, the location is good & I cannot think of anything negative to say about this stay. If you can get a good deal (as I did through Expedia), I can highly recommend the Ritz Carlton Singapore, & would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: 4rubylou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent six nights at the Ritz Carlton and loved the hotel. I had spent ages choosing where to stay and had booked through the hotel website several months in advance. We were given exactly what we had booked - a premier suite on a high floor - non-smoking (we got the 18th floor). The suite was very spacious and the bed the most comfortable I have ever slept in! The bathroom was fantastic and the view from the tub was great - especially at night - looking out to sea with the new Singapore flyer in the foreground. Two tvs, good stereo and excellent amenities. All in all we were extremely happy with our stay and would stay again but maybe spend more time actually in the hotel rather than being out and about all day.

Reviews.Title: “A very very impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgd73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton as part of a Singapore Stopover on our way back from Europe in June. As we were recently engaged, we received a lovely upgrade to a corner suite which was beautiful and the room was extremely spacious and well appointed, as was the bathroom. The view from the windows was also very impressive. One small annoyance was the fact that there was only one towel rail in the bathroom though. The service at this hotel was fantastic, from the concierge, front desk staff, porters and restaurant staff and this hotel certainly lived up to it's reputation as one of Asia's finest hotels in terms of it's service. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast on one day, it's mostly an Asian style buffet (which was very good) with a limited Western offering. We also had the dinner buffet once which was excellent. The price of wine and bottled water is extremely high (especially for wine which I know I can get at restaurants at home for less than half the price and which is not that good to begin with) The hotel is in a good location, within easy walk (underground via Marina Square to stay out of the heat) to City Hall MRT station and also to the restaurants along the riverbank. (Can also recommend doing the Night Safari, it's worth it). Singapore Stopover makes this an excellent hotel to stay at and one that I can highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: doggieluver
Reviews.Content: I cannot rave more about this hotel. The level of service is beyond belief and the bathrooms extremely sexy with a sea view. The rooms are spacious and decorated in a modern, chic way that is quite distinct from other first-class business hotels. The check-in process is done in my room, which is equipped with a fax machine before I walk in. The business center staff is very friendly and responds to customers' requests promptly. The pool is also very nice. I don't always look forward to staying at business hotels, but I always look forward to staying at the Ritz in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel ... but got food poisoning!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Millenia Singapore is a beautiful hotel and the staff is extremely helpful ... the rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are FANTASTIC! You can soak in the tub and have the most amazing views of Singapore while doing it. The workout facility is fantastic as well, the pool is decent. The only problem I've had at the Ritz in Singapore (having stayed there multiple times) ... is that I got food poisoning from the buffet! And so did my coworker on the same trip! I'm not exactly sure which food it was (the doctor said it was uncooked chicken or fish) but it was the worst food poisoning I've ever gotten. After returning to the states and being diagnosed, we called the hotel and they said they hadn't gotten any other complaints but we are 100% sure we got it at the Ritz. The last few days of our trip - we ONLY ate at that restaurant (we were there for work and swamped) - so it was definitely from there. They comped us one meal for our troubles (we were surprised they didn't offer more - but if they hadn't received otehr complaints at that point - maybe they didn't believe us). Regardless of the food poisoning, the hotel really is quite lovely and I've stayed there again since with no problems. I'd just be a little skeptical of the buffet

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, Staff great!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the RC Millenia several times & have always found it special & a great example of the 'classic' Ritz Carlton style. The staff are happy to go to almost any lengths for the guests & seem genuinely friendly. If the staff can capture one of your preferences (from the type of pillow you like to the types of beer you drink) - they will record it & work hard to ensure you get it. The location is great, superb views of the harbour. I'd stay there every time I visit Singapore if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Nice Big Rooms. Very comfortable. Good service, but impersonal. Very Nice Bathroom with Tub and View. Connected to Millenia Mall and Sentosa. Nice Lobby. Great Breakfast Buffet. Good Food. No Free Internet. Rooms and Hotel a bit old, but still comfortable. Lobby Serves Free Cookies. Enjoyable Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: horchesr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Singapore over a weekend for a short family get-away. From the beginning, the service provided by staff at the Ritz was impeccable and above reproach. Everything that you need is attended to promptly upon request and they do their best to make your stay so comfortable that you don't want to leave. The room was lovely - the bathroom was fabulous. The main bathroom, with the bathtub, shower facilities was gorgeous with an unonstructed view of the Singapore skyline. The separated toilet was great because it allows for greater privacy but the space is a little claustrophobic - could use a little bit more space in there! The layout of the room was alright though I think it can be improved but that's a minor individual preference than a glaring flaw that detracts from the experience. The room was nice and spacious which is a definite plus point. However, given that it is the Ritz, I would have expected their bed linens to be more pristine. While I did spot some stains here and there, they weren't too conspicous so that's alright. Swimming pool is a little too small in my opinion, with too little deckchairs given the size of the hotel. Faclitiies like the gym is top notch though a little small. Gym staff are on hand to measure your BMI and stuff like that to advise you on nutritional aspects such as your recommended daily calorie intake. All in all, a good experience and would defintely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: elliemaybelle
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay here for free as it was an incentive trip. The hotel is outstanding,pure luxury. Service is second to none. Had breakfast in the greenhouse restuarant every morning and it was lovely, lots of variety, fresh juices, gorgeous scrambled eggs ! On the first night we had an iron that didn't work and not very hot water in the bath, we phoned down and it was sorted straight away. They honestly cannot do enough for you, would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great to Look At, Not to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JerseySam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Ritz Singapore about half a dozen times, but will try not to do so again. There's no doubt this is one of the most beautiful and elegant hotels in a city full of top-notch lodging. The rooms are well appointed and views from the bathrooms, particularly the bathtubs, are striking. The problem is that service does not keep up with the high-end appeal of the place. The Ritz seems to be chronically understaffed with high turnover and new hires. Any request phoned in from the room takes 15 minutes or more to fulfill. Rooms are not well maintained - in recent stays, one toilet was gurgling like it was ready to blow a lid, the air conditioner in another room vibrated loudly. When I called down about both situations, service was unfailingly polite but extraordinarily slow, which was a problem in the first case especially because I had arrived in Singapore after midnight and wanted to go straight to sleep. Dollar for dollar, there are many better places to stay in Singapore. If you're in need of a prestigious address, or if you are a very relaxed traveler looking for an interesting hotel experience, the Ritz may still be for you. But if you're looking for serious sleep and service that can handle the "unexpected", try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on business. The location is great for people with business in the Suntec City area, and it's close to the usual shopping and restaurants that seem to be everywhere in Singapore. The room was one of the nicest, largest hotel rooms I have EVER seen. Instead of a closet, there is a walk-in closet. The bathroom is HUGE and includes a separate bathtub next to the window with a view of the bay. Nice! Breakfast was AMAZING - the typical international business breakfast, but with feeling - lots of every type of cuisine. The service was excellent, but the front-desk staff was really not very quick. I had to wait a while to check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LAT10258
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and booked a premier club suite (room 1626). Check in was very straight-forward - took place in the club lounge on the 32nd floor. Our room was superb - we had a lovely bedroom with separate lounge, both with wonderful views over the marina bay. The bathroom was huge with the fantastic bath overlooking the new "big wheel" being built. Amenities were excellent, very large shower and a large walk-in wardrobe. Everything was spotless and housekeeping were very good. The club loung was excellent -we had breakfast there every morning. A previous person said this was limited - not the same selection as I am sure you get downstairs but still very good - and included in the price. We both loved the meusli! We also had lunch there once, afternoon tea, and free drinks at the end of the day. There is free internet access and wonderful views over the city. All-in-all the lounge was excellent and we were so glad this was part of the deal we had booked. We ate in the Summer Pavilion restaurant in the hotel one evening and it was very good. All the staff in the hotel and in the club lounge were wonderful, very friendly and helpful. Hotel was great location for shopping malls and very easy to get cabs if wanting to go further. Really loved our visit and will definately stay here again if returning to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: AJ&HTraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: My family had an excellent stay in Singapore. We had stayed at Raffles on the way to Oz but the Ritz on the way back home. The Ritz carlton is a little way from the town but has great views of the harbour. The service and facilities are good and the restaurant food is truly excellant. My only complaint would be the size of the room was not quite as large as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “5 star but they need to pay more attention to little details”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, sisters and father) travelled from Hong Kong to Singapore for the 4-day Chinese New Year holiday. The hotel overall was fine - large room and really nice view of PSA (container port) from the bathtub. I thought they could have paid a little more attention to tiny details, such as the 2 broken lights in our bathroom as well as the broken light bulb in room. Housekeeping came 3 times to fix the lights but if they paid more attention they would have noticed the broken lights. Most 5-star hotels in Asia will provide 2 bottles of complimentary mineral water every day, some will provide 2 bottles every morning and every evening (total 4 bottles a day). We are happy to purchase our own but this hotel gave us 2 very small bottles of complimentary mineral water on Day 1 and that was it! If you're the Ritz Carlton you don't want your guests to remember you as the hotel who was too cheap to give their guests complimentary mineral water (yes, I know the tap water is safe to drink in Singapore). We asked guest services if any hawker centers were open for breakfast and the words that came out of the lady's mouth was, "it's the 2nd day..." It's the 2nd day of WHAT? When you're the Ritz Carlton you may wish to consider thinking about your response from the guest's point of view before responding with just any response. You want to your guests to feel like you understand them and you've gone out of your way to help them. That lady definitely needs more training on how to handle guest inquiries. When we checked out the lady who checked us out spent half the time talking on her mobile telephone with someone else and asked me for my room number twice (although I had given her my room number when I approached the desk). She obviously couldn't multi-task (I wasn't expecting that) but I would have been happy to wait for her the finish her very important telephone call. BTW, the 3 other people manning the check out desk weren't doing anything and I would have been happy to have someone else assist us. Again, that left a bad impression. Finally, when we arrived at the airport we discovered that the taxi we took was the more expensive type, flat rate SGD35 for the ride. As we are not from Singapore the bell captain did not inform us that there were two types of taxis (regular vs luxury). I only discovered the difference when I interrogated the taxi driver about the price (I recall spending less money for the taxi ride to the airport on a business trip 2 weeks ago!). I will stay at the Ritz Carlton Singapore again but I hope they'll pay more attention to the little details next time.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: amysa
Reviews.Content: We read the online reviews before staying at this hotel. Given the superlative reviews on tripadvisor, we had high expectations upon arrival at the hotel. We were not disappointed! Check in was a breeze, concierge was extremely attentive, room was magnificent, bed comfortable, room larger than usual singapore hotel rooms, bathroom spacious, walk in closet huge, and of course, the view from the bath tub was breathtaking! Amenities were standard/generic. We will definitely be back, and we recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: curlywee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Singapore for 3 nights from 11 Dec 06 as a stop over on our way to Australia and 1 night on the return journey. What a fantastic hotel. The service was immaculate and the bellhops coudn't do enough for you. Everyone was so smiley and friendly. Even the taxi drivers were very informative and friendly. Our breakfast was included and what a breakfast it was! The choice was superb - it really set you up for the day. (Especially the shopping on Orchard Road!) Our room was fantastic with fabulous views from the enormous windows. It is true, you can lie in the bath and look out of the window!! The shower was enormous and everywhere was immaculately clean. I've never seen a bed as big AND comfortable. My son, who is 16 could have gotten in with my husband and I !! but he said he'd prefer to sleep on the rollaway bed that was provided for him. Altogether a fantastic choice. It wasn't cheap but well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: two trees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Ritz-Carlton on 19th and 20th January. We had booked a Club Corner Suite via the hotel website, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience from the moment we were picked up at Changi from our flight from London, to our reluctant departure. The welcome, the suite and the Club Lounge were all excellent, as were the food and refreshments on offer. We loved the signature bathroom with its views from the tub and were surprised to find that the writing desk was equipped with scissors, sticky tape, paper clips and other goodies in addition to the usual stationery and a pen if you're lucky! The staff were exceedingly polite and helpful and succeeded in anticipating most of our wishes. Nobody is allowed to appear to be lost in the Ritz-Carlton without being approached with offers of assistance. All in all, a splendid hotel which we shall revisit and enjoy more of its facilities next time we pass through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: Traminer
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay immensely. Harbour view rooms were recently renovated with lots of space and discreetly furnished. Non-suite rooms come with the house (ie non-Bvlgari) tolietaries. Gym/pool facilities were clean. The service is truely exemplary. Being a jaded Singaporean, I was surprised by how we are capable of being hospitable without overbearing. The staff, from front desk, lobby, health club to the Greenhouse and even the security guard at the Marina Square entrance, were polite and professional with a smile. Somehow they found out it was my birthday and I was pleasantly shocked by a bottle of Moet in the room upon check-in. Perfect for that bath with the view!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt Wow Me Away”
Reviews.Author: Sept_Rain
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 night stay with the Ritz Carlton Singapore to celebrate our 6th anniversary. Wanting a surprise for my hubby, I also submitted an online request for a complimentary cake. A couple of hours later, much to my delight, a Ritz Carlton personnel called me back to confirm my request and promised a cake will be presented upon my check-in. On the day itself, the check-in process was a pleasant and speedy, without much hassle. Most of my requests were met – a high floor room, king sized bed, non-smoking room and an early check in. The room was okay but I wasn’t overwhelmed or overly excited about the room. Furthermore, there was a smell in the room – it smelled like fresh paint. I guess that management might have just refurnished or re-paint the room. However, I feel that the management should be sensitive enough not to use such rooms coz the smell can be real unpleasant. The swimming pool was nice and the service was ok. We often noticed the staff changing the towels on the chairs to maintain the hygienic level in the pool. But the most disappointing part was the cake - I wonder how did the message convey to the kitchen – somehow or rather, the wedding anniversary cake turned out to be a birthday cake with a Happy Birthday logo. I checked repeatedly with the reception and they failed to give me a satisfactory answer. I also provided feedback to the management, but till date there was no reply from them yet. Overall, the stay was okay but not the “Wow” kind.

Reviews.Title: “Pure perfection - so hard to fault the Ritz-Carlton...”
Reviews.Author: neilmadhvani
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights in December. I've stayed in a number of hotels around Europe and Asia, and this was by far the best. The Ritz-Carlton is certainly grand inside and has lovely comfortable rooms which are incredibly spacious and equipped with excellent facilities. However the best thing about this hotel is the service which is absolutely outstanding in every regard. Check-in was a breeze, and I was even offered a soft drink whilst they were allocating my room. The attention to detail is spectacular, combined with a genuinely warm and friendly attitude. This applies to every one of the staff I met at the hotel. The receptionist kindly walked me to the lift and provided a lot of useful information. It is immediately evident that the staff are so well trained and are always on the lookout for opportunities to help guests. Even if someone cannot help directly, they will ensure that your problem or request is dealt with as quickly as possible. The breakfast buffet is fairly costly at around SGD 44 including taxes if you compare it to the cost of meals outside of the hotel. However it's actually fairly reasonable compared to other 4* and 5* hotels in the vicinity. The Ritz-Carlton is only a few dollars pricier than other hotels but the quality and variety in the buffet is outstanding. Combined with superb service, I highly recommend having breakfast at the hotel. At the end of one of my breakfasts I completed a comments card that I was given. I was pleasantly surprised to find that a member of staff came over to thank me for my time and was interested in what I had written. I had suggested that the hotel might want to add a few more vegetarian options, such as Roti Prata. She let me know that they did in fact serve this as an a la carte option. I said I'd be returning the following morning to try this, and I was amazed to find that when I arrived, the same lady greeted me and remembered our conversation the day before. I had a wonderful breakfast - Roti Prata served with Tek Tarik - the latter isn't even on the menu but she arranged for the chef to prepare it specially. The health club facilities are also superb - a fully equipped gym, swimming pool and jacuzzi. When I went to the gym on the second occasion the staff even remembered my name - now that's impressive! Going back to the rooms - widescreen flat-panel TV, enormous king-size bed (one of the most comfortable I have ever come across), elegant furnishings and a good sized desk really make the accommodation here stand out from other hotels. The bathroom is incredible too - an ultra-powerful shower, and a bathtub with an amazing view. Everything is just so well thought out and appropriately positioned to make one's stay as comfortable as possible. I only have a couple of minor suggestions for improvement. The wireless internet access is extremely costly. It would be great if the hotel could provide free wireless internet access at least in the lobby areas. In addition, the rooms could do with a master light switch. Can't wait to return to Singapore and to the Ritz-Carlton Millenia again - a delightful hotel that really makes its guests feel special. Congratulations to the Ritz-Carlton and all the staff - I'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlc222
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Singapore in the last few years and we did wonder whether we should try the Fullerton this time. However, we decided to go back to the Ritz Carlton having had a wonderful stay there last time. We were not disappointed. We were met at the airport and quickly whisked away along the east coast parkway to the hotel. On arrival at the hotel we were taken straight up to the Club lounge as we had booked a club room. Unfortunately, the club manager informed us that our room wasnt available immediately. He asked if we would object to being upgraded to a one bedroomed suite instead. That didnt take much thought! The suite was enormous and overlooked Marina Bay. A fascinating view by day with all the activity but by night it is even more impressive with views over the bay, the Fullerton, the financial district and along the Singapore river to Boat Quay. The club lounge had been extended since our last visit. There are still 5 food and beverage presentations per day. So basically, should you wish , you can eat all your meals here.( Meals are buffet type though). A very nice addition is the Martini bar which overlooks the city of Singapore. Here, May makes absolutely wonderful martinis, several of which we sampled. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to City Hall MRT which links you with the rest of the island. You can walk to it via shopping malls and links so rarely have to go outside in the sticky heat. Taxis are also plentiful outside the hotel. We only used them once and I think we chose badly. The taxi driver was very disgruntled when we asked to go to the Stamford hotel, about 5 mins away and grumbled all the way there. The staff are very friendly, especially in the club lounge. Nothing is too much trouble. Only one little quibble was our room didnt get turned down one evening, our cleaned the next morning, as we were still in bed at 8.15am, we had to ring housekeeping to let them know as the maid didnt return later either. Im sure this was just a one off as it has never happened to us there before. Unfortunately, I cant comment on the retaurants as we either nibbled in the club lounge or ate in the city, but their write ups in the city guides were very good. We loved it there and will definitely be going back for a third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: CorporateNomad
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at this hotel many, many times, from the week after opening, until my most recent stay last month. I feel I am therefore in a position to say that the service has gone down a notch or two. The service at the front desk is not as effortless or as friendly as it used to be. During the first two years of operation I felt that the Ritz-Carlton was the best hotel in Singapore hands down. However now, whether it's due to cost cutting or otherwise, the staff is not up to their own previously set standards. The reception staff is often distracted, juggling several tasks at once. On two seperate check in occasions the staff was brisk in replies to the point of being discourteous. In the past I sent my clients, family and friends to this hotel. The emergence of several excellent boutique hotels and serviced apartments in Singapore make the Ritz Carlton a less attractive proposition. If a premium price is to be charged, the serivce had better be up to the level. It isn't. As a result I cannot recommend this hotel as a first choice. If I pay a premium I want premium service, it's as simple as that. The interior upholstery fabrics, carpets, and lighting scheme could use a refresh as well; they're looking tired. The Ritz-Carlton is still better than average; it's just not as good as it used to be. On a plus point, the bathrooms are still the most romantic and breathtaking in Singapore. And the sashimi served in the small Japanese restaurant is amongst the top three in South East Asia. The hotel still deserves an above average rating but in terms of value for money it is distinctly average.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Abstraction
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was quiet, comfortable - perfect temperature - and had a great view. The breakfast was fantastic. This is truly one of the best city hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but watch out for the fees”
Reviews.Author: matchtrader
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are large and clean, service is excellent, bathrooms are fantastic, beds comfortable and in-room electronics (television, dvd player, internet access, etc.) were very good. The grounds were absolutely gorgeous and the pool was beautiful. I would not say that this would be a great place to stay with kids, but for a business trip or romantic getaway, it really is a great place. The place is a bit out of the way and you pretty much have to take a cab to anyplace you go (Orchard Ave, Little India, Chinatown, the Quays, the business district, etc.), but cabs are readily available and quite cheap in Singapore. What really turned me off was upon check-out when we received our bill that included an additional SGD$36 per day for a facilities charge. This is not a huge amount for a hotel of this class, but the fact that we were not told about it when booking or when checking in was quite frustrating. Other things were quite expensive at the hotel as well, including over SGD$40 for breakfast buffet (which as far as I could tell was the only option for breakfast and since the place was too far from anything convenient, was about the only quick option) and almost SGF$20 for a cocktail. All in all, it's a very nice place so long as you are prepared for the costs over and above the room rate (which really aren't too bad for a hotel of this nature in a city of this size).

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Glindaba
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous start at the Rasa Sentosa, we moved to the Marina Mandarin (superb) and then to the Ritz Carlton for our final four nights in Singapore. Our stay in a suite included access to the club lounge and the experience was so good that we hardly saw the city! Traditional furnishings and fantastic views with a particularly stunning view from the bath! The staff in the lounge could not be faulted and the five, yes five daily food presentations nothing short of fantastic. Great pool area and fitness centre too. A faultless stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on the club level. The staff here were awesome! After the first meeting they knew your name. Very warm and inviting. The public areas of the hotel are very sleek and borderline stark. Elevators were quick. Payphones are on the level with the meeting rooms. Pool looked nice but it was very smokey due to the fires so I did not linger outside anymore then I had too. Club: nice selection of breakfast and lunch items. Very helpful. request for a later check out was accomodated. Very comfortable. 2 computers available for you to use. Nice selection of evening drinks. Room: Great sized. Great Bathroom. No name amenities are being replaced with Bvlgari. Nice robes. Great views. bed was comfortable. Plenty of hangers. Good desk with small office supplies in the drawer. Asked for a transformer that was delivered straight away. Paper delivered each morning. Slippers and shoe shine sponge in the closet along with a small safe, shopping bag, and umbrella. Maid left a key in the slot for me so I did not have to put mine in everytime I came back to get the power working. Not so good: Internet. Could not get the wireless to work. The broadband did work at S$30.00 a day. Only 1 packet of instant regular coffee per day for the kettle plus 1 pack of decaf and some tea. You need to walk through 3 malls to get to the MRT. There is some constuction noise from the MRT station being built across the street. There is a complementary shuttle from the mall next door to Tangs that leaves around :45 after the hour. Taxi's are reasonable. The hotel is a little removed but it is a quick trip to just about anything. Buffet Breakfast had a good selection. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: Tresadla
Reviews.Content: I used to send people to this hotel all the time when I worked for a bank, they all would love it, last week I finally got to stay there myself I was very excited. I have to say I wasn't as impressed as all the other reviewers, for me this was a huge come-down. Firstly as you come into the hotel the immediate view is one of a staircase going down into the basement, certainly no wow factor, as you look to the left a huge open plan (not romantic at all) restaurant that would seat around 100 people, go to the right and there is a large open lounge area (that I later realised is the bar too, go figure??) this also doubles as the reception, which was weird I thought, having people trundling though with luggage and bags whilst people are sitting around in their finery. I didn't like it at all. Room was a nice size, bed lovely, and bathroom amazing with THOSE windows but the decor is all a bit bland and because of this you see lots of scuff marks everywhere, carpets are bland and dirty too. All in all, I think this place needs to have a serious designer in to revamp the entire hotel, especially the bar/lounge/reception area, that was the biggest disappointment. No one in their right mind wants to wander into a noisy bar area after a long haul flight that is filled with people looking their best.

Reviews.Title: “Can it be too good?”
Reviews.Author: Jusco
Reviews.Content: I don't truly believe you could be disappointed in The Ritz, and this is also true for Singapore. What I loved the most was the massive bathroom that had huge windows that overlooked the most amazing view of the city. I wasn't that keen in the lcoation though, only one over priced rather boring department store nearby. The problem with The Ritz's are you are in the most amazing cities and you have paid a good chunk of money to justify staying in your room and never going out. In which case you are better off just paying to stay in one in your nearest city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Content: Really a lovely and comfortable stay. The window by the bathtub really offers a magnificent view of Clarke Quay and the Fullerton Hotel. And the driveway up to the hotel is just enchanting. Room service menu is surprisingly yummy and prompt. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: lkaran1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Millenia for 5 days in Sep 06. Their staff were super friendly - and made all the arrangements we asked for. The location is perfect for evening walks by the river, with all the restaurants nearby. The bathroom was the highlight of the accomodations - we had the river view which was spectacular. Will definitely recommend this place to anyone! One downside: the room service breakfast options are limited, you are better off walking to a cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: MKPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply one of the best! Great service, lovely rooms, views spectacular (even the City view), very pleasant and accommodating front desk. All that a hotel should be, and more!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GU1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as the final stop of our 2 week honeymoon in Malaysia. I spent a long time researching hotels as there were so many but I wanted our stay to be perfect as it was our honeymoon and something we would always remember. We chose right - the hotel was amzaing - really buzzy yet friendly. We did not eat in the hotel at all as we felt we wanted to be out in Singapore more but we did have breakfast in our oom one morning which was amazing. The room was better than I expected - I had chose it for the views (from the bathroom!) and it was ideal. Not the most contemporary hotel but very elegant and comfortable. Good location - again some could have bettered this being more central but we really enjoyed walking through the malls into the centre. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All we expected - and more!”
Reviews.Author: BecSte
Reviews.Content: We expected from the information in the holiday brochures and online that the Ritz Carlton Millenia would be excellent and it certainly was. It exceeded our expectations and we could not fault it. We were told that the hotel has 5 stars plus one diamond, ranking it amongst Singapore's best. The rooms were superb with fantastically comfortable beds, and pillows and duvets we wanted to bring home! The staff were attentive without being over the top; nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We happened to be there for the Independence celebrations (9th-13th August 2006) and the marina views we had from our rooms meant we were in the perfect spot for an uninterupted view of the most fabulous fireworks. Without a doubt we would love to return to this hotel again. Singapore is a fantastic city and the Ritz-Carlton a fantastic place in which to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed and bath!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_Jamie
Reviews.Content: Second time stay at this hotel. Wonderful! This time round, we stayed at a Club level room and hence has accessed to the club lounge. The view is fantastic (high floor). The bed is soft and heavenly. Bath with a view is to die for! Overall, a very enjoyable stay. The only complaint is that the food served at the club lounge is so-so (I've tasted better and wider food selections at other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Super customer service”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCat
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have just come back from a trip to Asia where we also stayed at the Ritz Carlton. The hotel was exactly what we had expected and fully lived up to its name. The most exceptional points were the customer staff the person that met us Ms. Lynett, professional, kind and extreamly helpful. We really apprected the beautiful though of the Chocolate cake sent to our room courtesy of the hotel for our anniversary. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Personal Service...But too many rooms and too crowded”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: This may be the biggest Ritz Carlton in the world (definitely the largest I have ever stayed in with more than 600 rooms) and the sheer volume of traffic in and through the hotel takes away from the experience. Waiting for elevators, club lounge overflowing, and an abundence of young children (okay, sorry if I am not tolerent of 2 year olds on the club floor...) take away from the atmosphere of a typical Ritz property. The rooms are huge and comfortable (but furniture and fabrics need updating in the bedrooms and in main floor cafe). The Staff here is remarkable. Keeping up with 1000 staying guests is not easy. Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE is pleasant, friendly, knowledgable, and sharp/well educated. This is a well trained team and they seem to genuinely enjoy their vocation. The conceirge made numerous reservations for us and he was SPOT ON with excellent recommendations. In short, too big (can't change that...) perfect staff, and slightly outdated furnishings best describe this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Laroush
Reviews.Content: Every single experience we had at the Ritz was great. Stayed there with my husband and 2 kids (6 and 9) for last 4 days of July. Service was amazing- friendly, curtious and attentive- how can everyone know our name in such a big hotel? Rooms were spacious and very well appointed, the bathrooms were very impressive with the famous window over the tub! Cleanliness and housekeeping in general was top notch. Pool, spa and gym were excellent (pool is partially in the shade so you don't always get a chaise in the sun). Room service was good and fast- even provided us with table, linens and cutlery when we told them we had hawker food take out in our room! Breakfast was one of the best buffets i have ever seen with not just a huge selection but the very best quality- dim sum was great. Staff there were attentive and great with the kids. I like that it is a bit removed from the hustle and bustle of Orchard but only minutes away by cheap and always available cabs. Shopping and restaurants connected to hotel via walkway to Marina Square. I would not think of staying anywhere else in Singapore- even my 6-year old said" I'm gonna miss the Ritz"!

Reviews.Title: “Best quality in Singapore, but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SilvanR.
Reviews.Content: We ' ve stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 nights. Actually we wanted to stay at the Raffles the Plaza for 5 nights, but this hotel was so dreadful and too expensive for value! So we had a look at all the other good hotels (Four Seasons, Hyatt, Oriental, Raffles..) but we decided to stay at the Ritz Carlton. Rooms were quite spacious, the hotel was clean and the stuff was much more friendly than elsewhere. The pool is probably the most romantic in town. Of course the hotel is not very charming, but you won't find a better one. All in all I was a bit disappionted of the hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The standard”
Reviews.Author: Palesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend -it was our wedding weekend. We stayed in the presidential suite on the 2nd to top floor... the ones you need a special key to get up to. The suite was divine. The service second to none. The only downer was the breakfast buffet in the club room which was quite uninspired. The views from the suite was lovely. We had a special dinner for 6 catered to our room and it was very, very good. For me, it will take a lot for a hotel to replicate or exceed this service.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel, but fading in elegance!”
Reviews.Author: MRIII
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Singapore in late June and decided to test all the top luxury hotels. We stayed at Raffles the Plaza, The Ritz-Carlton, The Four Seasons and the Shangri-La. Our second stop was the Ritz-Carlton Millenia - A luxury hotel but with fading elegance. ROOM We reserved the Deluxe Room with the Panoramic Marina Bay view. The room itself was very spacious and luxuriously appointed. There was a large LCD TV, a writing desk with Internet access, a sitting area with a huge Marina view window, and a walk-in closet. The room was very bright and cheerful, but the yellow paint and the octagonal windows looked a bit too silly! The bed was very comfortable and the hospital-white bed sheets were acceptable. The room was clean, but it looked old and somewhat shabby in my opinion. BATHROOM The bathroom was luxurious, but again it was very "old" luxury - The brown marble etc, was stained in places with age. The toilet was in a separate room connecting to the bathroom. There was a separate shower cubicle and the famous view baths offering beautiful views of the Singapore Marina. The no-name Ritz-Carlton branded amenities were disappointing of a hotel of this calibre. But I did read in their hotel magazine that they'll be switching to Bvlgari Amenities in the near future. HOTEL FACILITIES/RESTAURANTS The hotel offered a fitness centre/Spa and a pool, but we didn't use these facilities. There were numerous restaurants to choose from, but we only had afternoon tea the Chihuly Lounge - The tea and the cozy atmosphere were enjoyable. However, the lounge which is opposite the lobby is also looking it's age. There were some stains on the carpets and there was an overall slightly worn look to the whole lobby/lounge area. SERVICE There were no service-related problems. The staff were are very friendly and courteous. The only complain I have is that the Ritz Carlton group doesn't offer any affinity/frequent guest/frequent flyer programs even though it's owned by the Marriot Group. Furthermore, their tendency to use internationally unrecognised geographic names (i.e. "Arabian" Gulf as opposed to the correct "Persian Gulf") in their brochures can be insulting/politically insensitive to certain guests. SURROUNDINGS The hotel itself is a bit out of the way from the city centre (but an easy taxi ride away). For entertainment and shopping, there is direct access to the Marina Shopping Complex. You can also walk and explore the area's numerous other shopping areas. CONCLUSION This is a great hotel, but it's definitely showing it's age. Perhaps with a renovation, it'll live up to it's former glory.

Reviews.Title: “In a word - class”
Reviews.Author: JoeandSandra
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 night stopover with Singapore Airways on returning home from visiting family in Sydney. We felt the hotel was superb with excellent quality accomodation and genuine service from all the staff particularly Sirine, Nicole and Wilbur in the Chihuly lounge who also asked the resident band to play a song for us on our last evening. Their service with a smile is something we will miss now that we are back in UK where it just doesnt exist. We had dinner in hotel on one occasion and thought the standard was very good again the staff could not be more helpful. We would certainly consider returning to this hotel, it is in a good location and the attentiveness of the staff made it a very memorable,if brief, stay. I will conclude by thanking Chihuly Lounge manager Zulkiflee Januar and his excellent staff once again. Not forgetting the band especially for their rendition of Hotel California, the piano solo at the end was excellent. There are many good photos of this hotel already on this forum so I have added only 1 night view 1 of the lounge and 3 of us with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of my wife's trip...”
Reviews.Author: deemery
Reviews.Content: So I earn this big Round-the-world promotion, and we go to Samoa, NZ (North & South Island), Melbourne, Singapore, Cairo and Vienna. What does my wife tell her friends about? The bathroom at the Singapore Ritz! I spent a whole bunch of Marriott reward points for a couple nights here, and it was definitely worth it. The hotel is in a good location, is every bit as spectacular as you'd expect, and the bathroom was pretty nice, even if I say so myself :-) (All marble, big sunken tub with a spectacular view over the Singapore harbor, remote control shades, huge separate shower, dual sinks, etc, etc, etc.) The evening buffet was also quite good, not cheap but a reasonable value for the quality of the food. The only glitch was they were having some computer problems as we checked out, so I had to spend a bit extra time to check out to make sure they didn't charge me for the room. The critter in my photo is DustPuppy, see [--] for an explanation... If lI can earn enough Marriott points to afford it, we'd definitely go back there. dave

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Navigator10
Reviews.Content: Last March I visited Singapore after checking this web site's reviews. Stayed two nights here and two nights at the Shangri-La. I never spend more than two nights at a hotel if I can help it. I am sort of a hotel buff. I arrived at the Singapore airport, took the subway (be aware that you have to switch trains at the second stop to get to downtown) to the City Hall stop. At the City Hall area I got my compass out and since it was a beautiful evening I decied to walk to the hotel along the bay tugging my carry-on behind me. The walk was about a half a mile. Longer than I hoped but the sidewalks in Singapore are very good. At the hotel, I was relieved of my luggage an pointed to the reception desk. I was promptly checked in and was given a room on the 22 floor with a bay view as requested. This hotel was built in 1997 and a big deal was made about the bathroom, which has a large octangular window over the tub. Wow! Here I was in this large bath with a specatular view of the skyline of Singapore over a bay. I don't usually use the tub, but this evening was special. Took a bath after dinner. Unfortunatly the tub had a faulty drain and I could not drain it. It was fixed the next day as I was out. For dinner I walked over to the adjacent regional shopping mall (recently renovated) and found a fast food place to my take-out. This mall is open until 10:30 PM. Note that much of Singapore isn't open until 11 AM. (Do not bother visiting Chinatown in the morning). This 608 room hotel is large in scale. The room is big, the bath tub is big, the separate shower is big and the bed is big. A tall person would love this place. As usual with luxury hotels, the hotel room was quiet and well equipped. I did find that the pillows flattened out during the night. Westin's hotel " heavenly bed" was not beat by this hotel. I expected the hotel to be too expensive for breakfast so I walked over to the adjacent mall for my modest requirements. The next evening I checked on the pool. It was a bit sterile but once you got there, it is rather private. No major grounds like at the Shangri -La. I wanted to visit the famous Singapore Zoo. The consierge was helpful. Gave me an accurate estimate of the cab fare. You can't ask for more than that. Singapore is a difficult for a non-local to get around in as there isn't much of a grid system to the streets. My compass came in handy. Stay at this hotel if your business is done in the eastern portion of the metro area.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janalibor
Reviews.Content: I have just had a stop over night at this hotel and it is very good. I was met at the door were about 12 members of staff waited to great and welcome visitors was shown to reception were a very efficient member of staff booked me in and gave me instructions on how to get to my room. The room was large with wonderful bathroom everything was spotless and very well presented. I was offered a late check out 3pm) as I was on a late plane onwards and spent a couple of hours by the pool where a lovely member of staff made extra sure that i wanted for nothing. It is probably not the easiest place to wait for your transport back to the airport so you might want to consider a meal or a drink in the bar. It is in a good location if you want to explore a little and has extensive shopping nearby A great experience, would love to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bugs1012
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ritz Carlton was excellent. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi our luggage was whisked away and Lynette, an extremely helpful lady from guest services, took us to the front desk and then up to our room. At no point did anyone hover around waiting for a tip - in fact they ran away! The room overlooked the marina and had a really lovely feeling - cant quite explain why. The bathroom was enormous and had an excellent shower as well as a deep bath that overlooked the marina from a huge picture window (note - important to close the blinds at night otherwise you're putting on a show for the hotel next door....). Every interaction with the staff was fantastic - everyone going further than necessary to ensure our stay was perfect. Two great examples - We arrived back at the hotel one night and the taxi couldnt break our 50 dollar bill, so the doorman just paid him while another doorman went into the hotel and split the 50 into 5x10. All before we could even think about it. And we asked the concierge directions to the nearest mall and he didnt just point us there, he literally walked with us for 3 minutes til we could see the building. I really cant recommend this hotel enough. would give it 6 out of 5 if i could.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tess01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and children at the beginning of February 2006. Though we arrived at 8am, the staff endeavoured to find us a room to rest in while our own rooms were readied. We were disappointed that a connecting room for our children could not be arranged (though we had requested it upon booking), but the staff did put us in adjacent rooms. The rooms large and well appointed, and while the view was just of the city and roads from our side of the hotel, it was still quite amazing, especially at night. A nice touch was when the staff made sure we were aware of the fireworks at the marina for Chinese New Year. Door staff were friendly and welcoming. The pool was very nice, and the staff at the pool and gym were so very helpful. One staff member went out of his way to find toys for my children to play with in the pool and kept a concerned eye on them, and another spent ages blow-drying my 8 year old daughter's hair. The baggage staff were kind enough to look after and load/unload 16 articles of luggage for the day after we checked out. Overall, despite many good points, I was left with a cold feeling that I can not pinpoint, perhaps due to its' size. But it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz-Carlton - Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jaybee99
Reviews.Content: I can't add much to the raves above, but this hotel is the epitome of elegance...the decor, the service, the ambience, the prevailing attitude of the staff are models of excellence. It is a true oasis in the lovely, bustling city of Singapore. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Top class, superb experience”
Reviews.Author: Capph
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve at the Ritz Carlton on a stopover. It was by far the best place to be in Singapore, our room looked over Marina Bay and the view from our room and the bathtub windows of the fireworks was stunning. Impeccable 6 star service, delicious food, great room service. Friendly, efficient and unintrusive staff. We had to check out at 6.30am in order to get a flight and were told that we could order the included breakfast through room service. This turned out to be an error - however there was no issue when it came to payment, any extra charges for delivery were wiped. Perfect experience and will only ever stay there when we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A tired, worn hotel with bad service”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a single night at the Ritz-Carlton Millenia Hotel and the experience was not a good one. There were two people checking us into the room together at the front desk and they spent more time giggling between themselves than paying much attention to their guests. The room itself looked shockingly worn and frayed for a supposed top tier hotel, including stained carpeting, peeling wallpaper and a frumpy, lumpy couch. Since we had a very early morning flight, we requested a wake-up call for 4:00 a.m. Not only did the wake-up call never come but when I called down to point out this serious oversight, I was rudely informed that "it is only 4:20" now. There was never any attempt to apologize for an error which could have resulted in us missing an international flight. This hotel is an embarrassment to the Ritz chain. Granted, the bathrooms are very nice and the art collection around the hotel is first-rate. But this does not make for a first class hotel. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thmbs Up for the Service”
Reviews.Author: rome1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Millenia Singpore for 4 nights on business. Probably the best Ritz I've stayed at service wise. I arrived at around 5 am and they did their best to get me fed and accomodated until the room was ready at 7 am. Valet left the hotel and went into town to get me a phone card so I could make some calls, and then was embarressed when I tipped him. I should also point out that the restaurant (buffet) was fantastic and the rooms were very cool-- light hardwood floor, tiger eye marble-- Very contemporary, yet Asian feel. Also, the hotel seems to be a hot spot for the local well heeled, so at night it gets very busy in the lounge and has quite a buzz, which to me was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tui65
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Ritz Carlton in a corner executive suite, and it was fantastic. The views over the bay were magnificent and you could stand in the shower and look out both the bathroom and lounge windows at the same time. The room was extremely spacious, and with the high ceilings made it seem even bigger. The bed was extremely comfortable and had marvellous pillows - always a plus. The bathroom was fantastic, wonderfully appointed with all sorts of things - soaps, bubble bath and bath oil, shower gel, shampoo etc and the towels and robes were nice and fluffy. We ate quite a bit in their restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. You have the choice of a buffet at every meal, which looked great or like us you could order off the menu. I was very impressed - the food was hot, tasty and fresh - what more could you ask for. They had quite a well set up gym overlooking the pool and in the early morning when you can't sleep, it's great to go down and have a workout. I didn't use the pool but it did look very inviting. The staff were excellent! Always said hello and eager to help. I've stayed in a number of 5 star hotels and while not quite having the understated quiet elegance of the Singapore Four Seasons, I would definitely stay there again.
